name: 34th Street
description: Hi there, I'm Laura, welcome to 34th Street. Our small family run business loves to turn the ordinary into the magical with charming and creative products for children and their families. I started the business in 2012, whilst working as a puppet maker in animation, with positive products made by our lovely four-person team. The idea of making a family like yours smile, helping you to spend more time together, and bringing joy to your everyday, is exactly what we love!

name: A Vintage Garden
description: I'm Jane the founder of A Vintage Garden. I’m very proud to be in my late 60s and still working! Each piece I create is unique. I may make many swallows, but no two are the same so when you buy a sculpture from me, you’re getting something that nobody else in the world has! Each sculpture starts with a single strand of wire to sketch the outline and is then interlaced by hand to create the three dimensional details. Sometimes my work is abstract, but always recognisable.

name: AARVEN
description: Meaning 'friend of the people', AARVEN is an ethical homeware and jewellery brand founded by two adventurers, inspired by our artisans around the globe. From wood block printed textiles, recycled brass jewellery, to hand woven baskets, we design our joyful collections in collaboration with the worlds best artisans.

name: Abel Burners Ltd
description: We’re here for handmade, slow living, and rituals that elevate your everyday. We believe in taking time for yourself. We believe that the way you live directly impacts not just your health, but your mental health too. Building good habits like taking half an hour for yourself, to unwind, relax and destress from the day is vitally important. We have designed products that aid this ethos not just with how they work, but how they look too. Everything we do is still handmade, hand poured and small batch with very close attention to detail. We design ethically sourced, vegan and cruelty free products to improve your space, self care and way of living. We believe in operating in an eco-friendly way, doing everything we can to reduce our footprint.

name: Acacia Creative Studio
description: Our founders met in the floral markets of Kunming, China. Now, working internationally on events and installations, they love to take time to design for you in their studio!

name: Adam Bridgland
description: I am a graduate of the Royal College of Art in London. Since 2013 I have lived and worked as an artist and printmaker from my studio 'The Hide' in the small village of Lode on the outskirts of Cambridge.

name: Adams & Mack
description: We’re Adams & Mack, creators of enduring brass door knockers designed to celebrate nature. We have a passion for creating sustainable products that are as beautiful as they are functional. Each door knocker is individually handmade using traditional techniques. Our craftsmen come from a family whose expertise and skills have been passed down through generations. Our products are designed and patinated to order in our workshop in Devon.

name: Adventures in Print
description: From my cosy home studio nestled in the Norfolk countryside, I combine time-honoured printmaking traditions with fresh, contemporary colours to create botanical treasures that celebrate the quiet magic of British seasons. Rather than creating garden scenes or floral arrangements, I practice what's known as botanical portraiture – the intimate study of singular flowers and leaves. Like Georgia O'Keeffe's revolutionary approach to florals, I treat each bloom as a portrait subject, studying how flowers emerge from their stems, how leaves unfurl, how buds form part of the plant's complete story. This focused approach allows me to truly know my subjects. Working primarily at A6 and A5 scale, I can capture the essential character of Britain's everyday flowers – the humble daisy, resilient poppy, striking thistle – those often-overlooked blooms that have been my constant companions since childhood in the Scottish countryside.

name: Agnes & Aubrey
description: We're Mary Agnes Richards and David Aubrey Schweitzer - a.k.a. Agnes & Aubrey! We make books and write music from our SE London studio. We created ourTake Meseries of guided journals with a mission to encourage children to engage with the world around them and to make books that are fun, interactive and full of adventure. We're super proud that the series has won three Junior Design Awards, and has been featured by The Art Fund, Book Trust, The Week Junior, Science & Nature magazine, The Independent, and more! (Shoutout - the photos of us and the kids on this site were taken by the wonderful Penny Wincer.)

name: ai.no.ah
description: Hello, I am Noa. During my career as a designer, I have travelled to India extensively and worked with iconic brands such as Anokhi, who introduced me to the wonders of block printing. I started ai.no.ah to celebrate craftsmanship, collaborating with artisans to create collections inspired by traditional crafts paired with contemporary sensibility. The focus behind the brand is on small-scale ethical production, creating sustainable, unique and beautiful styles.

name: Aimee Mac Illustration
description: Vibrant, characterful, expressive hand drawn illustration, print, stationery & textiles. Always plastic free, printed on the most luxurious Italian papers and OEKO-TEX certified fabrics. Designed in sunny Yorkshire, made as sustainably as possible in the UK.

name: Aimée & Fred
description: We are a husband-and-wife team specialising in creating gifts and cards from recycled materials. We use vintage blankets, broken jewellery, feathers, vintage linen, reclaimed timber, and leather. We have been in business for 10 years and love what we do. Libby, a former theatrical costume designer handles the sewing and illustrating. Neil, a self-taught carpenter works with the wood. We have a small but mighty shop in the historic market town of Nantwich.

name: AIRO Aromatherapy
description: AIRO meaning: ah'-ee-ro. Verb. to raise up, elevate, lift up Elevate your everyday rituals. We make refillable, naturally scented aromatherapy products in England to help you make simple steps to improve your life. For every purchase, we donate to chosen charities to help older people living with dementia, loneliness and other ailments. For life's little pleasures

name: Akara
description: Welcome to Akara Store London. I create beautifully handcrafted felt ornaments which have been inspired by my love of all things spiritual. From idea to conception, my tarot cards are a way for me to express my thoughts through design. Tarot cards provide me happiness and inner peace therefore I decided to share a piece of my heart with you…

name: Alex and Annie
description: Hello, we're Claire Alexandra and Jessica Annie. A pair of storytellers and best friends with a passion for creating memorable experiences and moments. Alex and Annie Studio curates and creates collections of luxury and seasonal products that help us to slow down and reconnect, both with the world around us and our people. We are a conscious brand, sustainability and social responsibility is at the core of every decision we make. Alex & Annie Studio is the home of creative homeware and lifestyle products that encourage you to be present.

name: Alex Ebdon
description: Hi, I’m Alex and I’m an artist. I handpaint beautiful designs onto vintage and unique wooden boards to create one-of-a-kind pieces that bring a blast of colour and artistry to any home. I love the colours and forms that we find in our gardens – vegetables, fruit and flowers – so these form a big part of the inspiration for the pieces I create. Perfect for serving at special occasions or simply to have in your kitchen as a unique piece of art, every board is handpainted by myself with a design I feel matches the size, shape and feel of the wood. I hope you like them!

name: Alexandra Snowdon
description: Hello! I’m Alexandra Snowdon and I love words. I love drawing them, reading them and writing them. Ever since I can remember I’ve doodled letters and made them look fancy while on the phone, on trains and in planes. I'm happy to say I now make my living designing hand drawn greeting cards and prints which feature my 'fancy' hand lettering. I aim to make cards that people will want to keep forever and prints that will bring fun and inspiration to your walls and shelves.

name: Alice and Angus
description: At Alice and Angus we are passionate about Beeswax! We create 100% beeswax rolled and solid candles in a palette ranging from undyed natural beeswax to a host of vibrant and seasonal colours. Our packaging is 100% recyclable and our rolled candles are wrapped in seed paper that can be planted to help provide for vital pollinators.

name: Alice Funge Ceramics
description: ‘The perfect gift for a star baker from a star maker’. My ceramics business first started after I graduated from university in 2017 with a successful final product range, decorated with original recipes from my late grandmother’s collection. My work has since evolved and can now be personalised with your own cherished family recipes, making a unique and personal product. Have you got a special recipe that was passed down to you from a loved one?

name: Alison Hardcastle
description: Hello! We are a design studio and independent stationery company producing a range of stylish, clever and playful greetings cards in the Yorkshire Wolds. Influences and inspirations are wide and varied but mainly come from a huge passion for words, typography, graphic imagery and pattern, illustration and communication of thoughts and notions. We design simple things we would like to receive, own and use. Alison’s vision: to design striking products with true meaning and genuine creative integrity to be used for everyday adventures, monumental occasions and for the love of good design.

name: All Dressed Up
description: Hi, I’m Tess! I’ve always loved salad dressing! My mum taught me how to make it from as young as I can remember. We’d get through jars of the stuff at home - using it to dress up green salads, pour over jacket potatoes, jazz up a pasta salad or sometimes we’d have straight off the spoon! It wasn’t until I was older, when friends would ask on holiday if I could make the dressing, or if they could have the ‘secret’ recipe, that I thought “hang on, maybe this stuff is quite good!”

name: All Frills
description: All Frills was born when my daughter was four years old. She came to me with a pink piece of paper & asked me to make her a crown. She wanted to wear it to school so I thought I better make it to last the day, and with that, the first All Frills crown was created! I posted the picture to my instagram, someone messaged pretty quickly to ask where they could buy one and my small business has thrived from there.

name: Alphabet bags
description: Hey! We're Hayley and Lucas, founders of Alphabet Bags. Alphabet Bags is a family run accessories, clothing, and giftware brand, established in 2008. From soft, organic cotton tees to heavy duty oversized canvas totes, everything in our collection is designed by the two of us from our home studio in the lovely market town of Saffron Walden. We work closely with UK based manufacturers to bring our designs to life with the highest quality materials and attention to detail.

name: Amy Frankie Smith
description: Hi, I’m Amy, My hand crafted lighting showcase the natural translucency of porcelain ceramic. Beautifully simple designs are brought to life with delicate attention to detail and the precision required to handle this, the finest of clays. I work from my studio on Shoreham Beach, near Brighton, Sussex, where the waves and the wind blow into my work. Simple, honest forms, as airy and fluid as the sea that inspired them.

name: Amy Gardner Artist
description: Australian born, South London based multi media artist, best known for bold use of colour and uplifting images. The driving force behind my work is celebrating women, and the power of women supporting women, with a respectful nod to the movement and ‘history of effort’ gifted to us from generations of women before us. I am keen to amplify the message of celebrating our imperfections and embracing our uniqueness. I deliberately work outside of the realm of printing standards; mis-registering, imperfect hand cut stencils, as well as pushing and disregarding perceived limits.

name: Amy Swann
description: Hi, I’m Amy, a Welsh artisan who creates beautifully painted delights that celebrate magical, meaningful and happy moments. I follow my many inspirations leading with love, passion and purpose. I work with varied materials producing intricate and delicate heirlooms to be savoured and treasured for generations. My unique pieces are created to become part of your story all designed and made with love and care. “What comes from the heart, goes to the heart”.

name: AND ROAM
description: Hello. My name is Alia Roberts, founder of And Roam. We are a company that make leather carry goods that are unique in their concept of no sew and no throw. We create handmade bags here in East Sussex in our home studio. Because our bags are made from leather they have a longer lifespan and easily become heritage pieces. Rejecting a throw away culture is what we’re all about. Knowing the bag we carry is playing its part and looks good at the same time, is our essence.

name: Angela Evans
description: I make ceramic tiles in a little studio, situated in a secluded garden where my fruit and vegetable tiles can grow alongside the apples and peas. I have 30 years of experience designing and making bespoke tiles of all shapes and sizes. My tiles have been used in all sorts of interiors and collected as decorative objects in themselves for display on walls, shelves and mantelpieces. I am lucky enough to do what I love, and it makes people happy too!

name: Annabel Wond Interiors
description: Annabel Wond Interiors was born from a real passion (well...obsession) and love of all things beautiful for the home. We specialise in unique and sustainable homeware and prints that add character and elegance to any space.

name: Annika Reed Studio
description: Yours is a home like no other and in a world craving variety and originality, Annika Reed designs offer unique creations for people who love a life less ordinary. The age-old art of woodblock printing is in decline, and Annika is on a one-woman mission to revive the craft and bring the quality of delicate wood prints into the homes of discerning people like you with limited edition and bespoke wallpapers and fabrics Often based on minute details and personal discoveries, each tell their own story -- from the absurd to the historical, and are always steeped in beauty and curiosity.

name: Another Loop
description: We think that pieces of stationery can be miniature artworks in their own right! As an alternative to off-the-shelf gift ideas, we create stationery to treasure; incorporating creative gestures and finishing touches that make the final result completely unique. Every item is designed and created from scratch in our small studio, with our hot foil press along with boxes of nibs, inks and card stocks always at the ready to make your occasions - big or small - extra special.

name: Appreciation Project
description: A creative studio designing homewares that bring colour and character to your space. Championing British craftsmanship. Design led, female owned.

name: Arcana
description: Welcome, I am Ria. My passion for nature has always been my artistic fuel, leading me to found Arcana in 2022, with a mission to deepen our connection to nature through art. With previous careers in science and photography, I knew I wanted to create art with a story, one that encouraged a personal connection to nature in the everyday. This is Arcana: a marriage of art and natural history, woven into heirloom textiles for you to treasure and transform your home.

name: Archie Proudfoot
description: Hi, my name is Archie and I like to paint letters. I can make your walls talk with my limited edition screen prints and original paintings. The work I create is rooted in the techniques of traditional sign painting: craft, quality and the soul that comes with the handmade are essential to what I offer. I believe that artwork changes homes and enriches lives, and It’s my mission to use the alchemy of elements in my work to do that for as many people as possible.

name: Argent & Sable
description: At Argent and Sable, we create one-of-a-kind illuminated signs inspired by the magic of old fairgrounds, cabaret and circus life. From their Norwich workshop, husband-and-wife team Dan and Dusty design, make, paint and illuminate every piece by hand using carefully sourced reclaimed wood, authentic fairground bulbs and a love of colour, words and vintage fonts. Whether it’s a bold star, a playful phrase or a bespoke commission, each sign is designed to bring joy, character and a touch of wonder into your home.

name: Art of Ping Pong
description: Hello, we are Algy & Caro, the founding duo behind the independent and British-owned brand, the Art of Ping Pong. Sitting boldly at the nexus of art and play, AoPP is the leading brand to bring contemporary design sensibilities to the fun-for-everyone game of ping pong. With a simple mission to make art more playful, we specialise in fusing art with functional design to create unique objects that spark a connection with others through conversation and play. With our aesthetically striking wall-hanging ping pong tables, nets and bats, you can seamlessly transform your space into an immediate playground.

name: ARTHOUSE Unlimited
description: ARTHOUSE Unlimited is a charity that represents a collective of artists with complex neuro-diverse and physical support needs. The artists work alongside instructors to create artworks which are developed into designer products for sale. All artwork derives from the skills each artist brings to the enterprise and every contribution holds real value. Offering a sense of purpose lies at the heart of ARTHOUSE Unlimited’s philosophy in line with our belief that feeling truly respected improves health, happiness and well-being. We strive to challenge perceptions and to create better acceptance and inclusion for people living with neurodivergence and physical adversities. As we grow we hope to offer more opportunities to people in other towns across the UK. Sales revenue helps sustains the charity, enabling it to grow and evolve.

name: Artisan Luxury Soap
description: We are a small independent business based in London that creates 100% natural, traditional cold process soaps. We care about the planet, so all of our products are hand crafted and made in small quantities. Using herbal infusions, natural essential oils, colourants and butters, our soaps leave your skin feeling luxuriously pampered as they are kind to your body and the environment. This process required soap batches to be cured for a minimum of 6 weeks, for a harder, long-lasting bar with beautiful creamy lather. Our products are sustainable and zero-waste delivered in a plastic-free, repurposed, reused, recyclable packaging.

name: Artshed Brighton
description: Hi, I’m Hayley - a maker, obsessed with cooking, and seeing food beautifully presented. I’ve been transforming wood, fabrics, and furniture for over 20 years, working mainly on commissions and with chefs and event designers. Since moving to the UK in 2016, Yakisugi (or charring) has been the focus of my work. Each item in my wooden tableware collection is designed to accentuate the colour and texture of food, as it contrasts so beautifully with the charred wood.

name: Atelier Susan Bradley
description: Susan creates original and innovative work with a distinctive graphic quality.Her art is created by hand printmaking - using letterpress, lino cut and mono printing techniques. Her fascination with these handmade analogue techniques and with 'slow art' drives her creative output. She loves how each piece she hand makes is absolutely unique. How each piece is made with care and attention, and how creating by hand produces what might seem like 'imperfections' in our perfect digital world (finger prints, different weights of ink and the like ) yet are actually what creates their beauty. She combines a simple, graphic style for which she in known with either striking monochrome or rich metallics. Her inspiration comes from inspirational poems, song lyrics, wild swimming, contemporary culture and ancient wisdoms, folklore, protest art and feminisim.

name: Audrey's
description: Audrey’s, the oldest chocolatier in Sussex, has been delighting chocolate lovers with its handcrafted creations since 1948. Known for its artisanal chocolates, this family-run business has become a symbol of quality and craftsmanship, attracting customers from across the UK. Decades on, these cherished treats remain a key part of Audrey’s selection, alongside a range of other chocolates, each crafted with the same attention to detail that has defined Audrey’s since its founding.

name: Autumn's Corner
description: We are Autumn's Corner. A husband and wife team, handmaking beautiful wooden bookshelves, wall storage and décor. Our products are created with kiddos spaces in mind, though our stylish designs work throughout the home. Our products are made from beautiful natural materials, made with high quality joinery, and focus on adding functional beauty and fun to any space!

name: Baba Bears
description: Hey there! Welcome to Baba Bears, where we're all about crafting adorable handmade crochet bears & bunnies with a whole lot of heart. So, what's the deal? Well, first off, they're not just your average soft toys. Nope, each one is like a little bundle of memories waiting to happen. Whether they're snuggling up at bedtime or going on wild adventures with their new best buds, our bears & bunnies are there for it all. At the heart of our work is a commitment to ethics. Partnering with the Mon Ami Foundation ensures that every bear & bunny we create is made with fairness in mind – from supporting the communities involved in their creation to upholding fair labour practices. Now, let's dive into the fashion side of things! Our bears & bunnies are dressed to impress in some seriously stylish knitted clothing, all proudly made right here in the UK. But here's where it gets really fun – the clothing is customisable! Picture this: your bear or bunny sporting a cute outfit with your little one's name embroidered on it. How adorable is that?

name: Babak Ganjei
description: Hello, how are you? This is Babak

name: Bambi and Rose
description: Bambi & Rose is a London-based accessories brand creating handwoven baskets and bags with a strong sense of style and story. Founded by designer Rosella Daly, the brand takes inspiration from vintage summers — particularly the golden era of 1960s St Tropez — and reimagines them through sculptural shapes, natural textures, and slow craftsmanship. Each piece is handmade in Morocco by skilled female artisans using raffia, straw and leather, produced in small, considered batches with quality and longevity at the forefront. At Bambi & Rose, we believe in doing fewer things, better — and designing pieces that feel joyful, functional, and a little bit escapist. From bold striped baskets to our signature motif La Ponche reed bags, Bambi & Rose accessories are designed to carry more than just your essentials — they carry a mood, a moment, and a slice of summer, wherever you are.

name: Barefoot Oxford
description: I started making cakes at home for family and friends, this lead to a market stall and now we have 4 of our own coffee shops. I love developing new recipes and coming up with flavour combinations that are natural, seasonal and beautifully balanced.

name: Based Food
description: We are a small family business, starting as just a team of three, me, my mum, and my dad, but we have big ambitions. We are determined to grow and expand our range and our team, so we can provide as many tasty food choices as possible for you to enjoy.

name: Basket and Belle
description: I personalise ethically sourced items in my workspace in Hereford, transforming them into unique pieces, often designed with kids and travel in mind. Whether it's a keepsake for your little one, a special holiday memento, or a thoughtful gift to mark an occasion, I create products that help you celebrate the moments you want to remember. My love for crochet shines through in each piece, with every name crocheted free hand, adding a personal and handmade touch. Each item is crafted with care, ensuring it's both beautiful and meaningful.

name: Bear In Mind Design
description: I am an Illustrator and Designer originally from Birmingham but currently based in Stoke on Trent. I produce a range of designs and wares for the home and giftware. My designs are inspired by everyday life, nature, my love of typography and bold colour adding an element of fun in each piece. My illustrations are put on to a range of ceramic ware and I also screen print my designs on to a range of apparel and prints for the home.

name: Bear Wood Furniture
description: Handcrafted, wooden children's furniture designed and made in the UK inspired by Montessori.

name: Bear's Brownies
description: Brownies are the most comforting and decadent of all the bakes and make a wonderful gift. At Bear’s Brownies we bake and send a range of delicious handmade brownies delivered in gorgeous packaging to be delivered all over the country. Our flavour menu has been developed to go above and beyond the purist chocolate fudge brownie to the heights of decadent Salted Caramel & Pretzel brownies and even Billionaires Gold Leaf brownies. We set a pretty high bar for ourselves and work tirelessly to produce treats that look and taste divine.

name: Beevive Ltd
description: Inventors of the World's first Bee Revival Kit - As Seen on Dragon’s Den 🐉 Beevive creates bee-friendly, beautifully unique products that make perfect gifts for nature lovers. Each piece is thoughtfully designed and hand-assembled in their buzzing studio in Devon, UK. Their mission is to celebrate and support the vital role of bees while offering sustainable, meaningful products that spread joy!

name: Behold Relics
description: Bringing a touch of the unusual to everyday jewellery, Behold Relics aims to create wearable pieces of treasure that you won’t find anywhere else. Influenced by folklore, mythology and the natural world, my pieces celebrate the power of ancient objects and the mystery behind unearthed relics. My designs are predominantly made using the lost-wax casting method, a technique of jewellery making that is believed to have first been used around 5000 years ago!

name: Bel Holland
description: Hello, I’m Bel! A craftsperson, specialising in thrown ceramic stoneware vessels made on a potters wheel. I was born and raised in the beautiful Peak District which is a constant pool of inspiration for me. From the elegant stately homes of Chatsworth and Haddon Hall, to the rolling hills and rocky landscapes of the Derbyshire Dales and Dark Peak moorland. I make wheel-thrown ceramics made from a variety of stoneware clays, producing both functional and decorative objects for the home.

name: Belfast Bow Company
description: Located in a charming red brick building in historic Dromore, Co. Down, a quiet revolution in artisanal menswear is taking place. The Belfast Bow Company specialises in Men's Accessories, namely Bow Ties, Ties, Pocket Squares & Cufflinks, that are designed to be worn for a lifetime. Handmade by a couple of Belfast artisans & woven with time, talent & character, through and through. Our philosophy is to celebrate traditional handcrafting techniques, using locally sourced & quality natural fabrics such as Irish Linen, Scottish Wools and Liberty of London Cottons and Silks, and employ local skilled craftspeople.

name: Belinda Love Lee Paperie
description: In a world where most things are mass produced and manufactured, we believe in a slower and more sustainable way of living. We work with handmade, cotton paper and lots of textured goodness through the technique of letterpress to create lasting, subtle impressions. Our aim is to create greeting cards and stationery products that last more than just the moment of being read and thrown in the bin right away. The goal is to create beautiful, timeless, letterpress luxe cards that people will want to frame as keepsakes and memories for years to come!

name: Belle Smith
description: Hi, I’m Belle, the owner and designer/ maker behind Belle Smith Jewellery. Now based in Leeds, I draw inspiration from the natural world and the stories we carry. My designs balance traditional craftsmanship with contemporary artistry, featuring carefully selected gemstones and delicate details to create jewellery that feels elegant, personal, and like no other.

name: Benjamin Thomas Taylor
description: Hi I am Benjamin! I make bright prints inspired by Pop Art. I'm fuelled by a sense of joy, and my detailed paintings and prints open up hyperreal spaces, crossing from reality into a parallel world of limitless possibility, full of colour and creation.

name: Bert & Buoy
description: We're Bert and Lisa, writing from dreamy Devon and our arty indie business, Bert & Buoy. What began as an idea during late-night feeds on parental leave, has blossomed into a family-run venture, that's making waves. We're artist designed and British made, with a signature line art style. Joyful, bold designs inspired by nature and the ocean. Beautiful, well-made things, handcrafted with originality, love and sustainability.

name: Bertie Valentine
description: Hi! I’m Hester and I’m the founder behind Bertie Valentine. I’m a passionate paper flower artist and illustrator, with a deep love of colour and craftsmanship, based in Cornwall. I use FSC-certified Italian crepe paper to craft everlasting, intricate and vibrant paper bouquets and wall decorations. I also specialise in hand painted stationery, accessories and home décor, all inspired by maximalism, an obsession with decoration and bringing joy to everyday life.

name: Betty Woodhouse Design
description: Hello & welcome to my shop, a combination of my love for vintage ephemera and pop culture! Here you will find Cinema & Gig Ticket prints, as well as Library Card prints that you can personalise to celebrate your favourite pieces of media! Thank you for stopping by!

name: Bigfatbambini
description: Welcome to Bigfatbambini, where we believe that life's greatest joys are found in the simplicity of everyday moments and the wonders of nature. Our story is one of passion, creativity, and a deep appreciation for the world around us. At Bigfatbambini, our products are born from the beauty of nature and the magic found in the ordinary. We are dedicated to celebrating the small moments and achievements that make life truly extraordinary.

name: Bill & Ben's Occasional Emporium
description: Hello! I'm Ben, the proud creator behind Bill & Ben's Occasional Emporium. I'm on a mission to tackle plastic waste with our exquisite ceramic straws. Sustainability is my passion, and these handcrafted straws are my way of making a positive impact, sip by sip. At Bill & Ben's, I pour love and meticulous detail into each ceramic straw. Not only are they functional, but they're also a stylish eco-friendly option, waving goodbye to single-use plastic straws.

name: Billy The Kid
description: Living and working in London, I initially made art as a hobby to bring life, humour and colour to my own walls and as an outlet to clear my mind. Billy The Kid was created with the aim to make your walls happy. It's something different; something that starts a conversation and hopefully makes someone smile.

name: Bird & Co Studio
description: Welcome to my adventurous and colourful world. I’m Emily Byrd, the illustrator and founder of Bird & Co Studio. From my countryside studio, I create eco-conscious paper goods and gifts inspired by the natural world and designed to help protect it. These ranges include art prints, greeting cards, gift wrap and calendars.

name: Biskut Bar
description: Biskut Bar is a purpose-led Indian biscuit company offering boldly aromatic, award-winning treats. We aim to evoke delight and curiosity through biscuits and our mission is to bring the flavours of a heritage to life with intentionally sourced, sustainably grown ingredients. All treats are crafted in London by an American born in Punjab. Our motto is "Eat Biskuts, Have A Fun!"

name: Bison Bindery
description: Bison Bindery was founded by me, Maddie, and is inspired by my love for stationery, art and history. I am still involved from the first brushstroke of a painting to carefully packing up your order and sending it out to you from my studio on the edge of the South Downs. The majority of our designs are originally painted in watercolour, before being collaged together in photoshop to create the repeat patterns featured across our stationery.

name: Black & Beech
description: Hi, I am Stacey, and in 2016 I founded Black & Beech with a mission to make conscious, purposeful, feminist informed fashion. From concept to creation, we set out to support women, to inspire feminist activism and to create timeless, quality apparel in an environmentally conscious way. In the last five years, Black & Beach has reached over 20,000 customers worldwide, supported dozens of local suppliers and creatives and raised almost £20,000 for women’s rights charities.

name: Bloody Drinks
description: We're Harry and Will -  old friends who love Bloody Marys. Arguably, too bloody much. For years we spent our Sundays obsessively seeking the finest examples of the drink, before eventually distilling our painstakingly accrued knowledge into fluid ounces at home.

name: Blossom & Bramble
description: Personalised hand-embroidered cushions and clothing for littles. All Blossom & Bramble keepsakes are inspired by my love of nature and colour.

name: Blue Brontide
description: Blue Brontide make beautiful hand-crafted wooden toys & children's tableware with the belief that children's items should not only be beautiful but built to last, made for keeps & designed to be passed down the family gathering memories & character along the way. Heirloom quality toys & tableware in sustainable materials that can be cherished for generations to come.

name: Blue Stiggy
description: Truly thoughtful and personalised eco-conscious journals, notebooks and stationery. I love to type your amazing personalised messages using my vintage typewriter named Dorothy, to create hand painted and hand stitched stationery. I use traditional methods and tools from times gone by, to make contemporary stationery from recycled and innovative materials that you will love now. Give a truly thoughtful and personal gift that has real meaning between you and the recipient.

name: Bob & Blossom
description: Greetings + welcome to our world! Here you'll find our jolly range of childrens clothing, all made using a contemporary colour palette with a cheeky, little colour pop. We hope that each special piece brings big smiles + happy times. Somehow we are celebrating 25 years of Bob & Blossom this year!!

name: Bob & Eve
description: Bob & Eve was founded by me, Corinna Wilson in 2020. The name evolved from the words bobbin and weave in reference to my use of textiles as a medium. Aiming to brighten the world with humour, my colourful works are an expression of my irreverent take on modern society. Using a combination of hand tufted and machine based techniques to create one off pieces of art with wool, each artwork is designed and made in my studio in Brighton.

name: Bobbie Print
description: Hi, I'm Victoria. I'm the creative designer behind Bobbie Print. Bobbie Print has a simple, joyful style. My characterful, nature inspired illustrations, prints and cards always raise a smile. When they said good things come in small packages they really were referring to my collection of mini cards, making sure my products are not only beautiful, original and sustainably made are the core principles behind Bobbie Print.

name: Bobella Co.
description: Bobella Co. is slow living brand with a carefully curated collection of handmade refillable Soy Wax Candles, Wax Melts and plantable seed cards. A perfect harmony of craftsmanship and sustainability. All of our products are handmade by our small team in our local North East studio, including our stoneware candle pots! We are striving to be as eco-friendly as possible, so we also do refills for our candles which are designed to fit perfectly inside our candle pots, meaning you can use your pot over and over without having to throw it away! The dust covers on our candles are also made from Wildflower seed paper which means that when you have finished the last burn of your candle (and you no longer want to refill it) you can plant the seed paper and grow some lovely flowers in the pot! We also have a small range of greetings cards which are made from the wildflower seed paper and are fully plantable. We think these little extras are what make our little brand so special.

name: Bobo Wines
description: Salut! My name’s Chris, and I’m a lover of food, travel and most importantly, wine. Whilst journeying through France, I was introduced to the idea that outstanding wine could come in a box. This revelation inspired me to spread the word in other countries where—let’s face it—boxed wine has a mixed reputation. So, I created BOBO, to prove that boxed wine can be chic, affordable and surpass all expectations.

name: Bohemia & Flower
description: I’m Katy, the hands behind Bohemia & Flower, a small batch soap studio where plants and purpose come together. Inspired by The Good Life, an allotment and a lifelong love of nature, I craft soap the slow way -vegan, palm oil free and packaged plastic-free. Each botanical soap bar is skin-kind, earth-kind and turns humble washing into a joyful ritual, a daily reminder that the simple things can be the most beautiful.

name: BOKUNO
description: BOKUNO dolls celebrate the beauty and uniqueness of all individuals, regardless of their background, culture, or identity. I take pride in my hand-made, slow-made, better-made approach to doll making. It ensures that each item I create is crafted with care, attention to detail, and quality that can be cherished and passed down through the family. My dolls represent my values and commitment to promoting a better, more inclusive, and sustainable world.

name: Bonnie Bespoke
description: Hello, I'm Katy - the founder of Bonnie Bespoke Embroidery. Bonnie Bespoke Embroidery specialises in transforming the treasured handwriting of loved ones, often taken from cards, letters or meaningful notes, into delicate hand embroidered messages onto wedding and occasion accessories. Each piece is carefully traced and delicately embroidered by hand, creating a heartfelt keepsake that beautifully carries the memory of those who mean the most. I understand how meaningful these words are and I feel truly honoured to be trusted with such a deeply sentimental creation. I love hearing the story behind the handwriting and I take great care and pride in ensuing that each stitch is as perfect as it can be. It's a real privilege to help preserve and create a beautiful heirloom that can be treasured for years to come.

name: Book of Deer
description: My name is Eilidh, I create beautiful products aimed at exposing children to inclusive and diverse representation. I hand-paint portraits of the people who inspire us from the past, present and our own personal lives. I am Scottish and Chinese and my passion is discovering and celebrating role models from all over the world. When children are mirrored in the stories they are immersed in, we nurture limitless dreams and untethered imaginations.

name: Bow Beaus
description: Home of the original party animals, here at BowBeaus I’ve been creating handcrafted bespoke animals since 2014. Cherished by customers of all ages, my animals undergo a glow-up in the Derbyshire studio and make beautiful cake toppers, glorious ornaments, and are perfect decorations year-round.

name: Boy Wonder
description: Boy Wonder is a boy’s fashion brand that is playful and positive, where boys can enjoy fashion as much as girls. Created by a mum and son who wouldn’t settle for boring boy’s fashion and wanted to create a kinder product that would make people smile. With certified organic cotton and chemical-free prints parents can feel happy knowing they are safe and earth-friendly.

name: Brady and Blue
description: Welcome to my shop, Brady and Blue! I am Louise and I live in Liverpool with my husband and our little boy. I sell lovingly handmade felt garlands and decorations. I work in conjunction with some wonderfully skilled women in Nepal, bringing my designs to life using 100% New Zealand wool. Once in my studio, I then use them to create your gorgeous garlands! I'm totally living the dream, being able to decorate your homes with my colourful garlands, fuelled of course by lots and lots of chocolate! So brighten up your home with some pom poms, or squishy balls of happiness as I like to call them!

name: Bramble & Blooms
description: Nestled in the heart of Cheshire, Tarporley boasts a world of floral wonder where every bloom weaves a tale. From whimsical wildflowers to elegant seasonal arrangements, our flowers are eager to bring a splash of joy into your life. "Create a story with the language of flowers". photo credit: @whiteportraitUK

name: Bramble and Friends
description: Inspired by my heart dog Bramble and a love of creating, Bramble and Friends has been a hub of unique dog accessories since 2015. All products are handcrafted from my home, with full focus on eye catching designs, that are both comfortable and practical for our precious four legged family!

name: Bramble and Wild
description: Welcome to the Wild... where rustic and romantic floral design is at the heart of what we do. We're a small team of 8, creating glorious fresh floral designs and dried wreaths for every season. We're also intimate wedding specialists and purveyors of carefully curated gifts & gardenware. Based on quirky Catherine Hill in Frome, we're passionately independent, supporting other small businesses by sourcing locally when we can and growing lots of our own Bramble Blooms.

name: Brampton Willows
description: Based in the idyllic Suffolk countryside, we supply the finest willow fences to the East of England and our products and bespoke commissions worldwide. Brampton Willows was established in the mid 80’s in response to a growing need for quality natural fencing and garden products. Since then we have been perfecting our craft. Our skilled craftspeople use the highest quality natural materials to create beautiful natural fencing, willow sculpture, furniture, garden structures and more.

name: Bramwell Brown Art Clocks
description: Hi! We are Rob & Sarah, a brother and sister team originally from Lancashire. We trace our love of curious mechanical objects back to our childhood – to Sunday afternoons, when Dad would wind the grandfather clock, then tap on the barometer to see what the weather might be up to that day. Our clocks were born out of that shared fascination with old clock mechanics. It was our dream to create beautiful clocks that summoned that same sense of childhood fun and nostalgia. Our clocks are customisable so do please check the product descriptions for guidance!

name: Brick Sixty
description: We are a London-based studio who design and make products in the form of the much-loved London brick. The hand cast products symbolise London; the products will always be made in London and stocked at unique stores. Just like the city itself, all our products are designed to be completely inclusive and crafted for all to enjoy.

name: Brimble Studio
description: If you’re looking for a little escapism, fun and nostalgia shaped into a beautifully crafted and characterful ceramic then, hello! I’m Jo, founder of Brimble Studio! I am an Independent Award nominated ceramics business that is anything but ordinary, I like to have as much fun as possible and I aim to put a smile on your face! I meticulously construct and hand-paint each piece to create jovial ceramics that take on a life of their own so you can treasure them forever.

name: Brittany Davies Illustration
description: Hello! I'm Brittany, and I am an Illustrator and Designer based in Monmouthshire, South Wales. All of my items start off as watercolour and line illustrations before being printed in the UK onto mixed recycled card stocks. Thank you for popping by!

name: Brodie Davies
description: Illustrator, making tasty art for your eyeballs to enjoy. Bold and colourful greetings cards. Custom portraits created for you, your Dad, your dog, your dentist and everyone in between.

name: Buddug
description: Buddug (pronounced bi-th-ig) Humphreys is a designer-maker originally from Snowdonia area of North Wales but now lives in Cardiff, South Wales. Her Welsh upbringing is a large inspiration to her work. The Welsh countryside, Welsh literature and culture, feeds into her work. Buddug creates hand-made metal and illustrated enamel jewellery

name: Bumble & Earwig
description: Laura Cronin, aka Bumble & Earwig specialises in the creation of miniature curiosities through the medium of needle-felting. These artworks are inspired by antique taxidermy, museum collections, scientific illustrations, and of course David Attenborough documentaries! Every piece is painstakingly handmade, using a barbed needle to prod at wool roving thousands of times! It’s more fun than it may sound, but it does require a lot of time and patience!

name: Bumbleblue
description: Hello, I'm Emma - a Derbyshire lass with a dream of living a creative life and making treasures. I started Bumbleblue as an Illustration graduate, hoping to use some of my artistic skills to make products that would make people smile and feel good. Since becoming a mum to my little girl, my creations grew to include celebrating small people too. Personalised keepsakes and decorations became part of my designs, allowing me to fill my little ladies room with creativity and a bit of Bumbleblue magic. Whether it's to remember, celebrate or to decorate, these hand painted pieces are all created with care to make the most special treasures for you and your home. Thank you for popping over to see!

name: Buns of Joy
description: Buns of Joy is an artisan batch bakery with a difference. Sure, we love our baking: home-made pillowy dough and perfectly mixed cinnamon spice; preparing the icing just right so it melts in the mouth. But we also love our friends and family and know that being there for them is hard when you’ve got a million other things going on. Buns of Joy celebrates the simplicity of being able to gift something original, thoughtful (and most importantly delicious), to those we love most.

name: By Hope
description: By Hope is a carefully curated homeware brand bringing the beauty of nature into any home. All our prints are hand painted exclusively for the collection then printed onto the finest European stonewashed linen. They are designed to be used year after year, party after party! Our linens are the perfect dressing for your table, inside or out, all year round. Each item is inspired by a love of the outdoors and the joy of sharing this with others.

name: By Jay
description: By Jay is a creative embroidery business specialising in unique, high-quality embroidered pieces for children. Known for the Original Milk Carton Jumpers, each design is thoughtfully crafted with a mix of nostalgia and modern style. From bold statement pieces to delicate detailing, every item is made with care and creativity, bringing personality to your little wardrobe .

name: By Katie Kingsley
description: Pals with personality. My goal is to bring joy to as many people as possible through my ceramics. Encouraging people to slow down and enjoy the little things in life. Everything seems better when you’re drinking your morning cuppa from a mug with a happy little face.

name: By Nushy
description: Hi I'm Nushy! I'm a fineliner and watercolour illustrator based just around the corner from Hampton Court Palace. Whilst studying Graphic Design at university, I developed a huge passion for architectural style drawing. Inspired by the beautiful shop fronts, the palace and pubs on my doorstep, I began creating an illustrated map of the local area and the rest was history! I have since been creating and selling cards, prints and bespoke illustrations of my local area and beyond.

name: Calm Cocoa
description: Calm Cocoa is an award-winning range of vegan-friendly hot chocolate designed to help you create little moments of mindfulness and connection in a busy day. It's the tasty creation of meditation teacher, chocolatier and chocolate awards judge, Meredith Whitely. Calm Cocoa was founded on Meredith's love of food and chocolate, and a need to find a better sense of balance. This led her to combining two things that make her feel happy and connected: chocolate & meditation. She makes her blends in small batches in her kitchen in Mid Wales using flakes of real chocolate sourced for both ethics and taste.

name: Camden Clay
description: Hello I'm Steve Kamlish. My thing is words on plates. I'm interested in typographic quotes, idioms and slang all related to food. The history of a word or phrase fascinates me and I love breathing new life into an obscure saying, slang or film quote. My work is all hand made from our home studio in Bath. The kiln sits in a vault beneath the pavement of Camden Road.

name: Campbell Workshop
description: Campbell Workshop is a London-based workshop organisation that was established in 2018. Kristen's vision includes crafting DIY kits that are easily accessible to all, requiring minimal tools for assembly. Each DIY kit features a comprehensive, step-by-step video tutorial that can be accessed online. At Campbell Workshop, our paper flowers blend nature's beauty with artistic touch. Each bloom is carefully crafted, inspired by vibrant forms and colors. Choose from our Naturalistic collection, featuring lifelike replicas, or the Artistic collection, showcasing bold designs. Perfect for weddings, special occasions, or striking displays, our paper flowers add lasting charm.

name: Candyhouse
description: Hi, my name is Tanya. Welcome to Candyhouse! I started my business in the autumn of 2000, and am still enjoying the creativity and satisfaction of creating lovely sweet products, that bring joy to all that consume them!

name: Cappa E Spada
description: My name is Tony, the proud owner of Cappa E Spada Designs I am an independent designer who runs a studio and workshop, creating luxury furniture and bespoke decor pieces. My love of furniture and art sparked a massive interest in surface design which I went on to study for years. As my methods progressed I started to learn how to adhere certain inks to various surfaces like metal, wood and glass. My passion and persistence for my craft and my experience in the world of furniture infused these ideas together in a very unique way to form the beginnings of Cappa E Spada.

name: Caridade
description: Hey there! Welcome in. How’s it going today? Can I get you started with something to drink? I will give you a minute to look at our menu, but just so you know, our specials today are highly personalised products packed with irresistible flavour, enough to get your tastebuds dancing like there’s no tomorrow. Enjoy your meal!

name: Caro B Fin Studio
description: Hey, Im Caro(line), & I love flags! I design and make pennant flags for all your adventures, at home or on your travels, using canvas or old sails. I also source vintage flags, giving them a new lease of life by turning them into blankets and cushions. With left over sail, canvas or ghost fishing net I make a small range of 'one off' bags.

name: Carolina de Barros Jewellery
description: Carolina de Barros is a German-Brazilian jewellery designer based in London, inspired by nature’s textures and artists like Tarsila do Amaral and Barbara Hepworth. Her work reflects organic imperfection, capturing the beauty of raw, sculptural forms. Using lost wax casting, she sculpts intuitively, ensuring each piece is unique. Committed to sustainability, she crafts with 100% recycled precious metals, embracing slow design and ethical craftsmanship.

name: Caroline Burke Ceramics
description: Hi I'm Caroline! I create playful ceramics designed to bring joy in my Cambridgeshire studio. My passion is crafting functional art that can be collected and treasured. Each piece, from candle holders to splatterware bowls, is meticulously made in small batches. I aim to create pieces that elevate your everyday rituals, from making your morning coffee to evenings by candlelight, turning simple moments into special ones with unique, handmade designs that blend beauty and function.

name: Cassandra Yap
description: Originally from Singapore, Cassandra Yap is an artist based in East London. Her work often explores the juxtaposition between dark and beautiful subjects to create the surreal.

name: Cassia Beck
description: I am a paper collage artist using a mix of found and vintage papers. I hand cut my elements, using them to tell a new story. Colourful shapes create movement and direction. I am drawn to damaged paper with stains, rips and hand writing from the past. These marks often dictate my compositions.

name: Catherine Colebrook
description: Hi, I’m Cath and I create and make playfully cool designs that are all proudly made here in Britain. ‘Catherine Colebrook’ was founded on my kitchen table way back in 2006, and is an outlet for my love of fresh, bright design. I love colour, 70’s floral fabric, trifle, interior design, extreme pottering, mooching around flea markets & just the joy in the ordinary. Our bestselling liberty word pictures are completely bespoke & it would be an honour to make something for you.

name: Cece & Bear
description: Cece & Bear is a children's lifestyle brand creating quality, timeless, considerate designs for your little ones world. Our range of nursery decor and heirloom celebration pieces are sure to be the backdrop to your little ones childhoods. Treasured keepsakes for traditions and memories, we want our pieces to be loved through to adulthood. We work largely with Liberty London fabrics as well as European Linens and sumptuous velvets.

name: ceesawcards
description: Hi, I'm Caitlin, the founder of ceesawcards. Starting as handmade Christmas cards for friends and family, ceesawcards evolved into a professional range of cards for all occasions - from birthdays to Halloween to graduation. All my products are carefully created from original watercolour illustrations, inspired by the natural world, creatures big and small.

name: Celeste Chambers-Hill
description: Celeste Chambers-Hill aims to bring a sense of individuality to every piece of jewellery she produces. Originally from Dorset, but now based in London, Celeste graduated in silversmithing and jewellery design from the Glasgow School of Art in 2020. Since then, she has been making jewellery from recycled silver and brass, aiming to eliminate any waste. Celeste uses a combination of ethically sourced semi-precious natural gemstones and artificial gemstones with vibrant colours to give each piece a unique, personal touch. Her jewellery is made to be felt, to be worn, and to be loved.

name: Celina C Jewellery
description: Hi I’m Celina, the maker and designer of these one-off wearable memories. I lovingly create all these beautiful pieces in recycled silver and gold, only using lab grown or ethically sourced gemstones. I love making jewellery that is meaningful, whether it be my personalised wedding bands or gift-wrapped fingerprint and paw print kits; a perfect way to capture those people special to you, so that you can carry them with you forever, wherever you go!

name: Cesca Molly Flowers
description: Hello! My name is Francesca, also known as Cesca. I am a multidisciplinary artist based in Surrey, South London. I specialise in creating bespoke, intricate, and textural displays hand made from crepe paper. My process includes dyeing, cutting, curling & constructing every petal to create a beautiful and bespoke piece of art. My products can be used for a variety of settings including events, window displays, photo shoots, installations, and weddings or to simply display in your home for you to enjoy!

name: Chalk Jewellery
description: Welcome to Chalk Jewellery - Home of contemporary design led statement jewellery designed to make you Look Good & Feel Fab! Each piece is a labour of love, meticulously crafted to embody the perfect balance between form and function. I want you to not only wear my designs but to experience the joy and confidence they bring, as they add a touch of boldness and uniqueness to your personal style. I hope you love my pieces as much as I love creating them!

name: Chambers & Beau
description: I'm Amy, the designer/ maker of our gorgeous range of personalised sterling silver jewellery. Nestled in our studio on the edge of Dartmoor, we pour our hearts into crafting each and every single piece we produce, infusing rustic allure and understated grace into every design. Customisation takes centre stage, allowing clients to co-create bespoke treasures. The magic lies in hand-stamped words, endowing every item with sentimental value, appealing across generations.

name: Charis Raine Illustration
description: Hi, I'm Charis - I make art from a little eco studio in the old city of York and have slowly developed a range of illustrated paper goods since I first started in 2016. My work is inspired by folklore, Scandinavia and her great outdoors and all products begin with an illustration, either painted in gouache or digitally drawn. I'm a one woman band and pack and post them all orders to you! I try to use the best quality card I can find, and everything is eco friendly.

name: Charlotte Cadzow
description: Surfer, teacher, mum, and ceramic artist, I express my love of life through the language of clay. With 28 years of imaginative skill my pieces are covetable, tactile, and celebrate nature's beautiful imperfections. I'm proud my work has found homes in Michelin starred restaurants, galleries and hotels across the world, in private collections and community settings. I even had some pieces on Celebrity Big Brother! To own one of my pieces is to bring joy into your home.

name: Charlotte Gerrard
description: I create engaging imagery of animals and nature in which I strive to evoke emotion and ignite a sense of wonder about the natural world. My recent paintings feature animals often considered ‘lower forms’ such as chickens, foxes or small birds and by placing them inside vintage ornate frames I am elevating their status into something to be cherished as treasure. It is my belief that art has the power to transcend boundaries, touch hearts, and inspire positive change.

name: Charlotte Love
description: Hello I’m Charlotte, welcome to my world of fun faces. Life can be a little mundane at times which is why I like to to dream up characters from everyday objects and bring them to life. I have been creating and styling images for over 10 years working within the editorial and advertising world. Making faces began as a hobby but has grown into a small business. My collection ranges from Greeting cards, stickers, Art prints and more. All made with a touch of humour to make you smile.

name: Charlotte Miller Ceramics
description: Charlotte Miller is a Poole-based ceramicist and pottery teacher. She creates handmade sculptures and tableware inspired by domestic animals and the peculiarities of the British. Her anthropomorphic, whimsical budgie sculptures are endearing and nostalgic, while her quirky tableware is a tribute to the eccentric and kitsch. As a child, Charlotte became a keen social observer, trawling around car-boot sales with her Dad collecting curios, midcentury kitsch and seaside postcards. Amused by seeing the closeness of people and her pets, she decided to blend the two. Brian (aka ‘Elvis’) was born out of the chance meeting of an Elvis lover and his budgerigar.

name: Charlotte Spencer
description: Drawing on my knowledge of science, herbalism and aromatherapy, I bring you quality natural wax candles made from the finest ingredients, beautifully scented when cold and when lit. My products have a look of tinctures, tisanes and balms; things to make you feel better. And when doesn’t a candle help you feel relaxed?

name: Chase and Wonder
description: We are a family run home gift brand based in the heart of the English country side. Founded by Faye and David Aspinall in 2010, we pride ourselves in creating only the finest quality British made products, many of which are made using traditional techniques that have been passed down through generations.

name: Chateau de Mathilde
description: Hi, I'm Daisy, mum of four and creator of Chateau de Mathilde. Our hand embroidered pieces are all lovingly crafted in Shrewsbury, Shropshire. Designed to spark joy for all, both little and large- why not match with your Mini, or Bestie.

name: Chester & Cooke
description: Hi - I'm Liz Cooke and this is Chester my Jack Russell - I am the founder of Chester & Cooke. Back in 2015, life changed dramatically for me and my family. From this adversity and my love of the countryside, I started on a new journey to design and make products for the country lifestyle, eventually for the Home, Garden, Dog, and Horse. I am passionate about making high-quality, unique products, which are practical and useful. Customer service is so important to me. I feel like my customers are my friends and family as they share a passion with me for country life, gardening, and animals. Everyone gets one of my special handwritten notes. As each order is so appreciated. It's like you're cheering me on. So THANK YOU. Liz X

name: CHHABRA
description: Female-founded by 3 friends from East London, CHHABRA craft unique sugar-free blends with premium ingredients, to create an intense mouth-watering taste. Our love for creating new and fun flavours started with our award winning spiced cocoa and tea blends that balance punchy ingredients! We hope you enjoy the range, Casey, Pratima and Ruby X

name: CHICKPEA
description: Handmade knitted gifts and homewares. Knitted from our garden studio in Hampshire! Founder Harriett designs and creates cosy hot water bottles, cushions and scarves using pure merino lambswool yarn for an extra cosy and luxury feel.

name: Chloe Kempster
description: I’m Chloe, a furniture artist, designer, and all round creative soul who finds joy in beautiful things. I care about creating one-of-a-kind items for the home that reflect the individuality of the people who own them. Seeing potential in secondhand items, I look far and wide to find the coolest stuff, reusing items from the past to be a part of our future. Each project is a total one off but you can always expect to find quality craftsmanship, sustainable design, and unique hand-painted details.

name: Chloé Lawson
description: Hi, I’m Chloé and I’m an artist with a graphic design background. I work with ink and watercolour, and each piece I make is handmade and unique. I’m tapping into the playfulness and magic of life, illuminating the everyday experiences and emotions we all share, infusing them with humour and a sense of lightness. My work revolves around wordplay, visual puns, and the exploration of ideas, all while playing with the ordinary to uncover the hidden gems. In a world often overshadowed by darkness, I believe that injecting some lightheartedness and fun can truly make a difference in people's lives.

name: Chocolate on Chocolate
description: Kerr makes the chocolate moulds in ‘his shed’ while Flo runs the business, they design the chocolates together. Even though the business has grown, they still make all their chocolate by hand and staff receive in-depth training to do so. They currently produce approximately 163,000+ chocolates a week.... Chocolate on Chocolate pride themselves on the superb high quality of their Belgian chocolate and the way they have taken a fantastic product and hand craft it into something original. Designs such as shoes and handbags are big favourites.

name: ChoColours
description: If it looks good, it has to taste good too - We don’t just make chocolate; we give you an experience to remember. Stunning colourful chocolate bonbons, crafted by hand using natural flavours. I am passionate about developing, colouring and creating in order to give others as much colourful chocolate happiness as possible. Our amazing handmade chocolate bonbons come in a range of different shapes and delicious flavours, with a selection of dairy free chocolates as well as a selection suitable for vegans. Each chocolate is hand painted by the gifted hand of our chocolatier and each of them is a piece of art in itself.

name: Circle of Willis
description: Karen Willis is an artist creating bespoke ceramic pieces to wow your friends and family. For years, Karen told stories on screen, shaping unscripted television that captured real lives, real emotions, and unforgettable moments. Now she tells stories captured forever in ceramic, transforming words, humour, and sentiment into heirloom gifts you can hold, keep, and treasure. Each ceramic piece is bespoke, crafted to express exactly what you want to say, whether it’s heartfelt, hilarious, or sprinkled with a few choice swear words. Just like the best stories, these pieces become part of your family’s lore: passed down, talked about, and cherished for years to come. Karen's mission is to bring joy, laughter, and meaning into your relationships through ceramics that tell your story. Beautifully, playfully, and one-of-a-kind, each piece is a heartfelt way to show how much you care.

name: Circus Signs
description: I handcraft and paint Circus Style Signs in the comfort of my own kitchen in a small village in Somerset. My designs have now been used to create Replica Circus Signs and beautiful Hand Pulled Screen Prints.

name: CIVIL BLOCK
description: CIVIL BLOCK MICROSOAPERY make a range of Small Batch Soap, by hand, using a process inspired by the Traditional British Soapery from over 200 years ago. All synthetic free, they are suitable for Vegans, made only with raw base oils and plant extracts. From MENTAL BLOCK (Nettle + Lemongrass), to BREEZE BLOCK (Black Pepper + Pumice) and the fragrance-free BEAR BLOCK (Salted Porridge), each BLOCK is cured for a minimum of 6 weeks, and is packaged completely plastic free in boxes made on site.

name: Clare O'Neill Artworks
description: Hi there, I’m Clare O’Neill and I am a textile artist creating mixed media paintings, that showcase my love of nature and wildlife. I take much of my inspiration from the natural surroundings of where I live, capturing the seasonal changes and gathering materials from walks on the forest. Each lovingly made painting is then photographed, digitised so that every detail, texture and colour can be fully appreciated in my range of 100% eco considerate greeting cards, paper goods and home decor gifts.

name: Claudia Hocking
description: Fish, surfboard art is a unique and niche concept, a natural progression from painting fish on canvases which were hung alongside display surfboards giving me the idea of combining the 2 together - fish and surfboards. Cornwall is a county big on surfing so it's easy to get broken boards for me to paint on- the shapes are perfect for depicting a fish's streamlined body or head with the added bonus of stopping the boards going to landfill.

name: Cloth & Clay
description: Cloth & Clay is a London based independent brand centred around creating sustainable homeware pieces with a touch of luxury. Everyday essentials such as tea towels, aprons and table linens are made in muted colours and high quality linen to elevate your kitchen, dining and living spaces. All pieces are designed to be functional, blend in with any home aesthetic, and to be easily combined with each other for beautiful homeware scenes and dreamy tablescapes.

name: Coast and Country Designs
description: Welcome to the shack, where grassy meadows meet ocean waves. A creator of nature, inspired by the seasons and what it has to offer. A mix of foraged, homegrown and then dried. Specialising in wreaths, dried bouquets and arrangements. A blast of nature at its best, as I ‘wander freely’.

name: Coffee Cup Cards
description: From coffee cups to kind words - we make sustainably crafted greetings cards made from recycled disposable coffee cups. Thoughtful for you and kind to the planet. We are designer makers with a passion for unique and sustainable gifting. All our cards are designed by us, in our studio by the sea in Devon.

name: Coldharbour Lights
description: Hi, I'm Lottie, I set up Coldharbour Lights where we design and make original feather light shades from repurposed poultry feathers. Each piece is hand crafted and made to order in our South London studio. My background in theatre has influenced the spirit of these tactile designs. We are also a proud member of Blue Patch, the national social enterprise that funds community owned renewable energy projects.

name: Colours Of
description: Hi my name is Mary, I am the creator of Colours Of Sheffield. Colours Of Sheffield started out as an Instagram project where I matched Pantone cards to the beautiful colours around Sheffield.

name: Compound Woodwork
description: Compound is run by a husband & wife team Luke and Daisy Andrews. We founded Compound Woodwork to offer handmade, timeless wooden furniture and décor that adds a touch of natural beauty and classic appeal to any room. Our focus remains on using beautiful, sustainable materials and high-quality craftsmanship, ensuring each piece is both functional and aesthetically pleasing.

name: Contour Map Collection
description: Holders of memories; maps tell the tales of our adventures, celebrating our emotional connection with the soil, sky & mountains. Lifting contour lines from iconic and meaningful locations, their relief is cut into metal then hand formed and finished to create eye catching, topographical works of art. They can be personalised with hand-stamped or engraved details, like initials and dates, as well as marked with tiny granules or gemstones, pin-pointing special places.

name: Cooper & Fred
description: Cooper and Fred creates stylish hand-sewn products including banners and stockings, each of which can be customised with a choice of colours and prints. These items make great gifts for new parents, or simply to add a new touch of elegance to a child’s bedroom or playroom, and have received fantastic reviews since we launched in 2021. This team of one would love to create a bespoke, personalised decoration that’ll bring extra colour and joy to your home.

name: Cotswold Flora
description: Cotswold Flora is proud to grow British flowers sustainably, causing as little damage to the environment as possible. The flower beds and workshop are located on the farm in Winchcombe, Gloucestershire. We grow flower varieties which are vibrant and colourful once dried. They are then handcrafted into our unique Botanical Stag Head wall mounts.

name: Cottontail
description: Hi, I’m Emily and I’m the person behind Cottontail! Cottontail started out as a hobby, a way to fill my spare time whilst working as a teacher in Early Years. During my pregnancy with our first child during the COVID pandemic I enjoyed teaching myself the art of block printing and printed lots of muslins and clothing in preparation for our baby. I then decided to take the plunge and started to sell them online and my little business was born! Now it's gone from strength to strength and swiftly became my saving grace, something which has got me through some of life's toughest times.

name: Creature Clothes
description: Creature Clothes design & hand make cool kit for dogs & cats & their people. Founded in 1999, we pour the love & life that we share with our creatures into the products we create. Because the animals in our lives are more than pets. They're family. We make everything that we design in our Suffolk workshop or in our store in Brighton’s North Lanes. Our dog beds are washable (& won’t go lumpy), our collars are long lasting and beautiful. We love what we do & hope you do too.

name: Crinkly Cloth
description: I'm Jo Joof from Jo & Nic's Crinkly Cloth Books. My niece Meredith, now 17, was born blind and disabled and she inspired me to create a lightweight, tactile book that she could grip easily and is washable. In 2018 myself and Nic Moore created the Nursery Times, a range of children's sensory cloth books uniquely designed to look like little newspapers. Each cloth book is made up of six crinkly pages filled with bright, bold illustrations and rhyming text.

name: Crispin Finn
description: Crispin Finn specialise in practical paper-based goods and special editions. Their range has evolved from their iconic year planners to now include, a wide range of greeting cards, stationery, art prints and unique limited-edition items all in their renowned colour palette of red, white & blue.

name: Crooked Pickle Co
description: Looking for high quality, small batch pickles to perk up your food? Look no further!

name: Curious Fair
description: We create, luxury, heirloom masks, headdresses, & accessories for those who like to stand out from the crowd! Candlelit masquerade balls, wonderous woodland weddings, fabulous festivals, brilliant birthday bashes, our accessories are perfect for all of life’s celebrations! We are a small female team with backgrounds in theatre design & fine art, weaving magic into the everyday with our whimsical wares. Inspired by nature and the British woodland our ethereal creations are handmade at our Norfolk HQ from real feathers, dried blooms & natural findings.

name: Curly Thread Co.
description: Hello! Thanks for visiting Curly Thread Co.'s store! I'm Amy and I make original, feel-good hair accessories for you to feel your absolute best, and even more for the days when you don't! This little creative corner began from an incessant itch to reignite my creativity after many years, add in an obsession with collecting unique textiles, crafting and playing with hair - and voila! All my products are made from my tiny sewing room at home in Kingston Upon Thames.

name: D is for Dyslexia
description: Hi I’m George. I am a fourteen year old boy (should probably update my photo...); I am also: kind, thoughtful, funny, creative, sensitive, smart, DYSLEXIC. I have ADHD too, but I don’t want my neurodiversities to define me. Neurodivergence is not a choice, but an acceptance of it is. Through my products I am hoping to initiate positive conversation around neurodivergence, with the aim of raising self esteem and awareness for the neurodivergent community. Let’s celebrate the minds of ALL kinds.

name: Dalit Goods Co
description: Dalit Goods products are ethically sourced, eco-friendly and plastic free. Every purchase contributes directly to our mission of empowerment and providing employment. We work to highlight the injustice of the Dalit community in India and support the charity Life Association who have been building schools and children’s homes for more than 25 years. It started with a candle, handcrafted in Mumbai, providing dignified livelihoods and sustainable income opportunities. Dalit Goods now operates across India, bringing you coconut oil based soap from Kerala, hand-painted home décor pieces from Kashmir and so much more. At our core, we are committed to fostering positive change and social impact. By supporting Dalit Goods, you are not only embracing ethical consumption but also championing the rights and well-being of the Dalit people.

name: Dandy Star
description: Dandy Star strives to make you look good and your home to feel good. My ingredients are, a dash of colour, a positive message served with love to bring a smile. My designs are about distilling what is going on around me into a single statement. Words are reflections on life and yet remain playful. My visual identity and way of seeing the world is informed by my Art School training and the times I grew up in. I want the clothes and homeware I design to have an easy confidence. A t-shirt cannot change the world but the people that wear them can.

name: Darcie Olley
description: Hi! I'm Darcie Olley, an illustrator based in the east of England. Being able to draw and create everyday feels like a dream job! I use a mixture of acrylic, watercolour, gouache, pencil and digital techniques to make art, which I hope sparks joy in people. If I'm not painting, you might find me cooking up some exciting recipes in the kitchen, chilling out with some yoga, or trying to make friends with the neighbourhood cats.

name: Daria Solak Illustrations
description: Daria Solak is a Polish illustrator known for her vibrant, hand-painted illustrations that blend nostalgia with modern whimsy. A self-proclaimed '90s kid,' works full-time as an illustrator in her London studio. Her work primarily features female characters, animals, and playful patterns, often rendered in gouache, watercolour, and coloured pencils. Her distinctive style is characterized by bold colours, quirky textures, and a joyful, hand-crafted aesthetic. She likes to thing that her drawings make people smile.

name: Dashel
description: I wanted to find a bike helmet that would work for people like myself, who cycle about in everyday clothes. With a long career in design for luxury brands I decided to develop a helmet that would be a safer version of the cap I used to wear: lightweight, with a peak to keep the sun and rain at bay. At Dashel, good design is more than looks and even functionality, sustainability is at the core of everything we do. Our helmets are all manufactured in the UK with a commitment to 100% green energy manufacturing and waste reduction.

name: Dave Buonaguidi
description: I am a printmaker artist based in Hackney in London. In a past life I spent over 35 years working in advertising, co-founding several acclaimed creative agencies. Anytime that I'm not in the studio printing, you will find me trawling around auction sites and flea markets looking for interesting found images and ephemera that I can try and print onto. I use the techniques of mass communication and propaganda to create evocative pieces that connect in an emotive and humorous way. I like dogs, pink and Jaffa Cakes. I also played cricket for Italy.

name: Dead Mary's
description: All my furniture is designed and made by me out of trees that have fallen or been felled from in and around london. I like to create things that are elegant but do not take themselves too seriously. Playful yet simple design made with a utility and longevity in mind. Original ideas for furniture and products.

name: Dear Prudence
description: Hi I am Laura, the founder of Dear Prudence. The world of Dear Prudence is deeply entwined with nature and folklore - the character of animals, plants, trees, birds, the trappings and comforts of home and most of all, storytelling.
