My work is often inspired by my experience in with textiles. In my work I evoke the patterns, emotions and interwoven stories encapsulated by textiles to create emotive cards.

name: Debbie Fairbrass
description: Debbie Fairbrass is a botanical artist living by the sea in Kent, England. Growing up in the North of Ireland surrounded by orchards, glens and mountains and hearing tales of Irish folklore, inspired her fascination of the magic and mystery within nature. Debbie's background in jewellery design and couture embroidery along with her love of highly detailed craftmanship, influenced her to work with copper and brass as a new and exciting medium. She wanted to bring an intricate and ornate touch to a simple material such as metal. Specialising in ornamental arts, wreaths and sculptures, each piece is crafted entirely by hand using sustainable practices that will age beautifully over time developing a rich verdigris patina. This only adds to their charm and uniqueness. Every wreath is created with the intention of becoming treasured family heirlooms for generations to come.

name: Deborah Máire Nelson
description: Nestled on the edge of the wild Peak District, my atelier is a quiet sanctuary where the magic of the land and the rhythms of the seasons come alive. I am Deborah-Máire Nelson, a botanical artist who presses flowers, herbs, and grasses in harmony with nature’s own unfolding story. Each bloom is carefully gathered in its true season, then slowly pressed over weeks and often months, a patient ritual that captures not just the delicate beauty of the petals, but the whispers of folklore and memory they carry. Through this ancient craft, I preserve fleeting moments of nature’s enchantment, weaving tales of the earth into every pressed flower. This year, my work was honoured with five stars at the RHS Chelsea Flower Show a recognition that celebrates the quiet magic and timeless beauty of sustainably crafted botanicals. In my Atelier, I hold space for these stories, where petals become spells, and the passing of time is held gently between fragile leaves and stems

name: Decorum Tiles
description: Decorum create hand decorated tiles at our studio here in Cornwall. We take inspiration from everywhere – from the long tradition of blue and white Delft tiles from Holland to the glorious countryside and seascapes we call home and modern interior trends. If we love it, it’ll probably end up on a tile. We hope to bring a breath of fresh air and serious dose of joy into the homes of our customers. In all honesty, we love what we do and hope you do too.

name: DEEP Almond Butter
description: This is natural almond butter as it’s meant to be. Deep. Rich. Complex. Each jar contains Spanish Marcona almonds, known for their plump and buttery richness, along with Ferragnes almonds for their subtle sweetness. We roast, blend and jar every batch by hand, ready to be enjoyed by the spoonful, or in your favourite recipes. Our almond butters and caramel are made completely by hand - from the roasting process, to blending, jarring and labelling. We even break apart the almonds by hand to create our Crunchy variety, so no two jars are ever the same. We never add any fillers to our products; they're just simple, ingredients treated with the utmost attention to make them delicious.

name: Denim and Bone
description: Hi! I am Daisy, founder and dreamer behind Denim and Bone. One of my signature touches is the use of positive wording in my designs. I believe in the power of uplifting and empowering messages. Whether it's through embroidery or bold statements my pieces should evoke a sense of positivity and optimism to those who use or wear them. I hope you love my Holly and Co collection and find something that brings you joy.

name: Design Smith Studio
description: Design Smith is the creative partnership of Jude and Tina, based in Norfolk. Jude is the illustrator, drawing inspiration from vintage design, everyday objects, and popular culture to create distinctive greeting cards, limited-edition prints, paper goods, and tea towels brimming with character and nostalgia. Her bold designs and expressive mark-making breathe life into the everyday, celebrating its quiet beauty and timeless appeal. Tina is the planner, organiser, and logistical mastermind who keeps everything running seamlessly behind the scenes. Together, they balance creativity and precision to craft meaningful pieces that spark connection, stir memories, and bring a little joy to everyday life.

name: Designs By Louise
description: I'm Louise, a card designer and illustrator based in Staffordshire. Inspired by my love of bold colours and dopamine decorating, I create playful cards, prints and stationery with the aim of bringing colour and joy into people's homes.

name: Dicky Bird Cards
description: Dicky Bird is a small studio based in London. Coming from a design background, my aim is to bring something more simple and graphic to the world of greetings. I love clean shapes, beautiful colours and graphic patterns, and all my cards are printed in Kent on fine FSC certified papers. Dicky Bird cards have graced the shelves of Colette in Paris, Liberty of London, the Design Museum, Tate Modern & Britain and The Conran Shop - as well as many other amazing independents.

name: Dinette
description: I’m Marie-Claire, the founder and creative behind Dinette. I started this brand with a simple idea: to bring a dash of fun and a splash of colour to your dining table. At Dinette, we believe that every meal should be a celebration, and our illustrated table linens are designed to turn every dining experience into a delightful occasion. À bientôt and bon appétit!

name: Dingley Dell Creative
description: Hi, I'm Heidi the creative force behind the decorative nature inspired furniture. Designing and hand painting unique bespoke vintage furniture pieces whilst incorporating my passion for sustainability. Channeling inspiration from my daily walks in the woods and my love for all things decorative interiors. Helping to create homes as individual as we are.

name: Doggy Boho
description: With a degree in Fine Art and a dabble in Interior Design after leaving Art College. I am continuously inspired by art, colour, beautiful fabrics, and an unconventional bohemian style and artistic spirit. This is my inspiration when creating beautiful, handmade accessories for hounds who aspire to be noticed. The excitement of sourcing beautiful fabrics brings me great pleasure and escapism. It allows momentary respite and a chance to recharge before jumping back into the fray, of running a small business alone. Working for myself allows me to bring together my two great passions. Creativity and my love of dogs. There is nothing more rewarding than helping to cement the magical marriage of humans and their dogs with something as simple as a new piece of neck-attire!

name: Dohur
description: Dohur is a slow-living brand inspired by family stories and textile traditions. Although Dohur is inspired in part by the textile traditions of India, its identity – like mine – is linked to many different cultures. I was raised in India, lived in Norway and am now based in London. Along the way I have learned that many of the most meaningful aspects of those cultures – craft, tradition, giving – are in danger of being lost because we simply don’t take the time to understand or appreciate them.

name: Doppiocotto
description: Doppiocotto was founded in 2013 by Bora Cetin, a ceramic artist deeply passionate about his craft, dedicating long hours to shaping each piece by hand without using moulds. Focusing on form and material, Doppiocotto produces modern, original, and finely crafted pieces. The brand explores the harmony of contrasts by adding movement to simple forms and stillness to dynamic shapes, incorporating a playful touch to bring joy to people’s everyday lives.

name: Double Denim Kids
description: I source old jeans and repurpose them to produce lovely things for kids. Many of the jeans I use have rips, tears or stains, bringing them to the end of their life as an adult garment, but when washed and carefully disassembled, there’s plenty of denim left to create something new. Everything at Double Denim is designed to become a well-worn favourite that will last for many a kid's adventure.

name: Drifting Bear Co.
description: DRIFTING BEAR CO. We are David & Tanya, together with our small team we are an award winning small creative business working from our studio by the sea in South Devon. Specialising in unique typographic designs and lifestyle gifts, we have been creating personalised gifts since 2011. We use high-quality, sustainable materials wherever we can — including biodegradable packaging — and thanks to our customers we have planted over 96,000 trees all over the world.

name: Ducks in a row
description: Hi, I'm Lollie, here I am with my two little tinkers who are of course the inspiration behind my small business. I design wall decor for children in the hope that I can contribute in someway to creating imaginative spaces for them to learn, grow and play.

name: Earthsong Seeds
description: Hello! We are Sebastian and Ben, and we created Earthsong Seeds to share something we truly love; sowing seeds, watching them grow into beautiful plants and enjoying their health-giving potential. We especially want the seeds and plants we offer to encourage the tradition of the home apothecary; growing and making your own simple herbal health-remedies at home. Looking after ourselves takes many forms, and growing healing plants and then making them into various teas and potions, is something that we find thoroughly nourishing.

name: East End Press
description: East End Press specialises in handcrafted, high-quality printed decorations, gifts, and homeware. Designed in Glasgow and handmade in India, our products reflect our dedication to craftsmanship and ethical production practices.

name: Eco Magpie
description: Hello, I am Liz! I am known to friends as lady Magpie. I love finding dazzling and rare delights for my handmade crackers (which I started making at 5! But don't worry I have been to art college since then). Many of my designs are inspired by my love of travel, nature and disco dancing.

name: Eddie and Bee
description: What sets Eddie and Bee clothing apart? Standout prints, GOTS Standard Organic cotton, designed and made in the U.K. All of our leggings are made from organic cotton jersey and use low impact dyes. All other fabrics are sourced from a high-quality producer of Japanese printed fabric. They are all printed in small volumes which adds to the rarity and uniqueness of the fabric and helps to distinguish Eddie and Bee clothing from mass market, high-volume competitors. Every single item is either made by an incredible women run manufacturer in the U.K, or by me in my studio.

name: Eiderglass
description: Hello, I'm Frances and I'm a stained glass artist based in Marden in the Low Weald of Kent, and I make everlasting flowers, stems and wreaths. My botanical art is made in muted shades of opaque glass, inspired by British wildflowers and the foliage and flora found in local hedgerows. I also make limited runs of ceramic flowers and seeds, that can be combined with my stained glass or displayed individually. My vision for Eiderglass is to curate a shop of beautiful, nature-inspired glass art to enhance all interiors, to provide the highest levels of customer service, and to delight and bring joy to all who receive one of my designs.

name: EKA
description: I love crochet, that's it, that's everything! Creating something using just yarn and a hook feels incredible. I work together with a fair trade township Auroville to produce my timeless collection. EKA started as a hobby in 2003 when I was snowboarding, skip forward, a lot of time, and here we are! I live in the countryside with my lovely little family and Penny the dog. EKA has grown into my full time job and after all this time I still absolutely love what I'm doing.

name: Eleanor Joanna
description: I am Eleanor, a freelance Illustrator focusing on the themes of nostalgia, memory and dreams to inform my practice. I specialise in personalised products in my whimsical hand drawn style to give your gifts that special edge.

name: Elfie
description: Elfie is an independent British childrenswear brand offering equal doses of tradition and whimsy. As a homegrown British children’s brand, being original, charming and affordable are all high on our company’s agenda. Our aim is to provide fun, magical and durable designs. And our wish is to see families enjoying them from one generation to the next.

name: Ellen Lou
description: Hi - I'm Ellie. I am a jewellery designer-maker with a love for my garden. Whether, like me, you're a novice with crooked carrots, or rather, have been perfecting your cucumbers for thirty years - I hope you find something to make you smile amongst my gardening inspired jewellery adventures.

name: Eloise Rose Design Studio
description: I’ve always been drawn to the quiet beauty of old pieces - a faded jug on a Welsh dresser, a chipped plate that once sat at a grand table, the brushstrokes of a forgotten maker. That fascination turned into Eloise Rose Design Studio: a place where I could reimagine historical ceramics with a modern, painterly twist.

name: Elsie Moss Botanical
description: Elsie Moss Botanical is all about beautiful, natural, plant-based skincare and aromatherapy products, designed to raise your vibe, boost your mood and allow your natural glow to shine through. Our products transform ordinary, everyday rituals into moments of self-care. Whether that's taking a minute or two to wash your hands with a delicious smelling bar of soap, enjoying a wonderfully relaxing evening skincare regime, or taking a long, mineral rich soak in the bath - something we deeply believe we all deserve in our modern busy lives. Take a moment, breathe in the wonderful scents of the pure essential oils, and allow them to lift your soul. ​All of our products are handmade using naturally derived ingredients in Lisa’s Derbyshire based retail shop/workshop, on the edge of the beautiful Peak District.

name: ElviravvDesigns
description: Welcome to ElviravvDesigns. Founded by award-winning designer Elvira, my London-based brand offers a collection of pretty illustrated thank you cards & stationery inspired by nature.

name: Elvis & Kresse
description: Elvis & Kresse was established in 2005 to save London's decommissioned fire-hose, hoses that had become too damaged to repair and were going to landfill. We fell in love with these brave old hoses and mounted a rescue. Today, Elvis & Kresse's highly skilled craftspeople make beautifully designed accessories (bags, belts and wallets) and homeware from 15 different reclaimed materials. We now have several charitable partnerships and collaborations across industries. 50% of profits from the fire hose range go to The Fire Fighters Charity. 50% of the profits from our rescued leather pieces are donated to Barefoot College International. In 2021 Elvis & Kresse also took on a farm in order to establish a regenerative agriculture project, generate their own renewables and implement a host of environmental initiatives. Sustainable luxury since 2005: rescue, transform, donate.

name: Emena Home
description: Welcome to EMENA Home, a place where everyday moments are celebrated through handmade details. From fringed block-printed napkins, matching placemats, or fabric bread baskets, each piece is thoughtfully crafted from soft cotton fabric in small batches. Inspired by the warmth of gatherings and the beauty of simple living, our creations are made slowly, with care, and always with the planet in mind. Every item is designed to be reused, loved, gifted, and passed through many meals and memories, turning your table into the heart of the home.

name: Emily Edkins Illustration
description: Working predominantly with watercolour paint, I combine illustrations with hand lettered calligraphy details to produce clean and contemporary designs. I love keeping the magic alive for children and celebrating major milestones with beautiful paper keepsakes. I also adore working closely with clients on bespoke projects, original artworks, venue illustrations, wedding and event stationery.

name: Emily Nash Illustration
description: I’m Emily, an independent publisher of playful, punchy and planet friendly paper goods. I enjoy creating bright, fun and colourful imagery, using hand cut and digital collage. This is then transformed into high quality, sustainable stationery. I aim for my products to have as little impact on the environment as possible. I therefore only use recycled or FSC approved paper stocks and 100% recycled envelopes. Your orders will always arrive in plastic free and fully recyclable packaging

name: Emily Siân Hart
description: Hi, I'm Emily and I'm a crocheter living in Glasgow. I spend my days surrounded by yarn in my leafy little home studio. Everything in my shop is designed and handmade by myself. Here I am in my little studio with my whippet helper, Giles. I love creating joyful, colourful pieces for your home.

name: Emily’s Lollies
description: Hey, I'm Emily (She/Her) the owner and glitter and sprinkle addict behind Emily's Lollies, the home of handcrafted luxury lollipops for wedding, events and general consumption! During the process of organising my own wedding I had the idea of creating lollipop favours and started experimenting with colours and flavours (we had gin), I quickly discovered my love of making lollies and was urged by my Fiancé to start selling them.

name: Emlyn Delaney & Co
description: Hi there I’m Kate the founder behind EmlynDelaney&Co, a contemporary floral artist based in Sheffield. I have grown up with the cinematic and dramatic Peak District on my doorstep and this has created a lasting impression artistically and historically for me and is a huge inspiration for my profound love of the Mother of all, Mother Nature (I seriously suggest visiting if you haven’t already, it really does have that effect on you!) I create art on a variety of surfaces, with my exclusive range for Holly & Co being hand painted ceramics. Using both boldly simplified and distorted flora pieces I intend for my artwork to stir emotion and instantly strike a cord with those looking for a link to nature through art, with something that you can treasure for generations.

name: Emma Loizides
description: Emma Loizides is a British painter based in London. Emma creates oil paintings of candy hued street scenes, Twinkling skylines and playful paintings of ice cream vans, fast-food menus and all things americana. She spent a few years living in Las Vegas which has influenced her work, beaches, sunsets and palm trees feature in her paintings often. She often takes out the people and cars, capturing the peace in the early hours of sunrise. Her paintings of idealized landscapes are about escapism and enjoyment.

name: Emma Puddick Pottery
description: Hi there, I'm Emma. I make high quality, functional ceramics that bring joy to your everyday. My distinctive style combines beautiful, ergonomic forms that are thrown on the potters wheel with colourful hand-decorated designs inspired by vintage style, pop culture and traditional tattoos. I use a wide variety of surface decoration techniques including sgraffito, transfers, screen-printing, stencilling and carving to imbue as much colour and happiness into my work as I possibly can.

name: Enderra Luxury Gifts
description: Hi, I’m Gabriela…the face behind Enderra Luxury Gifts. My collection of personalised gifts is made from high quality materials and designed with an elegant yet unique touch. The focus of my embroidered products is on creating timeless designs that will be cherished for years to come; embracing colour and purpose in equal measure.

name: Eric & Albert
description: Hello! We're Rebecca and Martin at Eric & Albert - a small family business making sustainable wooden toys, by hand, based in the hills of Mid Wales. All of our toys are made and painted individually by hand, made slowly and carefully and with a big pinch of love! Each toy is carved individually and hand painted resulting in unique pieces and characters. We make everything as gently and sustainably as we can ensuring that we can have little magical toys without costing us the planet. Our toys are timeless, heirloom toys designed to last and be passed down through the generations. We feel that the stepping back to the traditional way of making things properly and slowly in a way that will last, brings as much joy to the makers as well as the children they're designed for.

name: esme and bird
description: Step into the vibrant world of pottery, where Deborah, a Yorkshire native now thriving in the serene landscapes of Staffordshire, crafts her masterpieces from the heart of her home courtyard studio. Surrounded by the picturesque countryside and ancient woodlands that serve as her inspiration, her journey as a ceramic artist began at Wolverhampton University, where she immersed herself in the intricacies of ceramics and 3D design.

name: Esther Kent
description: I'm an illustrator, designer and author with a love of pattern, wiggly lines and colourful, joy-filled homes. I hand-make richly patterned paper bird mobiles in my home studio, and design greetings cards, papergoods and jolly enamel mugs for you to use in your own home or gift with love. I'm often inspired by family life and that special place of play and wonder that small children are immersed in and us adults are often seeking to rediscover. My wish is that my designs spark happiness, create connection and bring a little bit of retro nostalgia wherever they go.

name: Every Story
description: Hello! We are Abby & Hannah, the sisters behind Every Story. We hand make ceramics from our studio in the Vale of Belvoir, nestled in rural Nottinghamshire. Explore our range of handmade ceramics to elevate your tablescape and home, from detailed mugs and plates, to elegantly rustic planters, vases and serving platters. Considerately crafted from natural clays, each piece is lovingly shaped and glazed to create the perfect piece to bring joy to your every day.

name: Evi Antonio
description: Butterflies symbolise rebirth and transformation. They have always featured heavily in my art, exploring themes of transformation and fragility in the forms of butterflies. I create small editions or one-of-a-kind pieces. I live life consciously, in appreciation for the smaller details of nature, striving to illuminate aspects of a subject that may go unnoticed. In a frenetic world, nature teaches us harmony and I am compelled to express this message through my art.

name: Evie & Skye
description: As designers of meticulously crafted home decor and children's products, we pride ourselves on offering a curated collection that transcends mere functionality, inviting our discerning clientele to elevate their living spaces with timeless beauty and refined style. With an unwavering commitment to quality, sustainability, and artisanal ingenuity, Evie & Skye London endeavours to create personalised atmospheres that resonate with the essence of our esteemed customers. Welcome to a world where every detail tells a story, and every piece embodies the epitome of luxury living

name: Ewenique Furniture
description: The Ewenique Furniture flock are a range of practical, sturdy and blissfully comfortable footstools who happen to be lifelike, near life-size, sheep. Created by myself in a small workshop on the Island of Portland within sight and sound of the sea, Ewenique Furniture is a range of wonderfully quirky but practical and sturdy sheep-shaped footstools. They are hand-made and combine realistically carved heads with deeply luxurious British sheepskin coats.

name: Excell Quilts
description: Kayleigh Excell is a designer and creator of landscape art quilts. With her signature abstract style, Kayleigh combines the traditional craft of quilting with modern design, to create striking textile art for inspiring spaces.

name: Exhale Healthy Coffee
description: Clocking up over 20 years together, Kirsty and Al share a love of all things outdoors, health and, of course, good coffee. After 15 years working in the corporate world (interspersed with 5 years of backpacking) they quit their hectic London jobs to launch Exhale in 2020. But it was Al's complex, 7-year health journey which spurred the move, after years of meticulous planning, research and then development...

name: Fabled
description: Fabled is on a mission to raise the most imaginative generation the world has ever known. We’re starting a movement to bring back the fairies and flying carpets. Consider this your training kit - an inspirational guidebook, tote bags and posters proclaiming our pledge: The Future is Make Believe! How can we build a better future if we can’t imagine one first? Save the green space in kids’ heads where the wild things live. Do it for them, do it for yourself. Let's make believe better.

name: Fake Food Workshop
description: My studio is a magical space of alchemy, where I stir up the finest raw materials, push the boundaries of technique, and experiment with recipes, methods and texture to create incredible inedible FAKE food. Blending a childhood in my grandmother’s kitchen, my father’s workshop, and then a career in museums and conservation all combine to bring a unique skill set to my fake food pantry. My clients include people who like gifting and unusual homeware. Also places like the National Trust, Disney, Warner Bros, TV and Theatre.

name: Fat Hen And Flo
description: Hi, I’m Susan, founder and Head of Everything at Fat Hen And Flo. From my studio on the often sunny Kent coast I design, screen print and make an assortment of pop culture idols. From mini Tinned Idols to huggable Idol cushions, I turn our favourite inspirational Idols into fun keepsakes making them the perfect gift for those that have everything except a Sew Your Own Kate Bush or huggable Pedro Pascal.

name: Fat Pom Poms
description: For me, Fat Pom Poms has never just been about yarn and fluff - it’s about colour, play, nostalgia, and finding happiness in the small things. Craft has been such a big part of my life and I love being able to share that spark with others, whether it’s through my tutorials, my kits, or just silly pom pom creations that make you smile. Thanks so much for being here - it means the world. I hope my pom poms bring a little bit of joy into your day. Love, Jess

name: Fatso
description: I'm Ella - Fatso Numero Uno (AKA Co-Creator) of super chunky, disruptor dark chocolate brand, FATSO. The idea for FATSO came when my two partners (in chocolate) and I started to ask the question: why is dark chocolate so boring, and why does milk chocolate have all the fun? I couldn’t ignore the urge to solve the problem. Our solution? A seriously chunky, fearlessly flavourful, uncompromisingly ethical dark chocolate brand, that doesn’t take itself too seriously. If you like your dark chocolate SINGLE-ORIGIN, your inclusions ABUNDANT, your flavour combos EPIC and your chunks COLOSSAL, we might just get along…. We believe MORE MATTERS, and it doesn’t stop at our product.

name: Faye Wellon Ceramics
description: Consciously hand-crafted ceramics for your home. Whether you’re looking for a unique gift or want to try making your own pottery, here you’ll find a stylish collection of beautiful modern-rustic stoneware for your home and pottery-by-post experience kits. Each product is individually made in small batches. Designed & hand-thrown in Herefordshire.

name: Feast of Flora
description: I’m Kat and I create one-of-a-kind homewares such as picture frames, mirrors, boxes and more! As the maker behind each creation, I take pride in infusing love and uniqueness into every piece I paint. Feast of Flora sells homewares and gifts that speak to those with an eye for beauty and a knack for cultivating cozy boho spaces. The majority of my pieces are second hand finds which have been stylishly up-cycled. I’m passionate about trying to lead a less wasteful life and it brings me a great deal of satisfaction to find second-hand items that I can transform into new beautiful statement pieces. Where possible I recycle packaging and am mindful of the products I use and the amount I throw away in creating my art. When you buy from me you are buying from someone who cares about their impact on the world and is trying hard to lessen their negative influence. I never know what gems I’m going to come across next so be sure to keep popping back to see what else I’ve found!

name: Fernandes Makes
description: Nicola Fernandes known as Fernandes Makes is an illustrator and painter making fun, quirky colourful nature inspired greeting cards and art prints. Nicola makes greats gifts for bird nerds and animal lovers of all ages. An aim with all of Nicola's work is to create literal laugh out loud moments and a sense of playfulness in her designs.

name: Fernweh UK
description: "Fernweh", meaning farsickness - an ache and longing for far off places, a craving for travel. A yearning to explore off the beaten path, into the unknown. Rugged, handcrafted goods and accessories, inspired by a passion for adventure. Designed and made in our Aberdeen studio.

name: Festive Fingerprints
description: Little fingerprints become bigger fingerprints over time and the cards become something to treasure. Take time out together as a family to make something special and know that whoever receives the card will feel closer to you, wherever they are in the world.

name: Fieldware Co
description: We are Fieldware. We are made in Somerset. We are handcrafted. Every day we do our upmost to be good, really good at what we do, designing and making workwear and functional products for garden, work and home. Forging a creative community of artisans and innovators who have both talent and passion for handmade. We like to call it 'The Art of Craft’

name: Fighter Shots
description: We are a UK based brand, with wellness drinks designed to give consumers the boost they’re craving. As winners of the 2020 and 2022 Great Taste Awards, we deliver a delicious range of products designed to boost immunity, reduce fatigue, and promote skin and joint health.

name: Fille Garcon
description: Fille Garçon was born from a deeply personal place. After two decades as a fashion buyer and becoming a mother, I found myself searching for something different—something that stood against the fast, throwaway fashion that had become all too common. I wanted to create pieces with meaning—beautifully crafted designs made to last, not just for a season, but for generations. The name Fille Garçon means "girl boy" in French—a reflection of my love for effortless European style and a belief that kids' fashion should be free from limits. Our pieces are gender-neutral, made for both girls and boys, because every child deserves clothing that embraces their individuality.

name: Fine Cell Work
description: Fine Cell Work is a charity & social enterprise committed to the rehabilitation of prisoners and prison leavers. Our aim is to support prisoners and prison leavers to finish their sentences with skills, money earned & saved, and the self-belief to rebuild meaningful, independent, crime-free lives. We do this by teaching them soft work skills, and by training and paying them to produce exquisite needlework, create beautiful cushions & gifts for sale. Fine Cell Work's intricately-stitched products have been created in collaboration with some of the country’s leading contemporary designers, with the majority stitched by hand in UK prisons and in our post-release workshop in Battersea, London.

name: Fiona Hamilton
description: I am a multi-disciplinary artist and printmaker based in Bristol and I have a master’s degree in printmaking from The University of the West of England. I make my artwork in Spike Print Studio where I print everything by hand on one of their fabulous presses. This collection of art prints and greeting cards has been inspired by my love of nature, particularly birds, and is printed using high quality specialist papers and inks including GF Smith Kraft, Gmund Gold, and Zerkell wood engraving paper.

name: Fireater Letterpress
description: Fireater makes posters and stationery, and when we say makes we mean designs, prints and finishes using traditional letterpress print methods. Matt (Fireater) has made it his mission to try to produce posters in a modern aesthetic but just truly using the equipment, tools and type of and age that is getting forgotten.

name: Fitz and Gwen
description: At Fitz and Gwen, we believe lighting should do more than illuminate - it should spark joy. Our handmade lampshades blend clean contemporary fabrics with bold bursts of colour, bringing personality and warmth to any space. Crafted with care, each piece is a little work of art, designed to stand out and last. Whether you're after a showstopping centre piece or a subtle touch of charm for your bedroom nook, there's a shade waiting for you here.

name: Fleur Pressée
description: Hi, I’m Daisy a flower preservation artist based in Northeast London. I launched Fleur Pressée in lockdown turning my gardening passion of growing cut flowers into pressed flower artworks. Many of the flowers I press are from my own garden and carefully selected from the surrounding countryside and sustainable sources. Fleur Pressée celebrates every petal, stem and detail of the flower. Each botanical element is preserved, making the artwork a true one of a kind piece.

name: Fleurs d'hiver
description: While studying design at ECAL in Switzerland I started learning about wellbeing and alternative medicine. Through my fascination for holistic practices I created useful, poetic and comforting products. On my journey I met an herbalist who’s ethos spoke to me. They were dedicated to promoting the health benefits of its local produce, primarily honey and plants, and how in combining these you reap the best rewards. It was then that Fleurs d’hiver was born. Herbal teas that are as beautiful as they are enriching. Teas that tells a story when you prepare and drink them.

name: Flingo & Swollop
description: Luxury Dress Up for cheeky kids. Flingo and Swollop aims to put a smile on your face. Celebratory clothing for parties, festivals, holidays in fact every days a fabulous day in Flingo & Swollop. Rainbow birds, Bubblegum Octopi, Ice cream Queens, Flying Leopards. Crazy clothing to inspire you in play! Leotards, leggings, sweatshirts, accessories and more. Easy to wear and care for with an emphasis on organic cottons and recycled stretch Econyl fabrics. All lovingly handmade in Abbys East London Studio.

name: Flora Fricker
description: Hello, my name is Flora and welcome to my shop! I am a graphic designer, based in Bristol designing and selling paper goods. My style is inspired by moments of nostalgia, vintage typography, & ephemera. I like to seek out the quirks and imperfections of the everyday. Thank you for stopping by!

name: Flora Scott Designs
description: Hello, I'm Harriet, the obsessive marbler behind Flora Scott Designs. I started this business to share the beauty of the wonderful craft of paper marbling. I love finding new ways for marbled paper to be incorporated into the home through decorative pieces, seasonal items and gift wrapping.

name: Florence and Bunny
description: We are a luxury kid’s dress up brand that is stylish and super fun! At Florence and Bunny we believe that dressing up isn't just about putting on a costume it's about igniting the imagination, building confidence, and fostering creativity. When a child slips into one of our creations they embark upon a magical journey and become the narrators of their own unique adventures.

name: Flower & Fable
description: We are Karen & Ben Lambert, artisan jewellers, working together from our workshop in beautiful Snowdonia. We use real flowers to create vintage & floriography inspired jewellery, using a mixture of traditional and specifically developed techniques. We believe that jewellery should feel like a gift, whether for yourself or for someone else, so it should be beautifully packaged. From eco-packaging and hand dyed bamboo silk ribbons, to our seasonal, scented dried flower posy, we love attention to detail, and for Karen, it's a favourite part of the process.

name: For Just One Day
description: For Just One Day is a love of costume, dressing up, festivals, circus, vintage and magic! Handmade in small batches by me, Becky, each item is designed, cut, sewn and sprinkled with magic in my atelier (home studio), based in south Manchester. My collection is made of items to be loved and worn for childhood adventures, from dress-up to scattering flowers down the aisle. Then, when the time is right, passed on for the next child to treasure and enjoy. Each items colour fade, patched hole, replaced button and fraying edge adding to its charm.

name: for peat's sake!
description: Treat your plants to our peat-free, eco-coir compost. Light and clean, it’s a joy to use. You can’t plant in anything better. Simply add water, and watch our dehydrated block of coconut coir compost expand and grow into the optimum soil for your plants. Made from sustainably and ethically sourced waste coconut husk, our peat-free compost is perfect for a huge range of plants from houseplant & herbs to veg, seeds & flowers.

name: Forage Somerset
description: I am Nicola, a natural Wanderlust. Often being asked “Where did you get that from?” I began this journey that is Forage Somerset, curating a collection of beautiful, affordable & mostly unique pieces sourced on my global travels

name: Forge Creative
description: At Forge Creative, we craft thoughtful homeware that blends functionality with beauty. Founded by designer-maker Josh Kennard in 2013, our pieces are made with care in our rural Sussex workshop. Inspired by nature and the unique grain and character of wood, we pair organic materials with clean, minimal design. Each piece - from hand-turned Trees to chopping boards - is made to be cherished for years to come.

name: Fox in the Attic
description: Baby muslins, prints, cards, tea towels, bags and custom illustrations, all from my own watercolour paintings.

name: Fraser's Mulled Wine
description: We make our mulled wine by hand in Leyton, East London using simple, fresh & all natural ingredients. Our mission is to recreate the best mulled wine you can make yourself at home (only we do it for you!). Made in small batches with award-winning Tempranillo red wine, organic spices & the freshest of citrus, it then goes straight into bottles and pouches to deliver to your door! Described by wine expert Henry Jeffreys as ‘the best mulled wine he ever tasted,’ we have now been voted ‘Best upmarket mulled wine’ by BBC Good Food two years in a row. We were also delighted to be invited onto James Martin Saturday Morning, where James and guests enjoyed our mulled wine, and even poached pears in it.

name: Fruit Bodhi Mushrooms
description: We are a literal family. The team consists of me (Tom), my wife, my mum, my dad, my sister, a couple of very close friends and of course my two children Ophelia and Otis. Our ethos is built on family values and connecting with what is essential in life. This includes family relationships but also our relationship with nature and particularly the fungal kingdom. As a team, we specialise in growing mushrooms. We love growing mushrooms so much that we decided to produce a mushroom growing kit for the likes of yourself to try at home.

name: Fungo
description: At Fungo, we hand-blend functional herbal teas designed to support focus, memory, and wellbeing — without the caffeine. Our Elevate blend starts with organic Lion’s Mane mushroom extract, known for its brain-boosting benefits. We pair it with carefully chosen herbs and spices like tulsi, turmeric, ginger, and cinnamon — all sourced from small-scale organic farms in Sri Lanka. Every ingredient is selected for a reason, and we only use what’s needed — no fillers, no flavourings, nothing artificial. We craft our teas in small batches and taste every blend ourselves to make sure it’s as delicious as it is functional. Our goal? To make it easy (and enjoyable) to support your mind, every single day. We’re a small team, doing things properly — and proud to be bringing a little more calm, clarity, and connection to your daily brew.

name: Furrtastic Empurrium
description: Hello - I'm Emily! I love to create work that makes people laugh and smile. Furrtastic Empurrium is inspired by my strong imagination, combined with animal and people watching. I bring to life my illustrations using stoneware fired clay. I individually hand build all of my animals; wild and domestic from my garden workshop. My work is exhibited in galleries across the country. I also make personalised commissions, mainly of cats and dogs from photographs; sometimes with interesting requests!

name: Gabriella Moxey
description: Hello! I’m Gaby, the creator of The Painted Wreath. I'm a multi-disciplinary artist consistently distracted by the decorative arts. I live in Dorset with my filmmaker husband, delicious toddler, Griff and regal Golden Retriever, Beverly. I spent most of my twenties honing the craft of portraiture, but since having my little boy I've found creating beautiful things like my wreaths are a total salve for the soul...and a little easier to make in between bouts of parenting!

name: Gavin Coyle Studio
description: Gavin Coyle Studio is a contemporary craft workshop based in Walthamstow, East London. Working predominantly in timber our work explores the interaction between traditional skills and modern techniques.

name: Gavin Dobson
description: Hi! Gavin here. Welcome to my store! Thanks for visiting my page and I hope you enjoy browsing through my products. My screen-prints are often a celebration of the object itself. Infused with a sense of nostalgia and situation, they bright and colourful, hopefully inviting an opening for conversation. Always handmade and always by me.

name: Gemma Wightman Ceramics
description: Hi! I'm Gemma, clay enthusiast, founder, and chief maker at Gemma Wightman Ceramics. I spend my days elbow-deep in porcelain, crafting luxury tableware in my Surrey studio alongside my little tribe of animals: Sizzles the sausage dog, golden retriever Maggie, and mischievous tortoise Tommy. I love creating tactile, beautiful pieces that you’ll use and enjoy every day, bringing luxury handmade joy into your home.

name: Genevieve Sweeney
description: I’m Genevieve, founder and knitwear designer of my luxury British knitwear label, Genevieve Sweeney. Creating unexpected knitwear that is forever practical, beautiful and responsibly made. I am based in Hertfordshire, mum of two beautifully wild young boys and two fluffy cats. Knitting has always been apart of me. I have always loved how knitting connects people and brings an element of total comfort like a warm hug. I launched my brand in 2015 to help revitalise a disappearing industry in the UK and to support artisans and family run factories to create beautiful enduring knitwear, made to be cherished. Discover sumptuous, timeless knitwear for womenswear, menswear, accessories and socks.

name: George Frederick
description: George Frederick is a British jewellery and accessory designer whose creative philosophy embraces hedonism, blending elements of fantasy, heritage, romanticism and the natural world. His work often defies conventional boundaries, offering a fresh perspective on wearable art. The George Frederick universe is a meticulously curated fusion of these inspirations, inviting individuals to immerse themselves in a world where fashion meets art and self-expression reigns supreme.

name: Gilbert and Stone
description: A little bit country, a little bit rock 'n roll... Hi, I'm Kate. I've been working with clay for over 20 years and love to design and make bright, fresh, modern ceramics with a handmade feel and a sense of humour. All Gilbert and Stone products are handmade by me in my small workshop in the Cornish countryside.

name: Gin In A Tin
description: Gin In A Tin creates bespoke collections of gin delivered straight to your door as individual tins, gift sets, or personalised tins. Distilled in small batches at 40% ABV, each London Dry Gin has different botanicals derived from changing seasonal influences, with distinctive tastes and a bold statement, whilst remaining 100% natural and being lovingly crafted right here in the UK.

name: Ginte Zacharini
description: I’m Ginte Zacharini, a contemporary artist. In my artistic journey, I find inspiration from various aspects of my life, drawing from my experiences as a business person, a mother, and a woman in today's world. I strive to reflect these diverse perspectives in my artworks, creating pieces that resonate with people on a personal level and evoke emotions. One of the subjects I explore in my art is food, which serves as a powerful symbol of our culture. Through my works, I metaphorically use food to represent significant life-changing events or various societal issues. While interpretations may vary depending on the viewers, my intention is always a positive perspective.

name: Glass Cathedrals
description: I’m Lisa Swerling, an artist making miniature worlds in boxes called Glass Cathedrals. Inspired by the power of the miniature to communicate big ideas and emotions, I've spent nearly twenty years making thousands of artboxes - in Cape Town, California, and now London. Described as "little pockets of joy", Glass Cathedrals remind us that we are all the heroes of our own stories, and that finding delight in small moments is a superpower we can turn on in the blink of an eye.

name: Gloag and Daughters
description: Hi, welcome to the Gloag and daughters page. We have  beautiful and practical rails that are really strong and solid enough for daily use in a busy home! We really hope you will enjoy using them as much as we enjoyed making them. Let's make 2025 all about  layered vertical storage! There is something so satisfying about reclaiming a bit of work top by hanging everything up! Of course whilst mixing in beautiful flowers and herb bunches and  random family nicknacks :) The problems we wanted to solve were to make a rail strong enough for a heavy cast iron pot, with hooks that stay on and don't come pinging off and end up behind the cooker! The hooks had to be wide enough to take any pan handle and strong enough to not bend. Also it had to look amazing! Chris, Deniz and Vermilion have worked on the design, admin and development of the products and Heidi and Summer have got really excited about what colours the rails should be and of course boxing up of the rails in our plastic free boxes.

name: Glow Lighting Ltd
description: The idea for Glow Lighting came from a simple desire - to help people step away from mass produced lighting and create something unique for their homes or workspace. Our lighting is all designed and created in Ripon, North Yorkshire. The components are sourced very carefully using British manufacturers, the majority of which are produced by local craftsmen. It has always been a passion of mine to support British manufacturing and allow people the opportunity to buy British wherever possible, as well as enabling people to buy bespoke beautiful lighting at reasonable prices.

name: godi.
description: Hello! I’m Nadim; designer/maker of minimalist leather goods. My journey with godi started in 2014 with a vision to create Timeless yet Modern leather pieces with Minimalism at the heart. In 2019, I officially launched my first collection after leaving my full-time career as an Occupational Psychologist. My designs are inspired by elements of Modern Architecture and Positive Psychology with an intention to bring a sense of Joy and Peace through my pieces.

name: Goodchap's
description: We are an award winning, eco friendly, plastic free brand specialising in products for human and hound. Our passion is to ensure that our canine family members enjoy healthy, high-quality treats and toys, whilst keeping our environmental impact low

name: Goodwin & Goodwin
description: We are designers, neon glass blowers, sign writers, welders, engineers and fabricators with a love of design and a passion for traditional sign making techniques. Paul, one half of Goodwin & Goodwin, is making good use of his passion for typography and his award winning career as Creative Director at one of London’s top design agencies - to produce an ever growing range of covetable signs. Viviane is the other half of Goodwin & Goodwin runs the operations, and she hung up her global-roaming HR heels to focus on the quickly increasing demand for their signage.

name: Grace James
description: Hi, I’m Lucy… I would love to say I have a degree in fashion and design but the truth is, I’m a mother who wanted to learn how to sew. From as long as I can remember, I’ve always wanted to create but I never had the confidence to try. I grew up watching my talented family of bakers and dress makers and witnessed the hard work that it took. Creating is in the blood but I never experimented with this until after the birth of my second child. Now I’m making up for those lost years of not using my hands by creating all things Liberty for mother and baby.

name: Granny Gothards Artisan Ice Cream
description: Here at Granny Gothards our wonderful (almost all female!) team hand make luxurious 'restaurant quality' ice creams and sorbets using only the best, natural ingredients. Our small team of 5 produce artisan ice cream in 20litre batches with milk fresh in from the first milking at Oak Park Dairy, Devon double cream, Somerset egg yolk and our 'secret sugar blend' unique to Granny Gothards. No skimmed milk powders, no colouring, flavours or preservatives - just the very best that Mother Nature offers, made into ice cream!

name: Growbar
description: Welcome to the wonderful world of Growbar! These cleverly curated, ready to grow seed collections have been created by the green-fingered team behind The Gluttonous Gardener, one of the UK’s most-loved gift companies. Growbar brings a distinctly modern twist to the art of gardening, making it easy and enjoyable for everyone.

name: Gus & Beau
description: We want to give playtime a grown-up twist and believe that tummy time can be fun and trendy. Our playmats will grow with your babies every step of the way. Designed in simple patterns and muted tones to fit in with your interiors. We use the highest quality non-toxic foam. The best part? It is wipe-clean!

name: Gwenyn Gruffydd
description: Gwenyn Gruffydd was founded in 2010 when Gruffydd decided to follow his dream of keeping bees. Gruffydd was kindly given a hive of bees by a friend farming locally and it is from there the dream developed into a reality. Gruffydd enrolled onto a beekeeping course in Carmarthenshire that year and the 1 hive in the back of his mum and dad's garden quickly multiplied into over 200 beehives, dotted around rural South Wales today. The 100% pure, minimally filtered, unpasteurised (raw) Welsh honey that we produce has won numerous Great Taste Awards over the years and in 2024, our Welsh Wildflower Honey was awarded 3-stars meaning the judges class it as an 'exquisite extraordinarily tasty' honey. Gruffydd cares for all of our bees and I, Angharad (Gruff's wife) takes care of the business and produce all of our pure beeswax candles in our candle making studio on our honey farm.

name: Habulous
description: Hand produced not mass produced. Welcome to the world of Habulous Ceramics, where craftsmanship meets creativity!At Habulous we take pride in handcrafting pottery pieces right here in the heart of Great Britain. We're not just about ceramics; we're about infusing happiness and fabulousness into every piece we create. Habulous Ceramics’ approach revolves around the unique charm of small batch production, ensuring that each item is meticulously handmade. We're driven by an unwavering commitment to ethics and sustainability, crafting our ceramics with love and care to align with our planet-friendly values.Our ceramics are more than just beautiful objects; they are thoughtfully designed and produced to stand the test of time. When you choose Habulous Ceramics, you're not only supporting a conscious lifestyle, you’re supporting a small, British business who utilise traditional methods. Our ceramics are made from British clay, and as part of our dedication to sustainability, we prioritise eco-conscious practices at every stage of production.

name: Halen Môn
description: We specialise in interesting, unusual and delicious sea salt and seasonings that bring depth and flavour to your cooking.

name: Handmade Sussex
description: My dried flower products are handmade from my home in West Sussex. Every product is unique, crafted from natural flowers and foliage that I have foraged from the local countryside.

name: Hangers and Macrame
description: Hello, My name is Mina. I am a macrame designer, making luxury macrame products for your home. I have a wild obsession with plant hangers and use only natural and sustainable materials to create the perfect accessories for your home & plants. My designs are beautifully detailed, unique, and inspired by the 70's vintage macrame movement. My vision is to dress up your home one hanger at a time.

name: Hanna Buck
description: I’m Hanna, an abstract artist based on the East Anglian coast. My work is all about colour, texture, and emotion—capturing feelings and turning them into expressive pieces to bring joy and vibrancy into your home. Explore my collection of limited-edition prints, greeting cards and exclusive original artworks.

name: Hannah Bourn
description: An award-winning jewellery designer, Hannah's intricate sculptural pieces are reminiscent of the sea, respectful of the earth, and carry the message of something both beautiful but fragile, which has the potential to re-connect the wearer to the world from which they came from. Hannah’s work is lovingly handmade in her Lincolnshire studio, demonstrating quality, craftsmanship, sustainability and creating sensory artefacts to treasure both now and in the future.

name: Hannah Carvell Screen Prints
description: Hannah Carvell is a Screen Printer, printing from her home studio in Somerset. Always bright colours that inject happiness into the art that she makes, whether that be with overlapping shades and shapes in abstract pieces or printing strange made up creatures, colourful hearts and flowers or pink gorillas. Hannah will always come back to a Dachshund in her sketches and they feature heavily in her prints. "I can’t resist them, my earliest memory is being in a pram with a litter of sausages, I have grown up with them, I had my own when I left home for Art college and currently Minnie Moomin is my printing assistant with a bed under my desk." I hope my art will always add a pop of colour to brighten up the walls of your home and spark joy when you walk into a room.

name: Hannah Heys Textiles
description: Hi, I am Hannah  an Artist & Designer, handcrafting homewares using Textiles & Ceramics. I carefully curate the materials and techniques that I use to create my high quality Rugs, Cushions, Vases & Wall Hangings to ensure they make a statement in any home. Each piece is unique, designed and handcrafted by me in my Buckinghamshire studio. All of my Wall Hangings, Rugs and Cushions are created using Reclaimed Yarns and British Wool.

name: Hannah Shillito
description: Hannah Shillito is a contemporary artist who has lived all over the world including Tokyo, New York, London, Cape Town, the Himalayas and Milan and is now based in Brighton. Her work has drawn attention from celebrities with clients including social media sensation Arron Crascall, Ru Paul superstar Bagachipz and punk poet John Cooper Clarke as well as Bimini Bon Boulash in a Barclaycard advert! She has recently had a smash solo show in Ibiza, collaborating with David Bowie’s official photographer, Mick Rock, and working closely with the iconic Concept Hotel group.

name: Hanne Rysgaard
description: Greetings! Welcome to my world of joyful porcelain creations. Handcrafted in sunny Bristol, each piece embodies my passion for infusing love, life, colour, and joy into your daily life. Practical yet exciting, my porcelain collections ensure smiles in your experiences. Embrace the unique variations, as each item is genuinely handmade, making them as special as you are. Enjoy using my milk jugs, cups, mini houses, and necklaces to brighten your everyday moments with vibrant charm. Warm regards and BIG love, Hanne Rysgaard.

name: Happy Heads Food Co.
description: At Happy Heads Food Co, we hand craft delicious organic granola worthy of sharing with those you love. After countless iterations we've perfected our recipes, striking the ideal balance of flavour, texture and nutrition. All this is hand crafted whilst using eco packaging that has little impact to our planet. Choose from our three core flavours and look out for limited seasonal specials!

name: Happy Rainbow
description: Hello, and welcome to Happy Rainbow, my small business. I am Molly, a 12 year old kidpreneur with a dream to share positivity across the world. I want Happy Rainbow to be a positive place for positive people. I create designs for prints and cards, with messages of positivity, strength and joy at their heart. I like the idea that something I have painted or designed has the power to brighten someone’s day, and to make people smile and feel good about themselves.

name: Happy Sunday Studio
description: At Happy Sunday Studio, we believe in the magic of simple, beautiful design that brings joy to everyday spaces. Born from a love of thoughtful interiors and inspired by the playful charm of childhood, our collection of hand made fabric wall hangings are designed to spark creativity, encourage positivity, and add a touch of warmth to your home.

name: Harbour Hounds
description: Hi, I’m Sarah, the founder of Harbour Hounds. A practical and nautically stylish brand for dogs and their humans. My combined love of the beach, dogs and the fun and beauty of coastal living, has been my inspiration. My vision is to provide everything you and your four-pawed pal need for a great day out at the beach, around water, or simply for life in general. Harbour Hounds is Eco-Friendly and partners with marine conservation charities. I hope you love my brand.

name: Harbour UK
description: Hey, I’m Pablo, founder of Harbour UK in London. Since 2015, I’ve dedicated myself to creating handmade bracelets that celebrate quality and individuality. Inspired by a mix of cultural influences, each piece is crafted knot by knot, from scratch, right here in London. These timeless designs are made for daily wear, offering a unique blend of style and durability. At Harbour UK, we believe quality is key to sustainability. By creating pieces designed to last, we help reduce the need for repeat purchases, offering something special, eco-friendly, and built to endure. Harbour UK is more than a brand—it’s a celebration of thoughtful craftsmanship and sustainable choices.

name: Harewood Homeware
description: Hello, we're a father (Gary) and son (Tref), designer and maker duo. We create timeless pieces, with a playful twist - often using rare materials to ensure you won't find treasures like ours anywhere else. We want to help you add even more fun and personality to your playful home, through our one-of-a-kind handmade furniture pieces.

name: Harriet Says Hi
description: Hi, I'm Harriet! Welcome to my colourful world of foodie-themed homeware. I hope it brings a smile to your face!

name: Harriet Watson
description: I’m Harriet, an illustrator with a love of the great outdoors. I was fortunate enough to have grown up in the beautiful Norfolk countryside and think this shines throughout my work. I take a lot of inspiration from rural living and have a great love for flowers. My joyful designs take shape in the form of greeting cards mainly, but also wrapping paper, prints and stationery. Everything is painted in rich gouache then printed on beautiful, eco-friendly materials making each one special.

name: Harris & Jones
description: We know that finding the right accessories to furnish your home or interior can be challenging. From our Rural Workshop in Bedfordshire, our dedicated team uses traditional skills to create accessories individually designed with specific spaces in mind. With numerous personalisation options, no two products need to be the same: perfect for special gifts and accessorising your home.

name: Harry Rocks London
description: Harry Rocks remains an independent British brand with a mission to create gorgeous, timeless, unique pieces that reflect who you are. Heavily inspired by our love for crystals and astrology, we believe our collections are perfect for building your own versatile jewellery collection. Our necklaces can be layered and interchangeable earring charms, give you more wear from one pair. Our jewellery is a mix of fun, playful, eclectic styles and personalised, antique-inspired pieces.

name: Harry Specters
description: Great flavours and positive social change, that's us at Harry Specters. Mona, Shaz, and their son Ash, who is autistic, are behind this social enterprise. Dedicated to crafting the most delicious chocolates that create employment for autistic people. You'll find the hustling and bustling chocolate factory in Ely, where autistic people are involved in every aspect of the business – from making and packaging the products to administration, design and photography.

name: Harry's Hot Chocolate
description: We are a family owned business based in Cheshire, England. Owned and run by Harry & Chloe, with a little help from our dog Ginny. We are proud to produce what we think are some of the finest hot chocolates and baked goods on the market from our tiny little factory in the countryside.

name: Harth Chocolate
description: We work in a small workshop on the outskirts of Bath producing a range of hot chocolate, milkshake, filled bonbons and bars. We go to great lengths to ensure all of our packaging is plastic free and can easily be recycled or biodegrade once finished. We only use 100% organic chocolate and cocoa. We want to ensure that a little treat does as little harm as possible and perhaps even a little good.

name: Hattie Buckwell
description: Hattie works from her sunny studio, painting with watercolour & ink to paint an illustrated world. Look closely to see the tiny surfers amongst inky turquoise waves and secret pools for wild swimming!

name: Hattie McGill Embroidery
description: Based in a little studio in my cottage in Hertfordshire (often accompanied by my Border Terrier Rigby), I create intricate hand embroidered accessories and embroidery kits. Specialising in the interesting technique of Goldwork embroidery, I aim to make embroidery accessible to all by using traditional heirloom techniques for modern pieces. Having trained at the Royal School of Needlework, I have a deep passion for my craft, which began at the age of three, with a project for my Mother on Mother’s day. Since then, I’ve been hooked on embroidery. I currently split my time between my business and embroidery for costume in the film and TV industry.

name: Haus of Lucy
description: I'm Haus Of Lucy, a contemporary multi-media artist. I am obsessed with marrying together the old fashioned and unloved with the contemporary, whether it's an oil painting, a ceramic figurine or a vintage plate. Since quitting my old life as a magazine designer, I have worked with Adidas, Footlocker, Lazy Oaf, Primark and Greggs (I'm STILL waiting for that lifetime's supply of vegan sausage rolls). I thrive on creating a contrast between old and new, urban and classic.

name: Hawkens Gingerbread
description: Founded by Alastair Hawken, Hawkens Gingerbread is celebrated for its rich blend of tradition and exceptional flavour. Alastair’s passion lies in creating the finest baked goods, driven by an unwavering commitment to quality and craftsmanship. Each artisan product, from perfectly spiced biscuits to intricately detailed creations, showcases his dedication to excellence and timeless taste, making Hawkens Gingerbread a true staple for those who appreciate authentic indulgence.

name: Helen Beard
description: Helen Beard is an internationally acclaimed ceramicist and illustrator. She takes inspiration from the world around her and sketches charming and whimsical scenes from our everyday lives. Her 'Dailyware Collection' is hand made in Stoke-on-Trent, using fine English bone china. Her simple ceramic shapes form the canvas for her playful illustrations, portraying her observations of contemporary life.

name: hello DODO Kids
description: Hello! We are Jam and Ali, the husband and wife team behind hello DODO Kids. Established in 2011, hello DODO Kids is a bright and bold range of fun, empowering and often "punny" designs that we have created to spread smiles! Each of our lovely ethically made pieces are hand screen printed by ourselves with lots of love and attention to detail. Nothing gives us more joy then seeing kids having fun whilst wearing hello DODO Kids!

name: Hello Time
description: Organise the chaos of life with our award-winning, undated planners & time-gifting stationery. The award-winning HELLO TIME Planner is your personal daily organiser. The smart, well-planned layout means organising your life has never been easier. Manage multiple tasks, stay on top of your work schedule, family time, to-do lists, notes, goals & ideas all in one place. Our minimal, timeless aesthetic and simple, flexible layouts are not at all prescriptive. We give you loads of space to declutter your mind, helping you become more intentional with your time.

name: Hetty's Kitchen
description: We make fudging delicious brownies from our kitchen in an Old Match Factory in Gloucester. Thoughtful about what we make & how we do it, we proudly support local artisans like Shipton Mill, plus only free-range eggs, un bleached sugar & unsalted butter. A team of brownie loving bakers, fanatical as founder Hetty about making them properly: always fudgy never cakey! We want our bakes to be the stuff of your dreams! And WE want to FEEL GOOD about what we make for YOU!

name: Hevensent
description: Hevensent Story Wallpapers is a unique collection of stories and memories, with each design telling a personal story. Rabbits Racing in Bugatti Cars is about our Mr White Rabbit who liked to play football and vanish for long periods of time. Whenever Mr Rabbit disappeared, we made up stories of his daring adventures, racing sports cars in Monte Carlo. Each design starts as a twinkle of a memory, with photos for reference, pencil sketches layers of colour to create an original design. All our wallpapers are made in the UK. We partner with 100-year-old wallpaper manufacturers who work their magic fusing modern techniques with traditional heritage processes such as hand-screen printing metallics. With each roll sale, we donate to the Woodland Trust.

name: Heykiddostudio
description: Heykiddostudio knitted wire word signs are designed to celebrate all kinds of kiddos. From the book lovers to the wallflowers, adventurers and little superheroes. All children deserve to feel seen, special and loved. Our personalised custom name signs are designed to give your little one a sense of pride and a space to call their own. We have sourced the most beautiful, 100% cotton yarn with a Scandi Style muted colour palette to create our knitted cord with - made to decorate the most beautiful kid's spaces. Heykiddostudio wall hangings make the perfect gift for a new mum and their newborn baby, toddlers, preschool kids or simply as a decoration to hang in your child's bedroom. Our knitted wire art is designed to complete any modern nursery or beautifully styled play room. NEW - I have expanded my range of products and now offer kids wall art prints to inspire your little ones and brighten up their rooms! I hope you love them.

name: Heyrlome
description: A collection of modern heirlooms. Authentically designed to empower, reminding each of us of our personal journeys. Each piece is crafted with recycled 925 sterling silver and plated with 18ct gold vermeil plating, and only feature natural gemstones. Tell your story with pendants, charms and discs on your choice of necklaces, bracelets and earrings. Each piece has a unique and special meaning built into the roots of its design, so you can make your jewellery a true reflection of who you are. Our concept is based around mix and matching, with each meaningful piece designed to be worn multiple ways. Swap them around, keep things simple or create a statement piece - the choice is yours.

name: Hillfarm Oils
description: At Hillfarm, we believe the best ingredients come from a deep respect for the land and an obsession with quality. Grown, pressed and bottled on our family farm in Suffolk, our cold pressed extra virgin rapeseed oil is the product of generations of farming expertise, crafted with care from soil to shelf. Our oils are golden in colour, nutty in flavour and naturally rich in omega-3, vitamin E and antioxidants. With a high smoke point and a velvety smooth finish, Hillfarm oil is as versatile as it is delicious – whether you’re roasting, baking, dressing or dipping. We’ve recently reimagined the Hillfarm brand to better reflect who we are – bold, rural, modern. We’re proud to do things properly and tread lightly, and we’re excited to share a little piece of our farm with the Holly & Co community.

name: Hillside Farm Flowers
description: Hello, I'm Sophie and I run Hillside Farm Flowers. We create beautiful everlasting floral designs from my workshop on our farm in the Cotswolds. We specialise in dried flowers and everlasting installations, with a focus on large commission pieces such as custom wreaths and statement arrangements. Drawing inspiration from the changing seasons and the English countryside, we create unique designs using foraged materials from our working farm. Our creations celebrate natural beauty while prioritizing sustainability, with eco-friendly practices like packaging orders in wool from our own flock of sheep. Whether it’s a bespoke wreath, a stunning floral installation, or a seasonal arrangement, we bring the wild charm of nature into homes, events, and businesses across the country.

name: Hiro + Wolf
description: Inspired by a friendship between a Shiba Inu named Hiro and a rescue Terrier named Wolf. Hiro + Wolf has been innovating comfortable and stylish accessories for cats, dogs (and their hoomans!) for a decade. Founded by accessories designer Amy Fleuriot-Reade with her friend Bee Friedmann. Hiro + Wolf's co-founders first met in 2011 while walking their dogs in London Fields Park in Hackney, London. With a focus on fun, original designs, everything is handmade in the UK by their all-female team.

name: HKA Ceramics
description: Ceramics lovingly handmade from a home studio in Hampshire. For the last 5 years i’ve been making personalised pieces for you & your pets. Thrown on the wheel, each piece is crafted from stoneware clay and glazed by hand to create wonderfully unique pieces

name: hobo + co.
description: Sustainable, vegan, cruelty free + paraben and phthalate free range of handmade scented home fragrance, self care + wellness goods for your place of calm. Inspired by a free-spirited love for travelling the world with fragrances evoking memories of special places, all hand poured in-house, by us, in rural Lincolnshire. ​Hobo + co. candles are handmade in small batches using only the finest quality sustainable 100% natural soy wax infused with blends of premium fragrances or 100% natural pure aromatherapy essential oils. Simple and classic in design to complement any space, making it feel happy, cosy and relaxed. Sourced with sustainable materials and packaging designed to re-use or recycle. Designed to travel. Take your favourite scents with you on all your wanderings and to your special happy place.

name: Holly & Co
description: Hello you, it’s Holly here. As you’re on our site, you probably know a little about Holly & Co already (or see our ‘About us’ tab below). We’re huge champions of creative small businesses and we’re here to change the way you shop, live and work for the better. That’s why we showcase a curated selection of unique finds from the UK’s best independent businesses, and very occasionally we make things ourselves too. I hope this brings you joy. Love Holly x

name: Holly Kerr Types
description: Transforming words from the heart into beautiful art. As a published poet, I understand the value and beauty of words, and I hope to transform your writing into unique keepsakes for those closest to your heart. All hand-typed on my vintage typewriters, your words will gain an antique feel as timeless as your love for the recipient of your custom print or greetings card.

name: Holly's Gin
description: An award-winning gin lovingly created by Holly Harwood. Holly's love of vintage and a classic London Dry inspired the beautiful green and gold bottle. A perfect blend of 9 botanicals, including Passion Flower, Gentian Root and Orange. Distilled in two 300 litre copper pot stills, Doris and Rose, at Trevethan Distillery in Saltash, Cornwall. After each distillation, Holly conducts the all important taste test and makes sure the ABV is correct. Holly then fills her gin bottles and labels each one by hand. It’s a real labour of love!

name: Hollywood Sign Prints
description: I'm an artist and printmaker, based in London.

name: Honeywell Bakes
description: Established in 2012, Honeywell Bakes is on a mission to bring creative baking to everyone, in a sustainable way. We offer a range of beautifully intricate hand iced biscuits, perfect for any occasion. Anyone who opens these biscuits will be utterly delighted, and you can add personalisation to many of our collections for that extra special touch.

name: Hook Me Up
description: Hook Me Up was created with one goal in mind, to add colour and fun to people’s homes. Each product is customisable, so you can choose colours to match your or your loved ones style. Every item has been designed and made entirely by hand, by me, from my home studio in Somerset. I use quality acrylic yarn and filling made from 100% recycled materials.

name: Hooksmith Press
description: Typographic prints made lovingly by hand, using age old and rare letterpress equipment from the vast and revered Hooksmith Press collection–some nearing 200 years old. The wordsmithing is as varied as the typefaces. Hooksmith Press produces both solely text-based prints, and text accompanied by imagery (from antique advertising/pictorial plates and bold colour blocks and borders). Subjects range from, fun poetic-witticisms, nostalgic & contemporary observations/sage advice or the just plain obtuse.

name: Hope Omelette
description: I’m Emily, and Hope Omelette is part of my printmaking practice. A place where I explore points of reflection and things to remember through risograph, cyanotype, and screenprint. My Sweet Nothings series begins with typewritten words on sweet packets and grows into playful, reflective editions in bright colours. I’m also co-founder of Something Good Workshops, a joyful Deptford-based studio sharing gateway-crafting and creative beginnings through workshops and original products that celebrate creativity.

name: Hormscent
description: In today’s market, it’s surprisingly hard to find birthday candles that are both beautiful and truly non-toxic. Most are made with paraffin wax, synthetic dyes, and artificial fragrances — ingredients that release harmful fumes when burned. At our studio, we’ve chosen a different path: crafting handmade birthday candles from natural waxes, with your health and the environment in mind. We use a gentle beeswax and soy wax — both biodegradable, clean-burning, and completely free from petroleum-based ingredients. These candles are designed to be safe enough to place on cakes and around children, without worrying about toxic smoke or chemical smells. Whether you’re celebrating a child’s birthday or marking a special milestone, our candles offer peace of mind with every flicker.

name: House of Dungarees
description: House of Dungarees is a British independent childrenswear boutique creating eco-friendly, gender-neutral clothing, handmade in England for children and their families. Founded by a mum and started from home, our designs are original, unique, and timeless. With easy pullover and loose-fit styles, our pieces are made for comfort, adventure, and everyday life. We work only with natural fibres, often choosing beautiful woven patterns over prints, to ensure each garment feels special and endures. Our generous sizing means children can enjoy wearing them longer, and we hope families will treasure our clothes enough to pass them from one generation to the next. Whether your little one is full of energy or simply wants to curl up with a book, House of Dungarees is made for them.

name: House of Hobson
description: Jake takes inspiration from Scandinavian and Mid-Century design, the distinctive clean lines of Japanese aesthetics, and the rolling hills of his South Hams home. Form, function, and durability are at the heart of House of Hobson — beautiful, hard-working creations that will last a lifetime.

name: House of Hooray
description: Hello there, lovely colour enthusiasts and statement-makers! Welcome to our world of joyful home decor that's designed to sprinkle a little happiness into your space. At House of Hooray, we believe that every shade, hue, and tone has the power to transform a room and brighten your mood. That's why we hand craft home decor that doesn't just look good but radiates positivity and good vibes. Our mission is simple: to turn your living space into a canvas of joy. But we are not just about colours and patterns. We are all about positive sentiment, too. Our designs carry messages of love, laughter, and inspiration. They're a reminder that life is beautiful, and your home should be a testament to that. All our items are designed and handmade in our Yorkshire studio, they are designed to give you a Dopamine hit; they are conversations starters, mood enhancers, and smile inducers. When your friends and family step into your space, they won't be able to resist asking, "Where did you get that?"

name: Hue & Shades
description: Hue & Shades create joyful stringy lampshades to light up your home. From soft sculptural silhouettes to bold contemporary lines, our unique lighting collections are made to bring colour, character and joy to your interior.

name: Hush-A-Bye Bay
description: Handmade with love for your little loves, Hush-A-Bye Bay is a children’s accessories brand where you’ll find gifts to delight the little folk. Whether that’s a sparkly hair clip that’s proudly worn from sunrise to bedtime or a toddler handbag to store all those treasures, our products are sure to enchant the small but mighty! We’re a team of mummies and makers whose tried & tested designs will put a smile on their faces. We’ve got gifting for birthdays to baby showers covered!

name: Hutch Cassidy
description: Nicola Hutchinson is an English artist based in Helmsley, North Yorkshire.
