Her colourful work is often inspired by imagined magnificent creatures, a deep appreciation for the natural world and a love of colour. Nicola’s wish is to transport you to a magical land through her illustrations. “Making art for me is about happiness, I choose colours and subjects that make me smile, dreaming up characters I would love to meet whilst roaming our beautiful world”. Our mission here at Hutch Cassidy is to bring all the magic and joy to people’s everyday lives through our enchanting colourful and thoughtfully created stationery.

name: ILO
description: At the heart of our brand is a desire for a more sustainable future, which is why we create clothing that you won’t need to replace often, if ever – helping reduce textile waste. ILO clothing is inspired by the Scandinavian philosophy of childhood where play, comfort, environment, family and friends intertwine to nurture a wholesome child. I do hope we are able to bring a little joy (ILO means Joy in Finnish) through our clothes.

name: Imogen Owen
description: Since 2012 we've been creating the finest luxury stationery using traditonal methods, mostly letterpress printing on our vintage printing presses. Imogen designs everything, from illustrating cards to designing all the boxes for our packaging. We make as much as we can in-house, and anything we out-source is as local as possible where possible, if we can't find what we need in the UK, then we source from Europe or elsewhere, but always working with companies that reflect our values.

name: Imogen Partridge
description: Telling stories through watercolour illustration, I bring your favourite buildings, places and things to life through intricately detailed watercolour illustration. I love to surprise and delight, drawing attention to less obvious places or buildings. Capturing the character and charm of everything I paint, while championing small businesses and introducing some of my favourites through my illustrations, is another way I love to connect people through my work.

name: Imprint Casts
description: Hi, my name is Katy and I am the maker behind Imprint Casts. I am a botanical casting artist based in Edinburgh, Scotland with a green fingered mum who inspired, and founded, Imprint. I specialise in wedding bouquet preservation but also create bespoke collections for interiors designers and stockists, as well as my own web shop offerings made from flowers grown in my mums beautiful garden. All of my casts are made plaster using fresh flowers and foliage hand-picked from the garden and surrounding woodland.

name: Inch Blue
description: Since 1999 Inch Blue has blossomed into a beloved and trusted brand, capturing the hearts of customers across the globe. Each tiny shoe, crafted with love and care, tells a story of comfort, style, and craftsmanship. Year after year, we have remained committed to providing high-quality, charming footwear for little feet, ensuring that every step taken is both joyful and secure. With a strong bond built between our brand and loyal supporters, here at Inch Blue we continue to thrive, spreading happiness and style to families everywhere. Our journey is a testament to the magic that happens when passion meets purpose, creating a legacy that keeps growing, one happy customer at a time.

name: Indy Cockroft
description: Spirited jewellery, made from recycled metals and ethical gemstones. Each piece is worked by hand by way of modern methods with ancient roots - sculpted, carved, lost wax cast, polished and hallmarked. Items are designed organically and created using explorative processes, great care and attention to detail. They evolve from an intrigue and are founded on emotional design. I find beauty in imperfection and strive to reflect this in my jewellery. My debut 00 Smile Collection features bold and playful pieces made from 925 Silver and 18ct Gold Vermeil, which are designed to bring sentiment and joy.

name: Inhale Botanicals
description: Skincare formulated in small batches, from the earth. Inhale Botanicals' skincare products are handcrafted in small batches using thoughtfully chosen ingredients, to nourish and care for your mind and body. As a qualified aromatherapist, mindfulness and wellbeing is very much at the heart of my brand, we use the highest quality raw ingredients, nourishing botanicals and we try to package as sustainably as possible.

name: Inkkin
description: Hello! I'm Susie, the creator of INKKIN. I design eye-catching, eco-friendly, self adhesive paper tapes that are packed with style. My designs often reflect patterns in nature, inspired during strolls through the picturesque Nottinghamshire countryside. In our commitment to environmental sustainability, all of INKKIN’s gift wrapping tapes and packing tapes are printed with pride in the UK. Our trusted printers are dedicated to using paper exclusively from sustainable sources approved by the Forest Stewardship Council, helping us minimise our carbon footprint.

name: Inside My Nest
description: In a world that constantly demands more (more gain, more speed, more noise), I created Inside My Nest for the opposite - for stillness, reflection, solitude, wonder, contemplation & gratitude. All of our products are inspired by our love of nature and are 100% designed and crafted by hand here in the UK.

name: Isabelle Sugden Art
description: I am a London-based artist and illustrator with a passion for creating art that celebrates the joys of nature and the everyday. My work is characterised by playful colour palettes and patterns, fluctuating between the boundaries of observation and imagination.

name: It's a sign
description: Hey, Hello, Hi, I’m Laura the founder of “Its a sign” a small independent artist specialising in all things signwriting, with my main focus being reverse glass gilding. This technique also known as 'verre églomisé' is a traditional process involving the precise application of designs in gold leaf onto the reverse of glass, creating an amazing and eye catching mirror like finish. By using this historical technique and putting my own twist to it, I make playful and colourful signs for your home or business. Each piece I hand paint on glass with 23ct gold gilding with an injection of bold and popping colours, a sprinkle of glitter and some fun loving expletives. All signs comes fully framed and ready to hang! What are you waiting for? Make your wall glisten!

name: Jacqueline Colley
description: I am an Illustrator and Pattern Designer based in East London. Specialising in creating explorable and playful illustrations that celebrate everything from travel to everyday objects! I have worked across, editorial, product, packaging and set design, a love of mine emerged in creating typography and often use themes around travel and curiosity!

name: Jade Boylan
description: Hello, I’m Jade, an artist and designer from the Isle of Man. I know creative people always say this, but I’ve always loved art and creating things. When I was four-years-old I would tell anyone and everyone who asked, that I wanted to be ‘an artist’ when I grew up. So I did just that. I’m thirty-two now and while I’ll never really grow up, I still love art and getting to design and create things in my colourful little studio is my favourite way to spend a day.

name: Jade Fisher
description: Playfully illustrated, recycled and waste free greeting cards & paper goods aimed to spread a little joy with messages of friendship, encouragement and female empowerment.

name: James Barker
description: James Barker is based in South London where from his studio, creates quirky illustrated prints and gifts with a pinch of wit for all ages. Inspired by nature, natural history and other curiosities, James creates playful collections and patterns with a range of topics that might appeal to all.

name: Jane Bain
description: Hi, I'm Jane, a London based artist and printmaker specialising in creating bold and vibrant screenprints. All my prints are made by hand and in small limited editions. Each artwork begins with a drawing and every single screenprint is individually hand-pulled – all and always by me.

name: Jane Kent Studio
description: All my wording is stitched by free hand embroidery, which uses a standard domestic sewing machine and I guide the fabric around with my hands to write the words. I'm completely self taught and it's taken many many hours of practice to get my writing so neat, in fact I think my stitched writing is neater than my handwriting!

name: Jane Mitchell-Finch
description: Hi, I'm Jane! I hand make brooches using free-machine embroidery, inspired by everything from fruit & veg to Frida Kahlo. Every brooch is totally unique, so I hope will become a treasured heirloom for years to come.

name: January Blues
description: Hi! I’m Laura, a banner & print maker who makes unique felt & velvet banners which are the perfect way to to spice up your walls or to cheer someone up. From mini pennants to monoprints it’s all small batch printed & stitched in Norwich by me.

name: Jasmine Pottery Studios
description: Jasmine Pottery Studios was founded with a passion for bringing the mindful joy of clay into everyday life. Our specialist clay kits are carefully designed so you can enjoy the creativity of pottery making from the comfort of your own home. Combining professional-grade materials with easy-to-follow tutorials, we make the craft of pottery accessible, sustainable, and fun for everyone. Each kit invites you to slow down, switch off, and discover the simple pleasure of working with clay. Designed for all ages and abilities, our kits blend quality, creativity, and a touch of playfulness.

name: Jayson Lilley
description: At the forefront of contemporary printmaking practices, my works incorporate painting and collage techniques which make each print unique and different from the next. My passion for the urban landscape is seen throughout my work, which is recognisable for its architectural focus, capturing familiar landmarks and iconic structures from the metropolis. These dynamic scenes sit against backdrops of expansive skies of gold, copper or silver leaf.

name: Jennifer Jackson Heirloom Dolls
description: Welcome to the little world of Jennifer Jackson Heirloom Dolls, where you will find all your favourite pop culture icons in the perfect little size to display. Alongside my core collection of fan favourites, including David Bowie, George Michael, Elton John and Prince, you will occasionally find mini collections of seasonal inspired Heirloom Dolls, with a vintage charm. All dolls are currently made to order, entirely by me, but I promise they are worth the wait. This does also mean that if you would like to add or change a detail, a different jumpsuit for Bowie perhaps, I can make that happen, and create, just for you, your perfect doll.

name: Jenny Hopps Pottery
description: I create colourful contemporary ceramics from my studio in West Berkshire. Through my work I aim to spark joy, invite touch and bring warmth to the home. My focus is on functional ceramics for the modern family home, robust enough for daily use, but also design focused and distinct in form and finish. I work mainly with stoneware clay creating both hand-built and wheel thrown items within my homeware range. I have recently launched a new collection of bathroom basins alongside my ceramic home and tableware. I love the tactile nature of clay and enjoy working with textured clay bodies. I like to keep my glazes playful, and use colours ranging from calming aqua hues to bursts of bright colours here and there. Another passion of mine is styling and photographing my ceramics with fresh blooms from the garden. My work is very much connected to the nature surrounding me, and I am inspired by the changing seasons outside my studio door here in rural Berkshire. My studio is my creative hub, my calming sanctuary and the place where I can channel my passion and energy. Thanks for browsing my collection and I hope you find something that you love. Jenny x

name: Jess Grimsdale
description: I’m Jess, traditional signwriter, folk artist, and enamelware collector. I can be found working on signs of all kinds across the UK, and hand-painting vintage teapots in my Bristol workshop. My work is largely influenced by my time spent apprenticing at the circus and fairground during the early years of my career, and by the bright and bold designs of canal art and wagon painting. These styles bring me so much JOY and I’m so excited to bring them into your lives too!

name: Jess Wilson
description: Welcome to my store! I am based in East London making products from my home studio. In this store there are many items designed and made by myself with the result being laughter and fun.

name: Jessica de Lotz Jewellery
description: Discover storytelling jewellery with Jessica de Lotz, unique personalised pieces made by hand in London at Jessica's studio-workshop in Kentish Town. Jessica is one to bookmark for gifts and treats for yourself, full of meaning, nostalgia and storytelling with modern-day influences. Jessica calls her customers her storytellers, and it's that caring, thoughtful relationship that creates designs with emotions, memories, sentimentality, symbolism and heritage. Jessica studied her craft at Central Saint Martins, where she graduated in 2008 to award-winning praise and success, including several high-profile awards including the Coutts New Jewellers Award. Jessica immediately set up her namesake business which stands strong today, female-founded and a pillar of the local community. You'll find Jessica at her workbench in the shop, behind a peep-hole window, she she handcrafts all of her designs with her team and materials sourced from local partners, supporting the jewellery trade she was schooled in. The essence of every JdL piece is uniqueness - pieces tailored entirely to each wearer, inviting questions of meaning and symbolism. Whether it’s celebrating life and love or commemorating loss, you'll discover truly special, one-of-a-kind, modern heirlooms that wearers cherish forever and pass to future generations.

name: Jessie Morrison Ceramics
description: Jessie's ceramics are a lovely combination of thought-out functional and beautiful homeware for the every day. Although she fell in love with clay at school, it's wasn't until May 2020 that she fully threw herself into it with a course in wheel thrown pottery. And since then she has been creating and honing her favourite pieces. From candle holders to personalised wall platters or chip and dip dishes, there is something for everyone.

name: Jo Laing
description: I'm an independent artist and illustrator, and I have enjoyed many years designing stand-out event creative and producing luxury paper goods. However my recent foray into hand-crafted ceramics has fast become the beating heart of my business and I am so excited to expand this exciting collection. When I'm not working, I spend my time trying to defuse the glorious chaos caused by my young twin girls.

name: Jo Stafford
description: I’m an illustrator and printmaker based in Norwich. I am a bit of a cultural magpie, collecting and hoarding all sorts of ephemera, whether its quotes, lyrics and sayings or sweet wrappers, beer labels and postcards. I take inspiration from music, film, food and nature to produce my bright, bold designs, which are heavily influenced by my love of Typography and Letterpress. I screen print all my work by hand in my studio in Norwich. I love getting inky and the tactile results you get from screen printing.

name: Joanie & Jeanie
description: Welcome to the enchanting world of Joanie & Jeanie — where love, creativity, and a splash of retro joy come together to transform your home. At Joanie & Jeanie, we love celebrating life’s little joys and big moments with plenty of colour and a good dose of nostalgia. Our designs are inspired by the playful patterns from Adele’s childhood, found in the cosy, retro homes of her grandmother Joanie and  sister Jeanie. Whether it’s a special occasion or everyday decor for your home, we believe there’s always room for a touch of colour Fall in love and celebrate your home all over again. With Joanie & Jeanie, your living space becomes a beautiful reflection of who you are.

name: Joanna Ling Ceramics
description: Joanna Ling is a London based ceramicist designing and making from her garden studio In a world of mass production, Joanna feels it important to cherish the singular which is why every piece she creates is unique, considered and handmade. She particularly likes to include elements in her work that reflect something about the person they are for or the setting they will be in. ​Sustainability is key to Joanna's process, including raw glazing her work with brush on glazes and recycling materials as much as possible.

name: Joe Webb Art
description: Joe Webb is best known for his hand-made collages that explore a broad spectrum of themes, from environmental and political issues to the deeper existential questions of our place on Earth and in the Universe. His creative process starts with carefully cutting out images from vintage magazines and books, which he edits and transforms into entirely new compositions. These artworks weave together messages, inviting viewers to reflect on their deeper meanings. More recent works by Joe revisits his love of drawing and painting, taking inspiration from the everyday experiences. Exploring themes of the essence of light, from sunsets, moonlight, shadows and even lasers at raves.

name: Joey Ruthers
description: Joey's passion for crafting beautiful objects began in childhood, inspired by her love for collecting shells, neat little rocks, and shiny trinkets. This lifelong fascination with tiny, exquisite objects now manifests in her meticulous attention to detail and the whimsical charm of her ceramics. Her work is deeply influenced by folk art, ghost stories, and her beloved black cat, Maeby. These elements infuse her creations with a sense of enchantment and narrative, making each piece not only a decorative object but also a story waiting to be discovered.

name: Johanna Wilbraham
description: I'm Johanna - a painter fascinated by that magical place between abstraction and representation. My portraits appear to emerge from watery depths of paint, between splashes, drips and pools – created with layers of poured paint. Alongside a passion for experimental mark-making, I am curious about the way we look at and represent women in particular. In a world dominated by the male gaze, I'm interested in the female one, as well as strength, vulnerability and diversity.

name: Join
description: Our ethos at Join is to create home fragrances that allow you to bathe in the beauty of nature to relax your body and nourish your mind. All of our handcrafted products are vegan and eco-friendly, using recyclable packaging from sustainable sources and printing with vegetable dye inks. We do all we can to help change our environmental impact.

name: Jon Williams
description: Following a BA from Wolverhampton in 2000, Jon established his practice through exhibiting within the UK, ceramic festivals in Mino Japan, Shaanxi China and at the Queen’s Diamond Jubilee at Buckingham Palace. Awarded with a scholarship from The Queen Elizabeth Scholarship Trust, he graduated with an MA from The Royal College of Art in 2014, specialising in ceramics. Most recently, Jon has raised funds for NHS Charities, responding to the UK Lockdown in throwing one hundred decorated, porcelain tea bowls, one of which was acquired by The Museum of London, in documenting the response of London to the Covid pandemic. ‘In making, there is a tipping point that I am looking for, the moment where a character becomes relatable. Through this, each work becomes a vessel, recording narrative and the energy of making. I’m interested in how time becomes a hand in my work, as it does in materials such as stone or clay. The idea of capturing a fragile, transitory state, which may be read in the hereafter.’

name: Juiced The Tip
description: Ethical, small batch, cold press one woman juicing machine from Manchester with an eye for flavour and a warm heart. Juiced the Tip is a forward thinking natural juice business with a naughty side. Created in 2024 in the beating heart of Manchester. Juiced the tip was born out of a love for fresh fruit, positive mind and body connection and a lust for life. Juiced the Tips range of health shots, cordials and other delights need to be tried to be believed, taste yours today!

name: Juno Preserves
description: We are a small batch preserves producer based in Scotland, fondly named after our rescue dog, Juno. we love unusual flavour combinations + encourage you to experiment with how you use our products in your kitchen. Add our jam to your yoghurt + granola, or enjoy with ice cream for a quick pudding. Enjoy our savoury products with a cheeseboard, on sandwiches, or as a marinade for chicken/fish/veggies.

name: KAPER
description: Welcome to the paper sculpture menagerie. My name is Kate and I make handmade paper sculptures to bring cheer to your décor. Every one of my pieces is one of a kind, made from recycled 300 gsm paper (really sturdy cardstock). Each design is tested for durability, and they are varnished with a UV protective lacquer to seal their edges and protect their vibrant colours. Each sculpture is designed, individually printed, cut, assembled and embellished entirely by hand to make sure each and every one has its own unique character. Birds are my most favourite subject. I also make flowers and other wildlife. I am inspired by countryside walks and garden visitors. I often describe myself as a seasonal maker, as I can often be found at my desk making cosy pieces in the autumn and bright, cheerful blooms in the summertime. I’ve been making my sculptures for over 15 years now, and my work aims to evoke the joy I find in the great outdoors. I do hope they make you smile.

name: Karla Courtney
description: I am a writer and hobby hand-knitter who is inspired by nature and the sea. I love knitting lobsters, and especially love knitting lobsters in sweaters :) I design all of my items and everything is handmade using fine alpaca wool blends.

name: Karma Tea Co.
description: Karma Tea Co. was founded in 2019 by Alison, a tea lover with a simple mission: to make it easier for people to drink good tea -and do good while doing it. Born in London, the brand was inspired by the Sanskrit word karma (कर्म), meaning “action.” We believe that what you put out into the world comes back to you - which is why we’re here to make tea that’s good in every sense of the word. In an industry where profit often comes at the cost of people and the planet, Karma Tea Co. is different. We focus on single-origin, loose whole leaf teas that are sustainably grown, ethically sourced, and completely natural. Our karmic philosophy runs through everything we do -from how we choose our partners, to the way we source, blend, and package our teas. Because to make good tea, you have to do good first.

name: Kate Gwilliam
description: I am the Queen of Sequins, and I love re-creating everyday objects in perfect detail out of embroidered sequins. My creations can range from the delightful friend Larry the Lobster to a packet of salt. I work entirely by hand and by hand-guided machine, and each piece I create is a work of art. I bring a touch of whimsy and nostalgia to your home and bring the sparkle to your party. No celebration should be complete without a piece from me!

name: Kate Maxwell Studio
description: Hello! I'm Kate, a printmaker and graphic artist with a love of all things retro. I create colourful screenprints, risoprints and other handprinted goods from my studio in Kingston, South West London. If I'm not in my print studio, you'll find me hunting for vintage treasures to add to my collection and to inspire new prints!

name: Kate Mayer Artist
description: Hi, I’m Kate, an artist who believes in the power of transformation. Through my art, I embrace freedom, inclusivity, connection, and personal growth. I truly believe that what we surround ourselves with has the power to transform our lives. It goes beyond a mood booster—it can shape our subconscious and long-term outlook on life itself! I’m here to fill your space with joy and endless possibilities. Ready to let my art speak to your soul? Let's get started!

name: Kate Slater Illustration
description: Hello, I'm Kate Slater, an illustrator working in mixed media collage. When I'm not designing cards, wrapping paper, prints, tea towels and bird decorations, I illustrate children's books. All my designs begin as collages made from old magazines, envelopes, shopping lists - anything I can get my hands on! I'm dedicated to creating everything sustainably; all my wrapping paper and cards are printed on 100% recycled paper and I use organic cotton for my tea towels. Everything is made in the UK. My favourite things to collage are always birds, but I’ve illustrated everything from ants to woolly mammoths, and, since buying my first home, I've slowly been covering the walls with swans and trees!

name: Kath Leone Art
description: Hello - I’m Kath Leone, a screenprint artist and textile designer based in London, originally from Cape Town, South Africa. Inspired by nature, I create imaginative scenes and pseudo botanical studies featuring flora, fauna, fungi and sea life. Whether free-diving in Cape Town’s magical kelp forests or sketching mushrooms and mosses under a shady tree canopy in the English countryside, I am repeatedly drawn to the detailed richness of life in these varied and awe-inspiring forest environments.

name: Katherine Jones Artist
description: I’m an award-winning architect and artist based in Cardiff. I use my work to help you connect with the people, places or moments that matter. I do this by creating intricately detailed illustrations, inspired by my architecture experience. In the last two years, I’ve featured on Radio 4 and have been commissioned by many individuals as well as the likes of Tower Bridge, the National Trust, Microsoft and the National Museum of Wales.

name: Katie Brinsley Ceramics
description: I love making, I can’t help it, my hands get restless when I’m not. That’s how Katie Brinsley Ceramics started, with my hands. They momentarily let me down as my friends treasured butter dish slipped out of them smashing on her floor. This inspired me to make the best possible replacement! I chose slip casting for its beautiful clean lines and tactile smooth finish that makes an everyday object a delight to use. I haven’t stopped making my ceramic tableware since.

name: Katie Housley Paper Goods
description: From her studio in Hove, England, Katie Housley creates thoughtful paper goods for life’s joyous occasions and just-because moments. Each item is lovingly finished, packed and sent from my studio by the sea.

name: Katie Tinkler Illustration
description: Katie Tinkler is a London based food illustrator who creates a range of fun and unique food related products, guaranteed to bring a smile to your face. Whether it's a punny greeting card featuring a decadent cake, a hand painted bowl of baked beans, or one her beautifully brightly coloured cotton tea towels, Katie's products are perfect for any food lover!

name: Kay Vincent Illustration
description: Welcome to Kay's playful world! Kay Vincent's collection includes educational and personalised art prints designed for the nursery, bedroom or playroom. These bold & colourful prints offer story telling potential & encourage the use of imagination. They make wonderful new baby or birthday gifts for friends & family, many of them can be personalised with name & birth details. Each character is given real personality, & naturally bring smiles to children faces, & fun loving adults alike!

name: KCHossack Pottery
description: Hello! I am Karin, the sole proprietor of KCHossack Pottery. I am known for my handmade table and serveware which incorporate scalloped edges into my many styles. I find great joy in creating colour combinations to enhance my aesthetic. The surfaces of my ceramics are solid colour which leaves lots of scope for mixing up your tablescape stacking sizes and edges for a real statement on your dining table.

name: Keep & Hold
description: Hi, I’m Sharon. I create small, bright, personalised storage and organisation solutions for homes and the people in them. I’m drawn to the softness of fabric and make all my items in my wee sewing nook in my home under the Pentland Hills in Edinburgh. Every product is made by hand, and all personalisation is hand-embroidered. I love how colour can instantly lift a mood and make the heart sing. My bags, binders, and baskets are made with the aim of being your wee helpers, to bring the personal touch to you and your home, and to turn chores into something joyful.

name: Keep Collect
description: I am Cat, founder of Keep Collect. I am a bookbinder and box maker for all occasions with a long running passion for order, neatness and finding small joys in the chaos that is life. I delight in creating personal archives and modern heirlooms, things that can be kept, treasured and passed on. Keep Collect is a company of two overlapping concepts, the practical and the pleasing; the useful and the beautiful. I hope I achieve some degree of both in everything I make.

name: Kelly-Anne Davitt
description: Artist and curator Kelly-Anne Davitt is known for hyper-real virtuoso painting style in vibrant pop tones, and her humorous and provocative light-sculptures. Her electrifyingly immaculate canvases fuse traditional still life and portraiture with a contemporary approach, inspired by advertising imagery, pop culture, nostalgic childhood memories and feminist themes. She has exhibited widely across the UK from Cork Street to The Potteries.

name: Kept & Cherished
description: Kept & Cherished is a collection of handmade, vintage inspired products influenced by the magic and nostalgia of childhood, the halcyon days, if you will. These products are for people who value family traditions and heirloom treasures that tell a story. Kept & Cherished products help you to create moments in the now, inspired by the past, that your children will look back on in years to come and feel that comforting rose tinted glow of nostalgia.

name: Kettle of Fish Designs
description: Hi, I'm Karen and I'm the sole pair of hands behind Kettle of Fish Designs. My background is in Fine Art and I believe that gives my work a distinctive style which really suits homes which have a personality that develops over time and doesn't necessarily follow trends. Many of the materials I use are recycled, reclaimed, repurposed or upcycled, which enhances their intrinsic beauty and adds to the distinctive character that you only get from handmade. I combine vintage imagery with a rustic aesthetic, so my pieces really suit environments that combine inherited pieces, quirky collections and secondhand finds.

name: Kimberly Rainford Art
description: Devon-born and bred, Kimberly is a printmaker living by the coast and countryside. She creates hand-printed linocuts, with every part of the process, from imagination to paper, carefully and lovingly undertaken by her.She’s inspired by whatever catches her eye and feeds her soul. Wildlife, animals, flora and fauna all feature but bringing joy through her work is important. If it makes your heart sing and your eyes twinkle then she’s a happy bunny!With a deep connection to nature, she’s fully invested in making sure her products are consciously and mindfully made.

name: Kip Candle Co.
description: Blending our shared obsession for scent with our passion for the outdoors we began Kip Candle Co. in 2019 with the aim of making stunning home fragrancing from fine ingredients, creating the highest strength candles currently on the market. Our Soy Candles, Diffusers and Essential Oil Soaps are designed to add joy with their beautiful scents, making your space really feel like home. We promise to always be handmade, vegan and paraffin-free.We hope you find something to love.

name: Kit Johns
description: Hi, I am Kit Johns. My work explores the wild and untamed nature of the Cornish landscape. Experimentation and expression are key aspects of my work, creating unpredictable, unique and atmospheric pieces. Combinations of mixed media including acrylic, oil and ink encourage me to push the technical boundaries of traditional landscape painting. I often use authentic vintage maps and other found objects as the base for my art, creating a rare unique canvas for each painting and adding further to a sense of place within the work.

name: Kitschen
description: Hi I'm Kitty! I've been making and designing jewellery since I was 16. I'd describe my work as fun fine jewellery with a main focus on food. My pieces are designed to be wearable novelty. I like the novelty side of things but I designed them to be beautiful objects. I carefully craft each piece in my shepherds hut. I put everything into my work because I love it. I hope you love it too!

name: Kitty Joyas
description: Kitty Joyas is a London based jewellery brand, founded in Barcelona by British designer Kitty Fuller. Creating with the intention to add joy and personality into jewellery boxes, Kitty Joyas champions slow, considered design. Marrying luxury metals and stones with her unique aesthetic vision, Kitty’s designs are a mixing pot of her favourite styles and influences; playful modern forms, timeless romantic charm and bohemian spirit. All pieces of jewellery are designed and handcrafted in Kitty's South London studio, combining recycled gold and silver and fairmined gold plating, with traditional artisan techniques.

name: Kitty Kenda Papergoods
description: Kitty Kenda is a heartfelt greeting card and papergoods brand and our uplifting, nature themed collections can be found in beautiful shops across the globe! Each of the products is designed in house & manufactured in England - many are even hand finished in house!

name: Kohsi Pets
description: Ey up! I’m Shelby, the designer, maker, and proud owner of Kohsi. By my side is Kallie, my beautiful rescue dog and trusty sidekick. She’s not just my four-legged companion—she’s also the real boss around here (let’s be honest, the girl runs the show). Kohsi is pronounced ‘cosy,’ inspired by the concept of Hygge, which is all about creating a warm, welcoming, and comfortable home enviroment. And let’s be honest, who doesn’t love a good, cosy snuggle with their furry friend? It’s a way of life here at Kohsi! I hope you love our products, just as much as I love making them.

name: Konoc
description: Konoc is a free-spirited lifestyle brand selling accessories with attitude to take on life’s adventures. From our award winning leather 'cult worthy' Keyrings to our sell out statement 'good days' tees.

name: Kristjana S. Williams
description: London-based Icelandic artist Kristjana S. Williams is a multidisciplinary artist, whose work spans fine art collage pieces, hand cut 3D artworks, illustration, animation and digital design. Her designs are inspired by nature, and her technique involves layering nature upon nature to mirror the symmetry in all living things. Her work has become well known, winning numerous awards and can be found all around the world.

name: L&Clay Ceramics
description: Fusing text with pottery I make bold and striking vessels, plates and trinket trays that can be as practical as they are beautiful, making a colourful statement in any interior.

name: La Fève
description: Artisan chocolate. Made to surprise. Meant to be shared. At La Fève, we craft award-winning chocolates designed for luxury gifting—handmade, hand-painted, and internationally recognised by the Academy of Chocolate and International Chocolate Awards. We use premium Valrhona couverture, organic ingredients, and natural botanical colours. No shortcuts. No artificial anything. Just bold, delicate flavours in every bite. La Fève means “the bean”—a symbol of creativity, care, and the magic inside each chocolate. Thoughtfully packaged and unforgettable, our bonbons are made to be gifted, savoured, and remembered.

name: Lady Bakewell-Park
description: Known on social media for sweary biscuits and capturing song lyrics, as well as saying-it-how-it-is onto her colourful biscuits, Lady B also indulges in classic comforts as well as specialised bespoke orders. LBP has worked with clients such as Pepsi, Snapchat, GSK, Virgin Media, amongst others, but loves to create biscuits that can be sent to loved ones by YOU. Becky works alongside a small team that makes your biscuits by hand on the Suffolk / Essex border.

name: Lappliq'
description: Lappliq’ is a British interiors brand. We create bold, playful and original cushions and soft furnishings for your home. Handmade in Scotland and inspired by traditional country life.

name: Last Night In Limehouse
description: One-of-a-kind luxury dog collars for the discerning hound. Original hand-painted designs created in the heart of the British countryside.

name: Laura Lane Ceramics
description: Hello, I’m Laura and I make stoneware pottery inspired by my everyday life here in Cornwall. My illustrative style is often playful and humorous with a gentle nod to Cornish folklore, both historical and more contemporary. I have a little pottery shop in the beautiful town of Fowey, where I am inspired by the fishermen, boats and tales of the sea. I’ve always lived close to the coast and you’ll often find me by the sea, either in it or on it, swimming with my wonderful group of girlfriends (all year round) or rowing in a Cornish Pilot Gig with my boys.

name: Laura Skilbeck
description: We are celebrating 15 years as a small and sustainable greetings card company! I began designing recycled and plastic-free greetings cards in my studio in Uppermill in 2010; experimenting with new ideas, using all of the materials to create my own style, die-cutting and gold foiling on a vintage foiling press, and creating these lovely little art works, full of warmth and joy! I'm proud that my designs are still drawn and painted by hand, printed onto really nice 350gsm card by our local printmakers, and sent out to you without any plastic packaging!

name: Lauren Ink.
description: Botanically dyed handmade paper and letterpress printed goods that are rooted in and inspired by nature. All my prints are borne out of my fascination with botany and ecology. My creative process begins out in the field with my wildflower key and hand lens in pocket. My papers are made from a composition of reclaimed rag and plant fibres either left in their natural tones or imbued with natures living hues through the alchemy of botanical dyes. Each sheet is pulled from the vat by hand using time honoured and traditional paper-making techniques. My botanical illustrations are printed on my big beautiful antique printing press. Each sheet of handmade paper is fed one at a time into the press. The pressure of the printing plate combined with the pillowy paper creates a lovely fossil-like impression. I have worked hard to create a circular paper-making process that uses bi-product and reclaimed fibres. Nothing is wasted and everything is repurposed. I strive to save and use every last drop of botanical dye - reusing dye-baths where possible or turning leftover colour into pigments.

name: Lauren Marina
description: I'm Lauren Marina, an illustrator, artist, and poet living and working by the sea in Dorset. I create a range of soulfully illustrated home and giftware designed to evoke a sense of joy, connection, and calm. My work is consistently created in a limited monochrome palette. I work using a digital technique that is a contemporary blend of my traditional printmaking roots with my love for the hand drawn. My illustrated goods are all thoughtfully produced in the UK using sustainable methods.

name: Leadporium
description: We are Sonia, Ruby & Ryder. I'm a self confessed dog accessory addict, so the progression into making beautiful products came quite naturally. I’ve put my heart and soul into every item and I hope you love all your Leadporium accessories. Welcome to my world, enjoy the ride!

name: Lene Bladbjerg
description: Hello, I'm Lene - a Danish artist based in London. I was born in Denmark in 1974, but grew up in Brussels, Belgium. The multinational environment prompted my passion for exploring new countries and cultures, and has heavily influenced my work as an artist.​

name: Let Us Pretend
description: Welcome to a world of infinite sparkle, my name is Susie and I am a Wizard of Oz, Camp-core mega fan. For as long as I can remember I have been fascinated by glitz, glamour and pop culture. I am passionate about bringing joyful, and uniquely customised items to my customers, whether it be wearable or wall art. I started my business during lockdown and it grew as the fabulous Sophie Ellis Bextor wore my capes for her wonderful Kitchen Discos. I’m thrilled to have you here!

name: Letterbox Gifts
description: At Letterbox Gifts our is aim to make gifting enjoyable and convenient. That's why we have curated a range of beautiful hand-wrapped gifts that can be ordered online and we'll deliver straight through the letterbox to your friends and family.

name: Letterbox Lane
description: Hello and welcome to Letterbox Lane. I am inspired by patterns, colour and colour combinations. I love drawing playful animals and bright blooms. I am known for my monochrome typography work and most of my earlier work focused on just using words to encourage, inspire or simply make people smile. All of my work is created from my comfy home studio and is printed at a brilliant local printers using high quality G.F Smith papers. It is then packaged by me in compostable cello wallets. I love my job and I am so thankful for every single purchase you make. So thank you for shopping small, it means the world Leanne x

name: Libby Ballard Ceramics
description: Hi! I am Libby, designer and maker for my Ceramics business. Everything is hand-thrown by me in my Garden studio in Wiltshire. Very much a small family business you can often find my toddler and baby popping their heads into the studio and my Mum stamping boxes and packing orders. Thank you for visiting my store!

name: Lilian May Studio
description: Hi I'm Will, the founder of Lilian May Studio. When I started my business, I created custom commissioned watercolour paintings and cards for people that were often gifted to their loved ones. For this reason I named my business after my late Grandmother, who treasured really thoughtful handmade gifts. My range has now expanded into everything watercolour including personalised painting gift-sets that are all made by hand by myself and my family team.

name: Lilly Loves
description: I am hugely excited about Lilly Loves, although we are starting mainly with linen tableware I want to be able to bring my passion and vision for stitched homeware into all parts of the home. Personalisation is a huge part of the business, not only monograming products but also listening to ideas and needs of you the consumer. Making your extra special event that much more personal.

name: Lind & Lime Gin
description: We create our classic robust London dry gin using just seven botanicals. Juniper, fresh lime peel and aromatic pink peppercorns are our three key flavours. We peel our limes and get the citrus oils from the skin. It took many iterations and almost a year of slow, careful development - a painstaking balancing act to find the perfect harmony between flavours. We use 100% organic ingredients, and distill with clean electricity. Our gin is bottled in-house and hand-labelled with our plastic free-tamper seals that secures our natural cork in our entirely plastic free pack.

name: Lindsay Madden
description: I am an artist living and working in County Durham, combining my passion for painting with my love of timeworn school artefacts. Happiest in my home studio creating colourful oil paintings on old time worn objects. Inspired by timeless narratives of childhood, handstands, cartwheels, push-along toys, sports and much more, are recurring themes in my work. Matched with lively titles that resonate on many levels, my paintings bring interest and energy to any space.

name: Linen & Bee
description: Linen & Bee specialises in handcrafted, sparkly delights that add a touch of magic to your special occasions. From novelty birthday badges, to greetings cards and cake toppers; each item is thoughtfully designed and meticulously handcrafted, ensuring that every piece is as unique and special as the moments it helps to celebrate. Here at Linen & Bee, we believe in the power of the little details to make a big impact and our passion is to bring the joy and wonder of childhood, in all its colourful innocence to anyone who purchases or receives our products.

name: Lino Lord
description: The joy of printmaking for me is rooted in the traditional tools and time honoured techniques that create beautiful, affordable art for every wall. Each Lino Lord print is entirely handmade by me - from the first sketch, to inking the lino and turning the wheel of the press. I enjoy the honest, analogue process and no two prints are ever the same. I also love to celebrate my Cornish heritage in my coastal designs, as well as homegrown produce and fun ‘retro chic’ classics.

name: Lisa Jones Studio
description: Good Design Is Good Fun!

name: Lisa Macario
description: Hey there, I'm Lisa, an obsessive word magpie on a mission to embroider bold battle cries on soft organic cotton jumpers. From light-hearted wordplay to serious protest, I’ll stitch what's close to your heart. Since 2016, I've woven stories, activism, and art into every thread. I've been commissioned by Estée Lauder, Instagram, The Design Museum, Penguin, and more. My work has also been featured in The Guardian, Harper’s Bazaar and The Telegraph's Stella Magazine.

name: Lisa Stickley
description: Hello, I’m Lisa, an artist author and illustrator based in South London. I host creative workshops, both online and in my garden studio, paint paintings, make personalised doodles of dog walkers, pastel drawings of cheeky swimmers & create portraits and pictures just for you. Each piece is completely handmade by me in my studio, painted, cut and collaged or illustrated in my favourite mixed-media style. Pictures come signed, dated and framed or unframed. Perfect personalised presents for any occasion, and each one completely bespoke. I realised, having been drawing for well over 40 years, that aside from loving it as a career, it really makes me feel better too. Happily dOOdling every day, I’m embracing the power of drawing to calm the mind and unlock creativity. SO, I’ve also created a series of Doodling Books. Guided drawing for you to do anytime, anywhere. They’re great fun for folk young and old, and really do take you away from the hustle, bustle & technical treadmill we find ourselves on these days. Even just a five-minute pause can help such a lot. Thanks for having a peek at my page. I’d be delighted to make something for you. Lisa x

name: Little Black Cat Illustrated Goods
description: Here at Little Black Cat we produce high quality, unique illustrated goods lovingly designed and packed by one cat lady in her studio. Our greeting cards are diverse, fun and modern. Within our collections you'll find plenty of unique designs to suit all ages and occasions. There's something for everyone at Little Black Cat for those looking to celebrate the joys of nature and being playful, with a touch of magical whimsy.

name: Little CaraBelle
description: Welcome to my little shop… Maker of pretties, christmas cushions, and costumes. Inspired by all things sparkly, felt, floral, ribbony, glitter and obsessed by gingerbread. Everything is handmade by me in my little studio

name: Little Egg
description: Little Egg is the fun, felt, faux houseplant brand created by Laura Gardner. Set up 12 years ago, the Little Egg brand has grown and matured, and so have Laura’s plants. The product range is now full of exquisite, intricate felt creations that have the look of real houseplants but with a whimsical twist. Ranging from huge, twisting and trailing plants to delicate, patterned leaves, Laura’s products are all unique originals, designed and made entirely by hand.

name: Little Fish Design
description: As an Artist & Designer I create playful & humorous ‘Pop-Surrealist’ pieces combining images drawn from classical art to vintage packaging. This current series of limited edition prints entitled ‘The Product Placement Project’ creates a cheeky juxtaposition between old & new, Classical & Pop, giving classical portraiture a humorous populist twist. It could be said to reflect on the functions of fashion, portraiture & advertising (but that would be hugely pretentious) ...they’re mostly meant to amuse..

name: Little Light Stitchery
description: Hi, I'm Nicky and welcome to Little Light Stitchery! I have been stitching for as long as I can remember and I love nothing more than sharing my love of needlework with others. I’m also slightly obsessed with collecting beautiful fabric so what better than to merge these two joys? Whether it is a heartfelt sentiment, someone’s handwriting or a memory, or something a little bit sweary that will make you laugh, I can stitch it on to your choice of fabric.

name: Little Loop Embroidery
description: I use delicate hand-embroidery to create beautiful keepsakes and artwork for special occasions and special memories. Everything I sell is handmade by me personally, and customised so it's unique to the future owner.

name: Little Mercies
description: Opened in October 2018, we are a multi award winning local neighbourhood cocktail bar and restaurant. Our food menu might be the best kept secret in North London. We started producing ready to drink cocktails during Lockdown, and after seeing the other options on the market decided to focus on making the highest quality products we could. What you drink in a bottle or can, is exactly the same liquid we serve in the bar. Give them a go and see what we mean.

name: Little Northern Nook
description: Welcome to Little Northern Nook, home of colourful, hand-painted photo frames. Set up out of a passion for interiors, styling and colour, I believe that your home should be a reflection of you. Little Northern Nook allows you to inject your personality into your home with fun, playful colours, whether that’s highlighting captivating prints and artwork or simply framing your favourite photographs. Each frame is meticulously crafted, and I currently offer two main styles - classic bobbly ‘bobbin’ frames and modern chequerboard photo frames. I offer a variety of colours and sizes to suit all interiors.

name: Little Omo
description: An inclusive educational brand that provides learning materials and toys, while teaching all children about diversity through play.

name: Little Wootton
description: Hello, I'm Melissa, the founder, creator and hands behind Little Wootton. Thanks for stopping by to have a read! Welcome to the home of handmade signage and gifts. I craft beautiful, unique pieces for weddings, businesses, homes, and gardens — all made with passion and painted entirely by hand.

name: Liv's Letters
description: Welcome to Liv's Letters! Celebrating the art of sending a letter (particularly of the 'thank you' variety), with colourful and personalised stationery, notecards, labels and much, much more.

name: Lochlin Stitches
description: Hello, I'm Alison and I design with heart. Inspiration comes from everything. I love art, travel, history, photography, film & stage design, folklore, storytelling, nature, bees! ... I could go on. I create embroidery kits & instruction guides on how you can make your finished embroidery into something extra special for yourself or a loved one. Every finished embroidery kit is a little piece of textile artwork.

name: Lockdown Liquor & Co
description: Lockdown Liquor & Co was founded in April 2020, by entrepreneurs Natasha and Jack Durling. The brand offers award-winning premium blended cocktails, crafted by expert mixologists using the best quality ingredients resulting in unique and great tasting cocktails.

name: LodePrints
description: Here, you'll find an eclectic collection of hand-carved lino prints inspired by the things I love most—be it quirky animals, striking patterns, or the everyday beauty that catches my eye. Each piece is designed and printed with care, making every print as unique and full of character as the moments that inspired them. Whether you're looking to brighten your space or find the perfect gift, I hope these playful designs bring a little joy and whimsy to your day.

name: Loel
description: Loel is the jewellery brand that is proud to be Unseriously Stylish. Our jewellery is made by a small family run businesses in Italy. We love going to see them. We say ciao! to the skilled hands making our pieces. They send us red wine at Christmas. We remember why we wouldn’t want to make our pieces anywhere else. This way our jewellery has the same reassuringly luxurious feel of a stunning pair of handmade heels, with ‘Made In Italy’ proudly stamped on the bottom. Our bold designs have been loved by the likes of Claudia Winkleman, Tyra Banks and a few girl bands to boot.

name: Loft & Daughter
description: Hi, I'm Katie, founder of Loft & Daughter, in collaboration with heartbeats from all over India. Born from the belief that what you buy can make a difference, I work with a very carefully selected group of artisan partners (who are now like family!) to bring our meaningful jewellery collections and one-of-a-kind resort wear to life. My mission is to uplift, empower & financially stabilize our makers & their communities through our intentional co-creations, using planet friendly materials & time-honoured techniques. These are the things you keep in your Loft. These are the things you pass down to your Daughter.

name: LoLA - Lots of Lovely Art
description: LoLA creates art boxes, activity booklets and art sketchbooks inspired by artists and full of projects and creative ideas for children of all ages, so that you can bring a regular experience of art into your children’s lives at home. Both Alara and Selina feel passionate about the arts and art education. They want to reach as many children as possible in the belief that process-based, artist-inspired experiences are an important way for children to: • Develop problem-solving skills • Think analytically • Build self-confidence • And to have fun!

name: Lolas Leads By LOLAPALOOZA
description: Lola’s Leads are the stylish and colourful solution to that unsightly plastic extension cord you’re always trying to hide. With the rise of people working from home, the need for a sexy alternative to getting power to the other side of room has become abundant. Whether you rent, live in large house or just don’t want to spend the money on fully rewiring, extension cords are a necessity in our lives; so why do they have to be ugly!

name: Lomond Paper Co.
description: Hi, I’m Sarah and I run Lomond Paper Co. a creative studio based on the West Coast of Scotland. I decided to stop procrastinating and started my business back in 2015. I wanted to create a brand to explore my creativity and the aesthetics that I love. My business gives me the ability to explore my creativity and still be around for my children. My aim is to deliver luxury paper products with pretty illustrations for all occasions. I am hugely inspired by nature, and I love playing with colour combinations. All my designs are now created on the iPad Pro, and I tend to use a variety of techniques from pencil drawings to painting in gouache

name: London Drying
description: Hey there...I'm Marcia. Throughout my life, I think Retail has always been a part of my DNA. As a child, the family routine always included a Saturday visit to the department store where my dad worked. In my last year of high school I was on a programme where I went to school in the morning and worked at Bloomingdale's department store in the afternoon. I also started a little business then, buying costume jewellery from wholesalers in NYC and reselling locally. Fast forward to a move to London and a lengthy career in Visual Merchandising, where I devoted many years trying to ensure shops looked the best they could. With London Drying I've tried to use my aesthetic in a different way. Powered by music and good vibes, I hope my tea towels bring a smile.

name: Lorna Freytag
description: I create brilliantly bold and playful prints. Perfect for kids rooms or hanging in cool cafes and studios!

name: Lotta's House
description: Hello, I'm Charlotte, I absolutely adore embroidery, the beautiful texture and depth it brings to textiles. I love to make personalised embroidered gifts that mark those all important milestones in life. Lotta's House is a brand that celebrates individuality and positivity, fabrics are embellished to create thoughtful gifts that can be treasured. Each piece that I sew truly is a labour of love, surfaces are slowly created as each stich is sewn and the design emerges.

name: Lottie Day
description: I am an illustrator and textile artist from North Norfolk. I produce a range of unique designs for the home, inspired by the wonky vegetables on my Dad's allotment. My original illustrations are screen printed onto cotton napkins and tea towels and presented in beautiful gift boxes.

name: Lou Taylor
description: Lou is a self-taught artist and designer who works in paper, perspex and textiles. Her work reflects a love for all things botanical and influences range from the kitsch to cottage core; from botanical illustrations to vintage seed packets via 70’s maximalism. Being taught to walk by Cecil Beaton at the age of 2 was a career highlight and you could say he's been a life-long influence ever since.

name: Louise Mulgrew
description: Hi! I’m Louise, founder, illustrator and animal-lover at Louise Mulgrew. We create joyful, illustrated greetings cards featuring lots of fluffy and feathery friends and the odd rainbow or three with the mission of spreading happiness and cultivating thoughtful human connection through the simple gift of a handwritten card. I hope our cards help you to say what you can’t find words for, capture your special relationships, and make you, and those you love, smile.

name: Love From Hetty and Dave
description: Hi, I'm Zoe. Born on the South Coast of England in the late seventies, and raised on a diet of sequins, buttons, ribbons and thread, it was inevitable that sewing would play a large part of my life. Inspired by South American folk art and vintage tattoos, all of my pieces are designed and hand-sewn by me, with love and attention, using cruelty free faux leather. I believe every day is a dress up day, and my jewellery and accessories are designed with that in mind.

name: Lucie Flynn
description: Within Lucie Flynn Studio I specialise in creating vibrant, innovative, and thought-provoking artworks which are deeply rooted in the idea of leaving behind a strong message to inspire viewers. I strongly believe in collaboration, and am always looking for exciting new projects to be a part of with a passion for pushing boundaries and creating art that will engage, inspire, and leave a lasting impression. I live and work in Surrey and have recently become involved in being part of Surrey Artists Open Studios which has been such a positive experience. After a very creative 20 years in London it has been an emotionally uplifting experience to move back to where I grew up and become involved in creating new memories of this part of the south east with my own children.

name: Lucky Budgie Print Studio
description: Mission:To stand and deliver prints with purpose, passion and particularity... curiosity, creativity and courage... humour, honesty and hope... wisdom, wonder and words, lots and lots of words. Philosophy:Love yourself. Then forget it. Then, love the world. (Mary Oliver) In a parallel universe:Pea is a 1970’s wrestler/an equine therapist/a glass blower/a dandy highwayman. You decide.

name: Lucy Deaner Illustration
description: "It's all in the power to dream and capturing a moment to inspire. Embracing the forms of inky line work, every illustration tells a story". I'm a Scottish born, London based inky and mixed media artist and illustrator working with paper and ceramics. All handmade and perfectly imperfect

name: Lucy Dorothy Art
description: Hi, I’m Lucy and I’m lucky enough to work full time as an artist, creating marvellously magical sculptures from my treasure trove of old papers and books, maps and even the odd chocolate bar wrapper! I love making pieces with a playful, illustrative feel and often focus on trying to make the impossible possible, be that a shop selling weather by the jar, a hotel for weary birds or even a rainbow making machine.

name: Lucy Hook Designs
description: Hello! I’m Lucy, an illustrator and designer living and working from my home studio in York. I create colourful, quirky art prints and greeting cards which I hope bring a sprinkling of joy to peoples homes. My main inspiration come from my love for food and baking. There’s nothing I love more than making people feel special or at home by having freshly baked cakes or a sourdough loaf on hand! Lucy Hook Designs is this encapsulated in a brand, warm, inviting and relatable.

name: Lucy Loves This
description: LucyLoves This is a small design studio, set up by me, ex book cover designer Lucy.All the products and prints I design celebrate the places that make us who we are. The places that have shaped, inspired and provided happy homes and holiday destinations for our customers. All the letter designs are filled with intricate illustrations, monochrome typography and contain the landmarks and icons that celebrate either a town, city county or country.

name: Lucy Miller
description: Hello, I’m Lucy Miller, a passionate designer specialising in crafting artwork inspired by nature. My designs adorn products such as greetings cards, gift wrap, stationery, textiles, and art prints. My pressed floral range was born out of the inspiration from my lockdown walks and the joy of exploring nature alongside my two boys. From carefully pressing delicate flowers and capturing their essence through photography and artistic assembly, the process is an absolute joy.

name: Lucy Turner Modern Marquetry
description: Put simply, I have always made things. Inspired by my surroundings, I believe inspiration is everywhere. I have found it takes many forms and can hit me in a flash - there is no formal process. I am lucky to visualise my designs and my mainly self-taught journey in this process of marquetry has been about acquiring the necessary skills and techniques to bring them to life. My passion is my work, and I strive to perfect what I do, and I love every minute of it. I also love running up hills, my small holding in Somerset and adventures with my family.

name: lucyandjaneceramics
description: Hello, I'm Lucy, the face behind lucyandjaneceramics. I design and make whimsical pottery in my garden studio including tableware, decor and sculpture. My inspiration comes from the world around me, from the flowers in the garden to little creatures that inhabit the green space. A ball of clay is where it all begins, meaning my items have a hand produced quality that can't be found with mass produced ceramics. My aim is to make customers smile with each quirky detail.

name: Luisa's Vegan Chocolates
description: Luisa makes all her chocolate with love from the beans all the way to the bar, with autonomy over every step of the process. This begins with directly sourcing the finest quality cacao from family run cacao farms. The team have been out to meet the farmers to ensure ethical working conditions, teach them how to cultivate, and build strong and powerful relationships. This has made a significant difference to communities across the globe. Please click here to learn more about how we empower our farmers through education, keeping them out of a poverty cycle.

name: Luna Lighting
description: Luna Lighting, makers of hand crafted ceramic lights, is based at a studio in the heart of Bloomsbury in central London.

name: Lynda Loves
description: Lynda Loves is a UK wedding stationery and branding design studio with a passion for minimal, typographic design, colour, and illustrative details. My wedding invitations, on the day stationery, occasion cards and paper goods blend considered design, tactile premium materials, and luxury hand finishing to bring a touch of style to life’s most important moments. As a small studio with craftsmanship and attention to detail at its heart, each stationery suite is carefully designed to your requirements and assembled by hand, before winging their way to delight you and your guests.

name: Mabel and Me
description: Mabel & Me was born from a vision to ignite the spirit of imaginative play and storytelling. With a passion for nostalgia, I set out to design characterful play sets that would transport children to whimsical worlds. My commitment to sustainability shows through the choice of materials used to create and package our products. Each toy is carefully constructed, embracing the concept of heirloom quality, destined to be treasured and loved.

name: MABLI
description: Founded by designer Lisa Roberts, MABLI is a family-run Welsh brand creating clothing for children, adults, and the home. Embracing slow fashion, we combine vintage-inspired aesthetics with traditional Welsh Tapestry patterns and versatile designs. Crafted using premium materials, our collections are made with trusted suppliers worldwide upholding ethical and sustainable practices.

name: Made by Valkyrie
description: Made by Valkyrie was founded in 2023 out of a love for creating timeless and functional art, ceramics that can be treasured forever and are an ode to my favourite things. I personally hand-build and hand-paint each ceramic piece in my spare room which makes anything you order unique and extra special. I only use high quality underglazes and source my clay locally to not only support other small businesses, but to help the environment where I can.

name: MadeKind
description: MadeKind offer a range of natural products for the home, body and hair that are plant-based, non-toxic, gentle on the skin and safe to breathe. Beautifully packaged in glass and aluminium bottles, the products look great on your kitchen counter or bathroom shelf, and with gorgeous scents that add pleasure to your daily routine. All MadeKinds products are made with the purest ingredients derived from nature. Non-toxic and free from harmful chemicals, MadeKind is a safe and effective alternative for every household, and kind to the planet. We create natural cleaning products you can trust; they are free from chemical nasties but are effective and safe to use around the family. We formulated our Body and Hair products to elevate your daily ritual; to start your day positively or to calm your mind after a long day. Gentle, nourishing, natural ingredients, with no synthetic scents. Conscious of reducing waste and keeping costs low, refills are available either as a 1-litre pouch, or a 3L ‘bag in box’ making this a convenient and cost-effective way of shopping sustainably.

name: Mademoiselle Macaron
description: Luxury French macarons, handmade & freshly prepared in Edinburgh by a female-led team. After tasting her first macaron on the Champs Elysées, Rachel fell in love with French macarons and was determined to bring this beautiful delicacy back to her home in Scotland. So she lived in Paris, immersed herself in the culture and went to the Alain Ducasse cookery school to learn how to make macarons, before founding Mademoiselle Macaron. Mademoiselle Macaron brings a moment of French luxury to every Mademoiselle and Monsieur. Handcrafted with artistry and flair, each macaron is a delicate harmony of timeless flavours and daring creations. Award-winning and exquisitely refined, they are the ultimate expression of French indulgence, whether given as a gift or served to elevate the most memorable occasions.

name: Magic Pink Designs
description: Hi, I'm Georgie and I run Magic Pink Designs. I love to create handmade lampshades and bunting that bring joy and happiness to your home. Home is definitely my sanctuary, and I believe in filling it with colourful and cheerful pieces that helps to make any space feel creative and inviting. Explore my collection and find the perfect touch to brighten your happy place.

name: Magnificent Stanley
description: Welcome to Magnificent Stanley, home to the original, beautiful personalised Liberty print t-shirts and gifts for babies and children. We have been creating clothing for little ones for 10 years. We were the first company to create t-shirts and clothing using Liberty print in this way. Every item in our range is created to last through the rough and tumble of childhood fun. Every high-quality item I carefully make for your child is lovingly produced in my home studio in Lewes.

name: Maison Spoon
description: Bonjour, I am Lucie, the founder of Maison Spoon - Vintage cutlery engraved by hand with cheeky or personalised words. I travel across antique markets all over the UK to uncover vintage spoons adorned with delicate floral details. I up-cycle old cutlery into one-of-a-kind pieces and give them a new life by delicately engraving each piece in my signature French cursive handwriting. I personalise them with playful words, sweet love notes and a hint of cheekiness, making each spoon a conversation starter or a memorable gift for your loved ones.

name: Make & Mend
description: Welcome to Make & Mend Company, our products are designed to help people live more creatively, colourfully and joyfully! Casting spools of support to those who need them most, we offer products that allow people to be creative, introducing them to the positive effects of making by hand. Our kits include not only instructions on how to stitch the beautiful joyful designs, but practical advice on how to stitch mindfully and relax into your craft. Our range includes embroidery kits to stitch yourself as well as colourful and inspirational handstitched artworks, notebooks and personalised gifts.

name: Make Note
description: Nothing beats reading back on old notebook entries - whether that's a forgotten idea from a stack of notebooks or reading about a happy day from a journal. We create custom notebooks, log books and journals to help encourage you to capture those moments and ideas you really don't want to forget. Your future self will thank you!

name: MamGu Welshcakes
description: Shwmae / Hello, I'm Becky & I'm the owner of MamGu Welshcakes! MamGu Welshcakes is a love letter to Welsh heritage, founded by using a secret recipe handed down from my beloved MamGu – “grandmother” in Welsh. From our coastal bakery here in St David's, we make both traditional and alternative Welsh Cake flavours that evoke the warmth and comfort of Mamgu's kitchen—a taste of home in every bite!

name: Mandy Sutcliffe Art
description: Hello I am Mandy & I am passionate, dare I say obsessed with drawing children. Fuelled by the story book illustrations of my youth (Milly-Molly-Mandy is still my hero!) I strive to capture the children of today in a nostalgic, timeless style. Within my art you will find wooden stilts & floppy hair bows alongside Nike swooshes & Hijabs. I draw, paint, print, stitch, collage the universal theme of childhood innocence & wonder. I adore what I do, I hope you will too.

name: Mapology Guides
description: Hi, I’m Tina. After years of personal inner work and a desire to give back, my love for design and personal development resulted in the creation of Mapology Guides - illustrated self-help maps for life’s journey. We are all meant to thrive, yet mental health illnesses are at a record high. Providing these visual tools to help people gain self-awareness and self-knowledge is a true honour for me. I really feel it’s my purpose. I love empowering people. I love igniting their spark. I love imagining them thrive.

name: Mara Wanda
description: Mara Wanda is an Italian artist and illustrator living in London. Her expressionistic figurative art often incorporates abstract elements and colour studies mostly representing interior scenery, still life, pets, food, botanicals, landscapes and portraits. Her mix media expertise ranges from acrylic to oil paint, watercolour, digital art and ceramics.

name: Marby & Elm
description: We have an old fashioned letterpress stationery & gift store in Clerkenwell, a beautiful 19th century shop full to the brim with humour, colour and deeply pressed text. We print bespoke cards in store and often while you wait. We specialise in one-off prints & gifts with an often naughty twist. Sisters Eleanor & Charlie design and make everything in store from greetings cards, posters to candles and jewellery.

name: Marita Wai
description: Hello, I'm Marita. I've been an artist all my life but only realised it recently. I make art using little more than flowers, sunlight and iron salts, which I think is simply magical. The process is called Cyanotype. It results in soothing, Prussian blue and white images. My art is for flower lovers, nature lovers and everyone seeking to add beauty to your life and enrich your environment. My art is hopeful and optimistic and will inspire a deeper connection to the natural world. Lovely to meet you x

name: Marmalade Sky
description: Originally I was a womenswear designer, so I used this skill to design fabrics and make clothes for my son. But after countless compliments and numerous requests from other mums I realised others felt the same and there was a gap in the market… and just like that, the Marmalade Sky was born. All prints are designed by me and are unique to the brand. We manufacture everything locally in Sheffield, using a team of machinists - which has been a wonderful experience for me. We’re also made-to-order business.. which means nothing goes to waste! We make what we need, when we need :)

name: Marmor Paperie
description: Marmor Paperie was launched in 2015 with the aim of breathing a new life into the endangered craft of paper marbling. Seeing shops saturated with mass-produced products, we wanted to herald a return to quality workmanship and give people back the joy of owning something truly special.

name: Maxine Gregson
description: After several years working as a commercial graphic designer, I followed my passion for creating art and screen prints. Drawing inspiration from music and literature, I soon developed a distinctive personal style. In 2023, my work was featured in The Guardian & Observer magazine. I was also selected for the prestigious Royal Academy Summer Exhibition in both 2023 and 2024.

name: McLaren's Christmas Pudding
description: Our family twist on the time-honoured recipe makes for a tasty pudding with a melt-in-the-mouth texture. We removed the stodgy suet, cut down the heavy flour and added a little extra butter. Zesty fruits, prunes, flaked almonds, cinnamon and nutmeg are then laced with French Brandy and Guinness Stout. Light, fluffy and utterly delicious, not only are these the best Christmas puddings around – but they’re also vegetarian-friendly.

name: ME & Blue
description: Hello, my name is M.E. Ster-Molnar and welcome to ME & Blue. I'm an artist at heart and my art has taken me on many creative journeys - fashion designer, boutique owner, artist, florist and more. My art reflects a sense of wonder in the details and imperfections of life around me. The texture of the river, the peeling posters on the city streets, vintage 7-Up signs, 80’s new wave music, and mother nature in the city. Worldly textiles, current fashion trends, blooming flowers, colorful outdoor markets, deep thoughts and the politics that seep into our everyday lives all intermingle in my creative world. Using collage, acrylics, oils, watercolor monoprints & more, I strive through my works to celebrate the beautiful flaws that make each of us and our world unique, infusing a bit of sunshine into each and every one of them.

name: Mean Mail
description: Mean Mail makes design-led, brutally honest greeting cards that tell the truth. Good friends send cards, best friends send Mean Mail.

name: Meg Cat Hooray
description: Hi! I'm the Meg behind Meg Cat Hooray! This little business of mine has evolved from my love for creating beautiful, modern & stylish celebrations. Making occasions extra special & memorable brings me so much joy. I offer an alternative to single use party decorations & accessories including Party Hats, Fabric Badges, Banners and more. I hope you will want to keep, treasure and reuse my makes for many years to come, making them part of your family traditions.

name: Meg Fatharly
description: Hello, I'm Meg. I am a multidisciplinary artist and maker working primarily with tin embossing, printmaking, and collage. My work explores themes of emotion, memory, and resilience, using tactile materials to create pieces that invite touch and reflection.

name: Memori Prints
description: Vince (aka known as Memori Prints), is an innovative graphic designer who creates stunning limited edition screen printed posters from his home studio and Ocean Studios in Plymouth. His unique designs are a combination of collage, vibrant colours, intriguing patterns, and bold images that perfectly marry a modern graphic art aesthetic with traditional screen printing techniques.

name: Merry + Brite
description: Hi, I’m Sophie the founder of Merry + Brite! Unable to find practical colourful cutlery I decided to design and create my own. This initial hand crafted product has led to a thoughtful collection of lighting and homeware. Built on creating products that combine evoking tradition and nostalgia, Merry + Brite’s homeware & lighting store is sure to bring both joy and colour from our studio to your home.

name: Merryday Studio
description: Faye is an award-winning designer and the founder of Merryday Studio. She has been working as a freelance artist for over 15 years, creating pop-up greeting cards among other creations. Inspired by the natural world, she transforms flat paper into three-dimensional animals and adds stylised surface pattern to create pop-up cards. They bring a dash of magic to any special occasion.

name: Merryfield Pottery
description: Hi I'm Helen - here in my Torquay studio a short walk from the sea and surrounded by my beloved cottage garden, I make my quirky and useful pottery collections. Produced from my original models, each item is slip cast from moulds. Finished by hand and meticulously decorated to a high standard. Often 'helped' by my cat Rumple, my aim is to enhance your home or garden with a smile!

name: Mersea Mudd Shack
description: Mersea Mudd Shack prides itself on using local natural produce to create beautiful handmade cosmetics and giftware. We use local Beeswax to make our handpoured Beeswax Candles and Beeswax Melts.

name: Meticulous Ink
description: Meticulous Ink is a small, women led team of lovely, diverse, creative folk that really care a lot about creating beautiful, unusual, tactile stationery.
