If you want to talk about the thickness and texture of paper, you've come to the right place.Our 1960s presses are what we use to print all our greeting cards, stationery box sets and printed matter that we sell in the tiny shop area of our studio. We also use them to produce bespoke print projects - from business cards and wedding invites to packaging and bookmarks. Behind the counter you can see our printworks, where the machines whirr and breathe. We proudly create bespoke design, and stationery printed the old fashioned way - using beautiful papers, time, patience, and a deep rooted passion for being meticulous. At the very back of the studio we teach our lettering and calligraphy workshops. The space is calm and friendly, full of creative inspiration and tactile, analogue trinkets.

name: Metre Candles
description: It all started with a candle - a very tall candle. As an event designer in London, our founder Jessica Lucas was a magpie when it came to sourcing the unusual and one of a kind - so when a friend spotted a pair of towering church candles for sale in Madrid, they were too perfect a gift to leave behind (even if they wouldn’t fit in her suitcase). There was just one problem: she only had two of them. And so began a two and a half year hunt to source candles on a grand scale - and when she couldn’t, to find the artisans who would be able to make them. "I created METRE Candles with that magic in mind. Whoever you are, whatever your reason, sometimes everyone just needs a moment to own something special.” - JESSICA LUCAS FOUNDER & DIRECTOR

name: Mew
description: I live down on the coast in St Leonards on Sea with my husband and 2 sausage dogs. And it's here in my studio that you will find me making my works on paper, textile pieces and ceramics. All of my screen print editions are also produced locally, by hand, using archival paper. I love Budgies! I feel as if they seem to be labelled with this 'kitsch' tag when in fact, they are the most beautiful creatures.

name: Mia Moo
description: Mia Moo is small clothing company based in Suffolk. Named after my daughter and inspired by her love of dressing up and all things sparkly!.

name: Miam Jars
description: Award-winning pickles, sauces and chutney for the flavour obsessed! At Miam Jars, we've been crafting delicious condiments since 2023. We are all about big flavours and small moments—those joyful pauses where you gather, share good food, and savour every bite. Made for spreading, spooning, and sharing, our jars bring people together around a bold, unforgettable taste. So slow down, call your mates, pass the jar, and relish the moment with Miam Jars.

name: Mikaela Lyons Jewellery
description: Responsibly made Luxe Jewellery • Handmade in England • Sterling Silver & 24ct Gold Vermeil Hallmarked in Birmingham's Jewellery Quarter. Member of 1% for the planet, donating 1% of my annual turnover to grassroots environmental organisations. 'From an early age I spent many hours in my Dad’s wood workshop, where my love of making & design began' - Mikaela Lyons

name: MilsTone Biscuits
description: Hi, I'm Mila, a passionate and enthusiastic baker driven by both the art of creating beauty and a deep love for baking. For me, there's nothing more fulfilling than sharing my delectable creations with the world. That's where my 'MilsTone' biscuits come into play!

name: Mims & Family
description: Products for fun-lovers and believers in magic. Little and lovely things to remind you to celebrate all the bits and pieces - to help you create your own story in everything you do. Merit patches for grown ups and little people, things to inspire the magic lurking in everyone's imaginations, encouragement to notice our beautiful world, and reminders to seek out fun and friends. All our products are designed to embody The Mims Manifesto; our notions to live by.

name: mini&thini
description: mini&thini, run by Rocio, mum of two beautiful little girls, is a London-based creative design studio and small business making natural textiles for little ones and unique baby gifts designed to add joy and magic into the lives of little ones. Lovingly handmade in their Soho studio, their pieces prioritise natural materials sourced from as nearby as possible and sensory elements for a safe and enriching play. Join them in creating a safe and magical environment for your child, filled with playfulness, love, and naturally good items

name: Mink
description: Something between a boutique and a joke shop. Mink is a design shop founded by artist Martha Hegarty in 2020. It creates objects that draw from a wide range of tones and themes: from jokes to pop culture to history, landmarks and theatre. Mink has created work in collaboration with a number of organisations, including Pollock's Toy Museum, the National Theatre, the British Library, MUBI, Picturehouse & the National Gallery of Ireland.

name: Minnie-Mae Studio
description: I am based in the Kent seaside town of Margate, creating and producing ceramics, printed textiles and interior decoration. British seaside landscapes, the history of London, Greek mythology, Italian kitsch decoration, East end markets and British vegetable growing culture inspire and inform my imagery and exploration of design, resulting in a healthy obsession with columns, peas and seashells. My hand-crafted ceramics are objects of empowerment, designed to evoke nostalgia and strength, whilst focusing on classical design. After the birth of our son Vincent, I decided to revisit my love of design and began to attend the drop-in classes at Clayspace. I found my calling and instantly began to spend all my waking hours there. I’ve not stopped since and most of my time is usually spent creating handmade ceramic pieces from inspiration and explorations.

name: Miss Bespoke Papercuts
description: Hello, beautiful! My name is Aimee and I am a watercolour and paper cut Illustrator based in Portsmouth. I am incredibly passionate about art and I enjoy creating fine art greetings cards that pop with colour and really grab your attention with bold paper cut text, and bespoke paper cuts that tell beautiful stories from memories and celebrations of love and life.

name: Mister Peebles
description: I'm Helen and I run Mister Peebles. He is a shy gent with a menagerie of animals and a love of puns. I am his human companion and I draw the animals and make the tea. Everything starts life as a hand drawn watercolour illustration and all products are loving made in the UK using planet-friendly materials.

name: Modo & Co
description: Based in the village of Haworth surrounded by Yorkshire moorland we are a small team of creatives designing and making from an old Yorkshire mill workshop and selling our colourful makes out of our neighbouring bricks and mortar shop. We make it our mission to support as many smaller and preferably local businesses as possible and many of our products come from a circular economy. This means that we use other peoples waste/off-cuts/left overs and rework them into something lovely. Imagine if everyone did a bit of this, the difference we could make to landfill and the environment!

name: Mole & Velvet
description: Welcome to Mole & Velvet! I believe in giving a new lease of life to old furniture and so I upcycle pieces using paint and prints. My workshop is based in Gloucestershire, that’s where you’ll find me either covered in paint or styling my own photoshoots for products or furniture.

name: momocreatura
description: Doorways to a magical World Inspired by European antiques, natural history, and the world of storytelling, our creations are like portals to a world of imagination. At times whimsical and humorous, they awaken a childlike imagination, adding a touch of magic to everyday life. These jewellery pieces, resembling fragments of stories, are designed to be worn, and as they adorn the wearer, they continue to weave new tales.

name: Mooch Antiques
description: Mooch is a small independent shop based in the Peak District National Park. I sell carefully sourced antiques, revive lost treasures and illustrate nostalgic greeting cards. Mooch loves anything old and past it like its founder! As I'm from 'up north' I do like to exercise my northern sense of humour! My greeting cards are designed to trigger nostalgia and make you chuckle just a little bit. If I achieve that alone then job done!

name: Mortlake Papers
description: Hi there I'm Alice Lickens and I run Mortlake Papers. I make playful eco-friendly stationery, all designed and made here in the UK. Each design starts life as a drawing, collage or painting made by me in my studio in Mortlake, South London. The artwork is digitised so that every brush stroke, inked line and texture can be seen in the finished product. Being sustainable is central to Mortlake Papers, our products are made of FSC recycled paper; this means that 100% of it is made from recycled materials. Our envelopes are vegan; they are made without the use of animal products, pigments or glues (including gelatine) and are made with 80-100% recycled materials.

name: Moulded By Sarah-Jane
description: Hello, I’m Sarah-Jane — the maker behind Moulded by Sarah-Jane. From my garden studio, I create simple, handcrafted pottery with a playful twist. I’m drawn to nature’s shapes and textures, letting them inspire pieces that feel organic and grounded. But I also love a bit of fun — so you’ll often find a cheeky design or a playful pun sneaking into my work. Each piece is shaped, fired, and glazed by hand, celebrating the slow, mindful rhythm of making. Whether it’s a personalised gift or a little something for yourself, my pottery is made to bring joy, connection, and a touch of whimsy to everyday life.

name: Mountain and Molehill
description: Stylishly witty animal based homeware Mountain & Molehill breathes new life into dusty old animal etchings. Edited and collaged together with an eye to anthropomorphic fun I use the old the images to create new and contemporary designs which are stylish feature in any room.

name: Mr Wolf Kids
description: Fabulously bright and beautiful baby and children's wear designed and manufactured in Essex. Made in the softest cotton jersey and digitally printed with fun, bold prints to make your little ones stand out amongst the cool kid's crowd!

name: Mr.PS
description: We design and print cotton handkerchiefs, produce delicious menu tea towels and delightful silk squares. Rematerialising in print, our best-selling collection of city map hankies reference streets and railway stations that no longer exist. The location featured may be the area you first lived or were born, the city you and your partner met, the place you got engaged, or the town you married in…

name: Muse Homeware
description: Hello, I’m Phoebe — founder of Muse Homeware. I launched the brand from my London flat in late 2024 with a simple goal: to create colourful, modern homeware that’s designed and hand-painted here in the UK. I’ve recently moved into my first studio space and am excited to grow my collection of homeware designs.

name: MW Makes
description: I set up MW Makes in 2017, from a desire to make with my own hands. Influenced by my background in architecture, items are designed with an emphasis on simple geometries, clean lines and functionality. I work exclusively with oak or vegetable tanned leather and are handmade from start to finish, using traditional saddlery techniques, such as saddle stitching and hand burnishing. The result is a collection of simple, functional items that are made to last.

name: My Bags of Stuff
description: Hi I’m Claire, the face behind My Bags Of Stuff and we make a range of statement bags and pouches. The majority of our products are personalised to our customers needs, helping them to stay organised and enjoy more quality time with their family. We like to mix simple design with bold colours and work hard to source products that are sustainable or have minimal impact on the environment.

name: My Papercut Forest
description: Welcome to My Papercut Forest, where creativity and imagination come to life! My name is Silvina De Vita, and I am a talented designer and paper artist. My Papercut Forest is my creative playground, where I unleash my imagination and try out new ideas, artworks, and designs. Here, I offer a wide range of handmade artworks, including paper craft kits, miniature paper domes, illustrations, prints, greeting cards, and other unique objects. As the sole designer and creator behind all of my designs, you can trust that each piece is made with love and attention to detail. All of my items are made in Brighton, UK, ensuring high quality and supporting local businesses. I hope you'll enjoy exploring My Papercut Forest and find something that sparks your creativity!

name: Naomi Anderson Subryan
description: Hello, I am a London based illustrator and maker working in a variety of mediums. I am a kitsch enthusiast, lover of colour and collector of Bric-A-Brac. My work is often inspired by the objects I like to surround myself with - the kinds of things we place on a shelf or mantelpiece that make us happy. I like to create things that are both vaguely familiar and yet unlike anything else.

name: Naomi Wilkinson Illustration
description: Inspired by the little things that bring me joy! Designed and printed in the UK. My products are all printed on recycled paper and card stock and all items come hand wrapped.

name: Natalie Cass Designs
description: Natalie Cass Designs is a small business set up and run exclusively by Natalie! All art is hand drawn or hand painted and made into beautiful prints. The prints come with the option of frames so they are ready to hang as soon as you receive them! The prints feature bold colours and relatable designs, with the aim to make art available to everyone!

name: Natasha Searston Prints
description: I make art for nice people who want nice things on their walls. My prints are a labour of love, each handmade at a screenprinting studio in East London and brought to life with vivid rainbow colours. They are often inspired by nature, regularly featuring plants, flowers, sea life and mushrooms, as well as an array of mischievous little creatures that hide in strange and colourful worlds. Some of my prints even glow in the dark thanks to special phosphorescent ink.

name: Natdraws
description: Natdraws is a London-based illustration studio run by Natalia Yañez-Stiel, an illustrator endlessly inspired by all things food. Natdraws embodies her love of colour and appetite for drawing food, bringing you jam-packed colour, rich details, and utterly adorable (tiny) prints. Natalia specialises in creating culinary-inspired art prints, greeting cards, and paper goods that celebrate the beauty and joy of food—her very own homage to life’s most delicious moments, perfect for anyone who treasures art as much as their favourite dish.

name: Natthakur
description: Natalie Thakur has been creating exciting contemporary bag and accessory designs in leather for almost two decades. From the early stages her work catapulted her into prestigious stores such as Selfridges and The V&A, winning ‘The Best of British’ in Liberty of London and featured in The World of Interiors and Vogue amongst many publications. Her brand has become known for reinterpreting everyday design classics utilising bold graphics, fine details and combining a ‘Made in Britain’ ethos with fine craftsmanship in leather.

name: Neil van der Knutsen
description: Graphic designer, illustrator, screen printing artist.

name: New Street Designs
description: Hey, I'm Katie! We take immense pride in crafting personalised bones, ensuring each one is carefully handmade to the highest standards. With every bone, we infuse love and care, wrapping it beautifully before sending it off to your fur babies. Our dedication to quality and artistry has garnered a lot of recognition, including a feature in VOGUE magazine. Experience the joy of treating your furry companions with something truly special.

name: nibs etc.
description: Hi, my name is Chloë. I'm obsessed with food and emotional about food waste. nibs etc. makes delicious and nutritious, upcycled snacks from industry byproducts that normally get thrown away, to fight food waste. Because food waste is totally nuts, we are changing daily rituals, nibble by nibble. At nibs etc. we're on a mission to design 'waste' out of our dictionaries. We celebrate nutritious yet misunderstood ingredients – byproducts – such as British apple juice pulp which is naturally high in fibre, and marry them with high quality ingredients. Food waste is one of the biggest contributors to climate change, according to Project Drawdown. By upcycling ingredients that otherwise get thrown away, we not only tackle the environmental issues but also the socio-economic challenges posed by wasteful supply chains; by making sure valuable nutrients such as fibre and protein are being used to feed humans, and not animals, energy or landfill.

name: Nic Brittin
description: Nic Brittin Studio is my creative home. A place where textiles and homeware are made with loving hands. Where childhood memories, the natural world and my love of colour combine to create lifelong textiles. Invested in pleasure and beauty, these pieces are made with love. With a hope that you will make memories gathered around them

name: Nicky Stewart
description: Hello I’m Nicky! Have you ever thought about knitting a puffin, but wouldn’t know where to start? Maybe I can help! I’m a lifelong bird nerd, nature lover, and a self-taught knitter. I design and make fun and easy bird knit kits, using the birds that surround me every day in the Scottish highlands as inspiration. My kits are designed to be relaxing and simple, perfect to inspire a beginner knitter, or as a thoughtful gift to a bird-loving friend.

name: Nicola Lebon
description: I’m Nicola and I make ceramics from earthenware clay. I’m based in the town of Margate and I take my inspiration from anthropology, folklore, popular culture and nature. I’m very lucky to have an array of museums and attractions nearby that help inspire my creations, along with the amazing and varied shorelines and vistas we have here in Thanet. All my pieces are lovingly made and painted by hand, in small batches. Each piece is unique.

name: Nicola Rowlands
description: My grandma bought me a pretend sweet shop when I was probably around 7 and my whole life I’ve been building on this image in my head, a little shop of my own where I’d sell my own designs and other wonderful things like soaps, cookies, books but it was the covid19 pandemic in 2020 saw me opening a brick and mortar shop while all the other non essentials around me were closing their doors. My brand is colourful, sometimes sweary - you'll find gifts and cards that say just the right words at just the right time.

name: Nicoles Jungle
description: These adorable paper miniatures are inspired by a love of plants and make the perfect unique and thoughtful gift for any plant lover. Each plant is individually handmade, combining two of my passions: houseplants and crafting. Working from my home studio in the south coast of England, I am entirely self-taught and have been developing my craft for more than 30 years.

name: Night Time Holiday
description: Hello, I’m Brooke and I create thoughtful and playful jewellery and Pet Tags to be worn both for fun and forever! I'm passionate about creating timeless keepsakes to mark milestones and bring you joy. I use playful shapes and bespoke etched doodles to give cool classic designs extra personality. And because your Dogs deserve to feel cute too, I also create bespoke, beautiful, durable Pet Tags, each hand engraved and truly unique.

name: Nina Paloma
description: Handcrafting illustrated ceramics for your home. Inspired by nature and environments, creating functional and decorative pieces to be enjoyed timelessly.

name: Nix Hawkins Ceramics
description: Individual hand-crafted ceramics to sit comfortably in your hands and homeHand-crafted from my studio in the heart of the Dorset, I make wheel thrown stoneware ceramics that are designed to be both beautiful and useful.

name: Noodle Doll Nelly
description: Hello! I’m Jess and I’m the founder, designer and maker behind happy kids brand Noodle doll Nelly. Everything is designed and hand stitched by myself here at my studio in South Wales. I make magical hand stitched wall banners and also bold and vibrant printed fabric wall hangings. I love colour and pattern, and my aim is to create colourful and positive decor that will hopefully inspire creativity, spark imagination and magic, and most importantly of all - fun!

name: Noolibird Handmade Stamps
description: I set up Noolibird in 2003, I wanted to share my love of printed patterns and lino cutting. Stamps seemed to be an ideal way to translate my designs and a perfect small business to run from home. Since then we have continued to evolve the stamp collection, due to my love of exploring new ways of creating and combining pattern and colour and the range of designs has expanded way beyond what I would ever have imagined! I love to encourage creativity in others and although I work mostly on my own, I never feel lonely as every day I am hearing from my customers all over the world. I get tantalising little snippets of their life as well as getting to hear about and see the beautiful cards and crafts they create.

name: Norfolk Natural Living
description: A desire to bring pleasure to my everyday rituals. From washing the dishes to cleaning my jumpers to falling asleep. These are rituals we all do every single day (and even more when you have children) and I believe it is possible to elevate them to something we enjoy, possibly even look forward to. By incorporating purposeful aromatherapy infusions into each of our products, we are being both mindful of our environment whilst also mindful of the benefits purposeful fragrance can have on our mindset.

name: Norrska
description: Cultures from around the world, brimming with stories and traditions, serve as the vibrant wellspring of inspiration for Norrska’s exquisite paper creations. We translate the richness of human history into captivating narratives, meticulously crafted using the art of paper folding and joining techniques passed down through generations.

name: not another one
description: We are a Sussex-based wax artistry studio, dedicated to imagining the unimaginable and playing with reality. Our work transforms the humble candle into something extraordinary – sculptural pieces that blur the line between art and object, familiar and unexpected. Each creation is rooted in a love for detail, storytelling, and sensory delight. We draw inspiration from nature, food, heritage, and ritual, crafting candles that spark curiosity, evoke memory, and invite a rare sense of calm and stillness in a busy world. More than candles, our pieces are moments – playful, poetic, and timeless. A celebration of the extraordinary hidden within the everyday.

name: Not Now Nancy
description: Not Now Nancy is a print maker & designer who works from her studio in South London and The Thames Barrier Print Studios. Her work is full of symbolism, antiquity and symmetry. Many of her prints embody forgotten themes from mythology, folk law, history books and a little starters (geek). Bringing together contemporary visual symmetry and a historical narrative she constructs one harmonious image. Retelling this narrative from a fairer angle she begins to rewrite the history that has been passed down through the male voice in a more palatable manor. In essence giving women, minorities and misrepresented historial characters back the power that was taken from them in mistold stories.

name: Notch Handmade
description: Notch Handmade is an artisan leatherwork business based in Tregaron, Ceredigion, in the heart of rural Wales. I create bags and accessories to order, hand-dyeing the leather and making each piece by hand from start to finish, with a view to an end product that will be useful and loved over time, whilst keeping my process focused on low waste and sustainability. Here at Holly & Co, my 'Little Monsters' collection are fun pieces to be enjoyed by kids aged 3 to 103.

name: Notes by Piper
description: Piper's notes are to her imaginary boyfriends Tony Thompson / Lee, Jake or Jim. Piper Revere is a Hackney artist who is 17, autistic and profoundly deaf, with a creative talent to be truly jealous of. Piper communicates and connects with people through her notes in a truly magical way. Some to her imaginary boyfriends and others to her family if they're lucky. “When I do my art it helps me with my wobbly balance. I do it all myself.”

name: Odd Goose
description: We’re Odd Goose, a sustainable, design-led kids’ stationery brand based in Bath, UK. We're all about making children's stationery to encourage a love of creating, playing, thinking and dreaming on paper. Our products are made by hand in our studio using traditional foil printing and hand finishing techniques to create unique, tactile items that are both functional and exciting. All our stationery uses high quality, carefully sourced papers and materials that are loved by grown ups alike!

name: Old Green
description: Not so long ago, people and nature were in sync as part of a big, natural loop – ensuring renewal for continued harmony. But recently we’ve been treating Earth’s resources like they’re endless - forgetting that what we do today decides what kind of world we’ll have tomorrow. Our goal is to reconnect with this natural cycle, working with nature not against it and securing a thriving future for our planet and the generations to come. Our female team handcrafts our wares in small batches using rescued, repurposed & recycled materials rather than virgin supplies. We keep your health at the forefront of our minds, using non-toxic, naturally derived ingredients. Our mission is to inspire you to create a home that forms a meaningful connection with nature, values the earth’s resources, and supports a slower, more balanced way of living.

name: Oldfield Design Co
description: Oldfield Design Co are a small family business creating home and lifestyle products that focus on the enjoyment of living an active life outdoors.

name: Oli Fowler Art
description: Hi there! welcome to my page! My name is Oli Fowler and I make screen printed artwork. For those of you that don't know, its a form of hand pulled printing where you print in layers to achieve your final artwork. I've been learning how to screen print now for over 15 years. I've just setup my own studio In Hertfordshire. It's taken ages to find all of the equipment but it's all I ever wanted to do in my life, come join me on my journey!

name: Olives Et Al
description: Olives Et Al has spent 30 years developing an extraordinary range of award-winning products from Kiln Roasted Nuts & Snacks to unique Dressings, Sauces and Condiments plus, of course, our incredible Olives.

name: Ollie Cooper Signs
description: Ollie Cooper is a lettering artist from South London who specialises in signwriting, murals and branding. His work is hand-crafted, bold and playful, providing commentary on subjects such as pop culture, societal and environmental issues.

name: One Million Lovely Letters
description: Hi! I'm Jodi Ann Bickley and this is One Million Lovely Letters Greeting Cards – where heartfelt sentiments come to life in beautifully designed cards that capture the essence of your emotions. Building upon our legacy of spreading love through handwritten letters, our brand now extends its warmth and personal touch into a stunning array of greeting cards. Each One Million Lovely Letters Greeting Card is a miniature work of art, meticulously crafted to convey love, appreciation, and connection. I believe that a well-chosen card can be a source of joy, inspiration, and comfort, just like our handwritten letters have been. With One Million Lovely Letters Greeting Cards, you can now share your emotions in a tangible, keepsake form, while still enjoying the personal touch that defines our brand. Join us in celebrating the art of heartfelt communication as we continue our mission to spread love, one card at a time.

name: OneWildOne
description: Discover your untamed style at OneWildOne. We craft vibrant, intricate pieces as unique as you are. Our collection of bracelets, earrings, and necklaces in 925 sterling silver with 14k and 18k gold plating is designed to make you shine. Waterproof and tarnish-resistant, our jewellery is ready for any adventure. Each piece tells a story as alluring and rare as its wearer. At OneWildOne, jewellery should be as extraordinary as the person adorning it. Shop our curated selection and let your wild side sparkle. Embrace the extraordinary – your perfect piece awaits at OneWildOne. Stay Wild x

name: Onneke
description: Nature-inspired letterbox gifts, art prints and illustrated greeting cards. Eco friendly and made in the UK. Onneke is a designer and illustrator based on the South Coast of England, inspired by the ever-changing landscapes of the South Downs and the British coastline. She uses her colourful, contemporary artwork to create high-quality cards, prints and logbooks that bring joy, calm and connection.

name: Orange Otter Design
description: Anything but ordinary. I want you to smile every time you walk into your home. Marrying style with sustainability, at Orange Otter Design I transform quality, preloved furniture into beautiful statement pieces with a colourful, contemporary twist. I truly believe in the power of colour to express ourselves and to make us feel good. My aim is to bring JOY into your home. Everything is hand finished with care for a high-quality finish with a unique design to suit each piece.

name: Orgill Originals
description: Orgill Originals is a family run business based in a little village in Derbyshire, UK. The business idea was imagined by me, Nicole, along side my father, Neil. We started our leathercraft journey in 2016, self taught together we have developed our skills and creative ideas to bring the business to life.

name: Origami Est
description: Origami Est is founded by origami ninja - Esther Thorpe. She has a passion for passing on her love for all things paper folding. Est has been designing, folding & teaching origami for over 10 years & she's also a published author of Paper Home. Est is passionate about origami making a difference to people's lives - improving mental health, creating community and championing sustainability. She also has two adorable long haired guinea pigs who are often confused for walking toupées.

name: Otto & Flow
description: Hi I'm Sally and welcome to Otto & Flow. Combining my passion for painting, my love of dogs and especially my own dog, Otto, and the calm and meditative Flow that comes when I paint dogs and cats. I created Otto & Flow to provide thoughtful artisan gifts for dog lovers, hand-painted in the recognisable Otto & Flow style. My ethos is that your dog will always be part of your story and you of theirs so let's celebrate the wonderful bond that humans and their dogs have created.

name: Oxford Ceramics
description: Oxford Ceramics - home of contemporary porcelain tableware that surprise, intrigue and surely make you smile. All designs are created and carefully handcrafted by Kina Gorska. We work with English Bone China - a type of porcelain that is white as snow, divinely translucent and super durable. Everything in our studio is handmade. We fire it in our purpose-made kilns which are uniquely designed to mature ceramics at a range of different temperatures.

name: Painted by Amy
description: I am a sign painter, gilder and artist based in Devon. I undertook an apprenticeship with an experienced sign painter at the start of 2020 and immediately fell in love with gold leaf. A self-taught gilder with a background in fine art, I enjoy the playfulness of unexpected words juxtaposed with a decorative and traditional craft. My favourite pieces include colour, some excellent word choices and considered detailing.

name: Paloma's Products
description: We are Milly and Jack, the founders of Paloma’s Products. Paloma is our Mini Double Doodle dog and the muse for Paloma’s Products.

name: Paper & Wood
description: Mixed media sculptures, artworks and Kits inspired by the beauty and details I find in the natural world around me. Commission a one off sculpture of something you love in nature, or have a wonderful mindful time creating your own artwork with one of my easy to follow paper kits to make at home. "Nature deserves attention to detail"- Zack x

name: Paper Star Create
description: Hello there, a warm welcome to Paper Star Create the home of colourful and creative origami and paper craft kits. Origami is a fantastic craft for all ages and such a relaxing way to spend a bit of time. It’s magical to see how you can transform a flat piece of paper into something entirely different with just a few folds. All my kits are designed to be a fun introduction to origami with easy to follow instruction, sparking joyful creativity. Fun to make yourself or ideal for a unique and thoughtful gift. Designed for kids and the young at heart! Happy Crafting Jo x

name: PaperArgonauts
description: Welcome to my curious, colourful world! The general sentiment here is the beautiful tradition of sending love. A little 'thinking of you', a parcel of positivity, a boost of motivation, a token of affection. It’s the little things in life that make us smile, and there’s not much better than knowing you’re in someone's thoughts. So dive in, discover valentine love letters based on magical 18th century puzzle purses, love tokens inspired by those sailors carved during perilous months on the seas and embroidered wall art reminiscent of WW1 sweetheart pin cushions.

name: Paperwhale Cards
description: Paperwhale is an eco-friendly card and paper goods publisher created by illustrator Lianne Harrison who creates all of Paperwhale’s papercut collage designs. She aims to create beautifully unique designs that inspire and take you to another place.

name: Parkin & Lewis
description: Hi, I am Joanna the (only) person to make all these items you see in my shop. I have always been a creative person, passionate about making products that are reusable and will stand the test of time. That is why I love working with leather so much. It only gets better with age. There are so many things you can do with it too, stamping, burnishing, engraving, dying, painting etc. I love the idea of making products that produce memories people treasure forever.

name: Path Homeware
description: Hand-picked, beautiful accessories and lovingly designed organic cotton for your home. Each item we sell is made with love in small batches using ancient traditions, natural inks and organic fabrics. We pair these with beautiful finds from around the world and vintage treasures. We love to mix vintage and craft and are inspired by nostalgia and nature. We make and design our products slowly and thoughtfully and every detail and decision we make is considered and mindful.

name: Patroula Jewellery
description: Hi, I’m Patroula…and for as long as I can remember I have had a fascination with jewellery. I believe the pieces we collect create a link between our present and our past, eventually linking together to tell the story of our life. My jewellery is a collection of creative pieces designed for the confident woman, to be worn as an act of self expression and as a lasting reminder of the inner strength within all of us.

name: Paul Worthy
description: Hi, I’m Paul, a Graphic Designer and Linocut Printmaker based in Cardiff. I began experimenting with lino as a medium during lockdown, and I have found that linocut printing provides me with an enjoyable contrast to my digital-based day job. My background in design influences my work, helping me to explore the possibilities of physical composition. When I’m not working, I’ll spend as much time as I can outside — cycling, hill walking or sea swimming.

name: Peckham Sauce Co
description: Our small batch craft fermented sauces originated in Peckham, London. A mix of secret spices are blended with our favourite chillies to create Britain’s freshest, finest hot sauce. We’re 100% Vegan, 100% Natural and don’t add any preservatives or additives. All of our sauces are designed to enhance the natural flavour and heat in any dish. We ferment hot chillies with spices and aromatics to create a fragrant profile and wonderfully refined heat.

name: Peggy & Kate
description: Kate Cronk is an illustrator and calligrapher based in West Malling, Kent. After collecting stationery for a number of years, she founded her own studio Peggy & Kate in the summer of 2014, combining her love of colour, painting and nature. As both Peggy and Kate (Peggy is her middle name), she has grown her studio to include prints, birthday cards and bespoke paintings of houses, people and pets. Seeking both humour and beauty in the everyday, Kate’s projects are also inspired by the places she loves – from the lushness of her family home and plant nursery in Kent, to London’s historic architecture and gardens.

name: Penguin Ink
description: Hi I’m Lizzie, the designer behind Penguin Ink luxury letterpress cards and homewares. Working from my garden studio my designs are inspired by my love for nature, featuring my favourite flora and fauna. Our cards are traditionally pressed by lovely local family printers. Letterpress is a beautiful technique, using gorgeous old machines, it is a true craft. My designs are striking and simple using just one or two colours to depict the shadows, highlights of the form, using simple lines and shapes creating a lovely texture on the cards.

name: Penny Grace Knitwear
description: Hi, I’m Helen (not actually Penny or Grace!). I named my small business after my two daughters who are the driving force behind everything I do. I am a female founded independent business, making luxury knitwear from my home studio in West London, using 100% Lambswool spun in the UK. Penny Grace Knitwear is a design-led, slow fashion brand creating fun, colourful and beautifully knitted accessories. Designs include wristwarmers, snoods, scarfs and beanie hats.

name: Peony Belles
description: Peony Belles is a flower studio specialising in beautiful, everlasting arrangements that bring colour, character, and calm into any space. Founded by Kelly, a florist with a love for colour and emotional connection, each bouquet is thoughtfully designed and hand tied in her home studio. Drawing inspiration from fashion, art, and the people she meets, Kelly creates floral pieces that are anything but ordinary vibrant, lasting, and full of feeling. Whether it’s a bunch to brighten your home or a gift with meaning, Peony Belles offers flowers that stay beautiful long after the moment has passed.

name: Periwinkle Ink
description: I am a self taught linocut artist, working from my home studio on the sunny south coast. I love to create hand carved ink stamps which can be used to create your own recyclable wrapping paper and gift tags. These are also great for creating your own unique invitations, journals, scrap booking, product tags, the list is endless!

name: Petit Boo Che
description: Welcome to Petit Boo Che, where imagination is infinite. I specialise in beautifully crafted, bespoke felt decor, ranging from complementary additions to bold statement pieces. Perfect for your little one's nursery or playroom.

name: Petra & Co
description: Hello, my name is Jessie, I am the founder of Petra & Co. Like many families, Christmas is my favourite time of the year. I believe crackers bring so much joy to families at Christmas and on special occasions. My mission is to make sustainable yet pretty crackers that contain fabulous goodies all sourced from small UK businesses.

name: Petra Boase
description: Petra Boase is an independent British creative design studio based in Norwich, established in 1999. Colourful, nostalgic, playful and unique, the brand is an extension of the personality and imagination of founder Petra a self-confessed creative fidget, fast crafter and fan of all things vintage. A small Business with craft and sustainability at its heart, Petra Boase aims to bring a little bit of joy to the everyday.

name: Philly & Friends
description: Philly & Friends is an award-winning purpose-led children's lifestyle & toy brand on a mission to add a drop of colour and diversity to the playroom while empowering literacy in underprivileged children. We create beautifully crafted children's books and dolls designed to instil confidence and self-love through the power of representation. All our products are based on Philly & her wonderful friends. Social impact is at the heart of what we do. For every product sold, we sponsor a book into the hands of an underprivileged child.

name: Piggy's Hot Honey
description: Ridiculously tasty on everything.

name: Pigscombe Makers
description: Hi, I am Philippa. I make things that refuse to blend into the background — from colourful butterdishes and hand-thrown jugs, mugs, plates, and bowls, to wooden flying birds that dance in the breeze. Whether it’s clay or wood, practical tableware or purely decorative whimsy, each piece is made to bring a little lift to your day and a smile to your home.

name: Pine and bear
description: Pineandbear is a collection of unique handmade gifts for adventurous families, celebrating the nostalgia of vintage camp life and the great outdoors. Included in the range are adventure gifts for children, pennant flags, embroidered name patches, and personalised camping gifts. All designed and made from a small home studio in Brighton, UK. Many of the products can be personalised to create an heirloom to treasure forever.

name: Pins & Needles
description: Creative, embroidered designs and bespoke artworks.

name: Pinyatay
description: Custom made piñatas for every occasion. From the smallest gathering to the biggest bash- every party needs a piñata! Let me help you throw the best party ever! All of my piñatas are bespoke so I can accommodate even the wildest designs. And because they are made to order you can easily add a personalisation to make it extra special.

name: Pip and Henry
description: Hi there, my name is Jeroo, I’m the founder and CEO of Pip and Henry. Driven by a love for the environment, I created a sustainable footwear brand for kids. Our playful shoes are made from eco-friendly materials and can be recycled when outgrown.

name: Pipwin
description: From as young as I can remember, I have loved and cherished the outdoors, having often used it as a sanctuary during challenging times in the past. Whether crafting with twigs or foraging alongside my father, nature has always been a significant part of my life. Jewellery has been a passion of mine for many years. My journey began at age eight, making friendship bracelets in a pottery class, and evolved to silver wire-wrapping sea glass in later years. Each step has led me closer to where I am meant to be—here, creating unique pieces that reflect my connection to the natural world. Becoming a mother to our two beautiful daughters, Winnie and Piper, has inspired me and fostered growth in ways I could never have imagined. Lastly, none of this would be possible without my husband, Angus.

name: Pivot
description: We design products that can be made in hostels, bringing flexible and meaningful employment for those with difficulty accessing it. Our products are made by and support people experiencing homelessness. Every purchase takes our Makers one step closer to their goal of leaving the hostel.

name: Pixiecraft
description: Hello, I am Katy the hands behind the stitching of Pixiecraft. I create colourful hand embroidered artwork from my illustrations with every piece being stitched together by hand. Hand embroidery is a slow art that brings a little magic into every piece. With designs based around promoting positive mental health and uplifting words I bring together words and design to craft art that can bring a little sunshine into every day.

name: Poetry Pharmacy
location: Bishop's Castle, Shropshire & Oxford Street, London
description: Poetry On Prescription. At the Poetry Pharmacy we believe that poetry can do so much to match or alter a mood, to assist in so many ways with good mental health. The Poetry Pharmacy parks up the ambulance and brings the therapeutic effects of poetry under one roof, with an emphasis on well-being and inclusivity.

name: Polly Mabel Illustrations
description: Polly Mabel Illustrations offers original watercolour and ink artworks and limited edition giclee prints. I love to create mixed media, playful, highly decorative art inspired by seasonal flowers and pottery that will bring joy to the space it is placed in.

name: Polly Wren Studios
description: Polly Wren Studios is a team of knitters and embroiderers who are keen to keep the age old craft of hand-knitting and hand-embroidery alive. Creating one-off custom pieces here in Britain, we hand-make bespoke clothing for our precious little ones. Using your choice of yarn fibres and yarn colours, we create each piece completely unique to you.

name: Poppy and Honesty
description: Hi I'm Sophie! I design 'fun and functional' homewares that are designed to bring your cheer as well as last a life time. I adore blending chintzy Liberty fabrics with Gingham and Candy Stripes. The mish-mash of pattern and colour brings with it a joyful chaos. At Poppy and Honesty we like to use tip-top fabrics including Liberty of London Tana Lawn Cotton as well as Designers Guild Velvets and premium tumbled linens.

name: Portamus
description: Ever yearn for just honest products? Simply made by traditional methods, by someone who cares. I don’t handmake each bag using old tools and old methods just because it’s fashionable. I do it because it’s better. All Portamus products are handmade from start to finish right here in the Stroud valleys – by me, Ben. They’re made for the outdoors. Making the best of traditional British waterproofed fabrics and Italian vegetable tanned leather (which smells amazing). Just perfect for our predictably unpredictable weather.

name: Postcard Models
description: Postcard Models was born out of the ambition to recreate childhood memories in miniature form. Building inspiration from British architecture and our surroundings - every day life inspires us.

name: Potily
description: Hi I'm Jane, and I am the founder of Potily. Potily is all about beautiful decorative plant pots that can be used either indoors or out. My specialty is bright, colourful floral patterns that are bursting with personality, they are unlike any mass-produced item you'll find out there! Whether you're a plant lover seeking a pot with a difference or searching for a thoughtful gift for someone special, these plant pots are a wonderful choice.

name: Pott Candles
description: Tired of throwing away empty candle jars? We have the solution with our refillable candles - handmade by artisans around the country. Each refillable Pott is hand-thrown by local potters, giving it its own little quirks and personality. No two are quite the same – and that’s the beauty of it. When something’s made by hand, it carries a little of the person who made it. Our candles are blended and poured by hand, using natural wax, 100% essential oils, and sustainable fragrance oils. We switch up our scents with the seasons, so there’s always something new to lift your mood and bring warmth into your space. At the heart of Pott is a simple kind of kindness: to the earth, to the people who make our products, and to you. Because when something’s made with care, it makes you feel good too.

name: Pri Pri
description: Hello, my name is Priya. I grew up in London but I'd spend summers in India with my grandmother who was always dressed in a Sari and had a passion for sewing. She taught me how to make everything, from scrunchies to dresses. The love for clothing she gave me led me to a career in textiles for a major retailer. During this time, wanting to create something unique for my gorgeous niece, I cut up one of my mother's old saris and crafted the little girl a dress. Seeing how much she loved it I began to make more and a short time later I launched Pri Pri. One of the things that makes us special is that our clothes are a beautiful blend traditional Indian fabrics and western design. Stitching together the two cultures that have made me.

name: PrimsPrintsDesign
description: Prims Prints is a joyful collection of uniquely crafted wrapping paper, imagined and brought to life by husband-and-wife duo Josh & Emily Inspired by nature, nostalgia, and the seasons, our designs turn everyday gifting into something magical. From spooky pumpkins to festive florals, each print is made with love (and a bit of chaos) in our UK home studio.

name: Princetown Press
description: At Princetown Press, we do things the hard way. Nothing is efficient, and only the lights are powered by electricity. From our workshop in rural Devon, we use heritage craft techniques, hand-powered printing presses, and British-made recycled papers to create printed ephemera that inspire and delight.

name: Print Sisters Archive
description: Print Sisters Archive, founded in 2020 by the creative sister duo, Alexia and Claudia, born during the initial lockdown, this small, independent, female-led company curates an extensive collection of rare artworks, historical prints, and timeless textile patterns. Our ethos revolves around celebrating craftsmanship, blending creativity with heritage, and embodying a sense of timeless style. Through reviving vintage prints, we manifest our passion for fashion, interior design, and a commitment to environmental consciousness, offering accessible art to all.

name: Prohibition Cocktails
description: Born from the creative minds at The Lockdown Bar—proudly ranked as one of the top five cocktail bars in the Tees Valley. Our cosy spot in Marske-by-the-Sea is all about blending the old with the new. Inspired by the Prohibition era, a time when creativity knew no bounds, we pour that same spirit into every bottle. We love keeping it local and being sustainable. Our cocktails feature fresh fruits from the village fruit shop and are crafted with care, partnering with local brands wherever we can. We aim to bring our community together and promote the talented artisan makers close to us.

name: Purcell-Green Studios
description: Purcell-Green Studios is an independent female run business based in Northwich, Cheshire. We design fun, illustrative and colourful high quality prints and plantable greeting cards which bring joy and colour to all! Our love for nature is always at the heart of each piece we create. Our mission is to help our planet by using tree-free paper packed full of bee friendly wildflower seeds and use sustainable packaging where possible.

name: Quinton Chadwick
description: Quinton Chadwick products are recognised for their unique colour combinations; their fun take on traditional knits, the sustainability of their British production and the quality of their craftsmanship. We use British mills for our yarn supplies, always 100% natural and biodegradable fibres. Mostly Lambswool or Merino and we also use Recycled Cashmere when it is available. We like to combine traditional knitting techniques with new technology to make a more sustainable product. Our seamless hats , gloves and cut edge scarves are cleverly designed to ensure there is zero yarn waste in the production process.

name: Quirk & Whimsy
description: Hello there! I’m Anna, a multimedia artist with a passion for porcelain, paper and slow processes. I fell in love with clay when I was eight years old and I’m still addicted to working with it now I’m a fifty-something! I spend my days designing and creating whatever comes to mind, loving the process and hoping each item will bring joy to whoever chooses it for their home.

name: Rach Lloyd Press
description: Hi, I'm Rach — a printmaker and ceramicist living in rural Shropshire. I've loved making, drawing, and creating for as long as I can remember, and I try to hold on to that childlike creativity and joyful energy that art brings. I'm especially drawn to traditional, tactile techniques like letterpress and linocut, and I enjoy the hands-on, three-dimensional nature of working with clay. I also have a deep love for poetry and words, which naturally finds its way into my letterpress work. My practice brings all these passions together, creating bold, timeless prints for lovely people.

name: Raspberry Blossom
description: We’re a wife (Rebecca) and husband (Mark) team based in sunny Leamington Spa. Our aim is to inspire everyday moments of joy for everyone who interacts with our colourful products. We make sure that all of our products are abundant with colour, inspired by the things we love and our loved ones, created with hand drawn typography, painted illustrations, graphical patterns or acrylic abstract paintings. We ensure quality is at the heart of everything we produce while also pushing innovation with our forward-thinking, colourful and trend-focussed design. We’re proudly family-run, with everything lovingly designed and printed in the UK.

name: Rebecca Buchanan Illustration
description: I'm Rebecca, an illustrator and printmaker based in West Yorkshire. My practice combines traditional analogue techniques—such as painting, collaging, and printmaking—with digital processes playing with colour and shapes to create joyful, character-driven designs and risograph printed greeting cards.

name: Rebecca Ceramics
description: Rebecca Ceramics embraces the crossover space between art, craft and design. Objects and designs play with our sense of what is familiar, functional and beautiful. Each piece is a curious balance between the raw materiality of clay and glaze and an object’s function or purpose. Rebecca Ceramics loves to collaborate. Recent commissions have included works for Aberdeen Standard Life, Chateau Villepreux and a design collaboration with UK fashion designer Olivia Ruben. Several media have featured Rebecca Ceramics work including most recently; The Great Pottery Throwdown, Channel 4’s Inside Out Homes, Etc Magazine, Landscape Magazine and more.

name: Rebecca Edelmann Ceramics
description: Rebecca Edelmann is a Danish potter who started making her own ceramics while on maternity leave with her first child a decade ago. She has since sold her work to galleries and shops all over the world. She has a little sunlit but mostly quite messy studio space at the mixed makers studio Inbristol Studios where she has been since 2018, working as a full time ceramicist since 2020 The rest of time she spends with her partner the poet Joel Scarfe and their two children.

name: Rebecca Strickson
description: Hey there! I’m Rebecca, and I am an illustrator, artists and do-er of things with over 15 years experience. You may have seen my work already with Holly’s Campaign Shop Independent, amongst others; I create bold, bright and unique prints, cards, patches and homeware from a heart full of community, collaboration and protest. Working from my studio in sunny seaside Margate, I create joyful and positive work designed with a passionate delight.

name: Rebel Stationery
description: We are Rebel Stationery. And we have a mission. We design sustainable luxury stationery that gives back to communities around the world.

name: Redbellyboy
description: Redbellyboy, AKA Ewan Taylor, is an artist specialising in limited edition, handmade screen prints. His unique style draws inspiration from pop culture, film, graphic design, loud music and tries to squeeze as much of it in as possible. Bright colours, bold lettering, intricate designs, and humour are all key ingredients.

name: Refuge Chocolate
description: Hey, we are the Magee Family, proud new owners of Refuge Chocolate in Ballymena. Refuge Chocolate was created with the belief that chocolate can be a force for good. That spirit continues with us, and we’re excited to build on it with new goals for the future. We remain committed to being a social enterprise, supporting people and communities through our work. At the same time, we’re expanding Refuge’s vision to include regenerative farming and sustainable agriculture — making sure that what goes into our chocolate is as kind to the planet as it is delicious to drink. From ethical ingredients to eco-friendly packaging, we’re working to create chocolate that not only tastes good, but also helps shape a better future for people and the environment.

name: Rho Rho Illustrations
description: We are an illustration & graphic design duo based in Aberdeenshire, and make illustrated prints and products for the home using our original and distinctive detailed drawings.

name: Rich C Studio
description: I’m Rich – an independent sign painter and designer. I handcraft bold signs, custom prints and lettering that turn heads and win hearts. Every piece is made the old-school way – by hand, with heart. Inspired by fellow makers, breakers, dreamers and doers, I create joyful, one-of-a-kind work that helps small businesses and creative folk stand out, feel proud and fly their flag high.

name: Richard Heeps
description: I am a film-based photographer, I use a range of vintage analogue cameras. I consider myself to have three studios, the external studio of whichever location I may be shooting, my darkroom where I make my master prints and my home studio where I do the postproduction where the artworks are mounted, framed and finished. I have always wanted my work to be accessible without compromising on quality and making everything in house I am in control of each step to achieve that.

name: Robert James Hull
description: From drawing dinosaurs every day as a child, to deciding to make a go at chasing my dream from my mum's dining room table in my mid twenties, I am now lucky enough to call this my job. All my products start off as a lovingly created original watercolour illustration and my first big breakthrough came with the addition of a pompom adorned party hat on to one of my cards. This idea went on to form the birthday card ranges for which I am most known. I hope you like them!

name: Robert's Dorset
description: Robert’s Dorset was born out of our modest kitchen back in 2011. After much labour and experimentation (and heated discussion), we took our products to markets in and around our beloved Dorset and were thrilled with the response. Everyone loved our snacks more than we could believe! From that moment on we’ve worked hard to maintain our most popular products and to develop delicious new flavours and ideas.

name: Robyn Macdonald Knits
description: Knitted products designed by Robyn Macdonald, inspired by a love of craft, materials and tradition. High quality knitted products are made by me my home and studio in Oxford, and in collaboration with a small knit design centre in Leicester with whom I work closely. The yarn I use is spun in Scotland and is RWS (Responsible Wool Standards) certified.

name: Rocketfullofpie
description: Step into a world where threads come alive, capturing the essence of your furry friends. Working from your cherished photographs, I’ll embroider a characterful and lifelike portrait of your beloved pet: whether a dog, or a cat, horse, or even an aardvark (yes, I have done an aardvark!) My work is a mixture of hand and machine embroidery, meticulously building up layers of fabrics, threads, and countless stitches, to create a vibrant portrait, and a unique piece of art.

name: ROOT2GINGER organic
description: Hi I'm Deanne, the founder of ROOT2GINGER. We make delicious ginger mixers which are influenced by our Caribbean heritage. We are a family business based in Manchester and we manufacture our drinks using premium organic ingredients including cold pressed Peruvian ginger raw cane sugar and lemons. Our drinks have won Great taste awards and World Alcohol free awards. Our drinks are concentrated, you simply dilute to taste or add to cocktails. If you want an authentic Fiery Ginger Kick ROOT2GINGER is made for you!

name: Ros Shiers
description: Welcome to Ros Shiers Illustration, my little world drawn in pencil... Hello, I'm Ros, I'm an illustrator. I work from my studio in Walthamstow, East London and design a range of art prints and dog portraits to hang on the walls of your home. Alongside the popular dog collection I love to draw anything and everything, whether it's ice creams, helium balloons, classic food packaging, hopefully there will be something for you to enjoy in my archive of illustrations.

name: Rosa Harradine
description: Hello, I’m Rosa and I’m a brush and broom maker. I aim to make pieces that are beautiful as well as useful and I love to experiment with bright colours and bold designs. I use natural, sustainable materials including arenga, tampico and broomcorn fibres, as well as hemp thread and wood grown in my own small woodland. My brushes and brooms are a joy to hold, to use and to admire, and I hope they bring pleasure to the daily routines within your home.

name: Rosanna Reade
description: Rosanna is a Northern Irish printmaker and illustrator, living in Edinburgh. Storytelling is at the heart of her work, which she likes to explore through the themes of nature, places and their inhabitants, with a lighthearted approach.

name: Rosco Brittin
description: I believe that if you think the skies are the limit you have a distinct lack of imagination. Welcome to my work, which was once described by The Guardian as "When special FX & paper first meet". I have a love affair with filmmaking, nature and comedy. I like to think I combine all three in whatever I create, whether it is original art, wallpaper or storytelling.

name: Rose Gardner Studio
description: My name is Rose and I make ceramics from my picturesque garden studio in the countryside. Inspired by the Mediterranean, ancient mythology and classical design, I create colourful, playful, joyful ceramics for la dolce vita at home!

name: Rosie And The Boys
description: Hand crafted papercuts and decorations for birthdays, celebrations, weddings, and parties, Rosie and the Boys products are made for those who love to celebrate and make people feel special. Inspired by Nature and the lovely people we share our lives with, we’ve created a whole host of papercut decorations, and gifts to help celebrate the special people in your life. Stylish, contemporary and often colourful, if you’re looking for something special, you’ve come to the right place.

name: Rosie Brain Embroidery
description: Rosie is an embroidery designer and textile artist based in Dalston, East London. Using a hand-guided embroidery machine known as an 'Irish', all her products are made in small batches using natural materials including silk and wool felt.

name: Rosie Gore
description: I am a ceramicist based in London. I have a background in interior styling and sourcing and I design and make all of my pieces in my London studio. I aim to make unique pieces which are full of colour, pattern and texture, which are designed to last a lifetime and help the home tell a story. My pieces are designed to be both works of art, and functional robust pieces for the home. Each piece is meticulously crafted by hand, creating organically shaped pieces which are then painted and glazed by hand, ensuring that no two pieces are alike. The speckled, earthy tones of the stoneware are designed to balance the brightly coloured glazed patterns. Shaping each piece by hand means they are all intentionally slightly different, and aims to emphasise my belief in creating unique, slow, sustainable pieces for the home. I draw inspiration from the living world around me, earthy colours inspired from nature which are complemented by traditional patterns such as check or gingham mixed with architectural shapes and often finished with a pop of bright colour. The beauty in hand crafted functional pieces really inspires me, beautifully crafted items from the past which have been used hundreds of times over the years each telling a story.

name: Rove Knitwear
description: We make functional knitwear for men and women that evokes a sense of adventure and connection to the natural world. With every stitch, we aim to inspire and empower our customers to explore their own unique journeys, embracing comfort, style, and the beauty of British craftsmanship. Sustainability and transparency are core values in our small business. Our wool is fully traceable and from non-mulesed sources.

name: Rowena Jeanes
description: I'm Rowena Jeanes, and I live in a village outside Winchester, Hampshire, with my husband, three sons, and our cavapoochon, Mabel. My fascination with fabric and sewing started way back in textiles class at school, where I crafted a faux fur cow print record bag with purple satin lining. I was hooked! Luckily, my fabric choices have come a long way since then, but my passion for sewing and home furnishings has only deepened.

name: Ruby & Bo
description: We design & create plantable paper goods and eco-friendly stationery. Working with a small team of artisan British papermakers, our brand champions the heritage craft of papermaking, a craft which is critically endangered in this country, whilst simultaneously seeking to reduce waste and to support our pollinators. We source our materials locally and sustainably, using post-consumer waste wherever possible, and are proud to be a carbon negative business.

name: Ruddock Jewellery
description: Ruddock pieces blend bold, distinctive style with timeless elegance. Each piece is crafted by hand using the time-honoured technique of lost wax casting. A method which involves hand-carving or sculpting each piece initially in wax form, which is then cast and replicated in metal and moulded, serving as a blueprint for further pieces. The technique ensures the intricate details of the original design are faithfully preserved.

name: Rude
description: RUDE was founded 25 years ago by Rupert & Abi Meats. As trained graphic designers they launched a t-shirt label which soon grew into a creative street brand. RUDE’s reputation soon earned them commissions as graphic artists, often commissioned for their colourful hand drawn typography.

name: Ruffles & Riot
description: Welcome to 'Ruffles & Riot' - where clay meets a riot of colour and creativity. I'm Sahiba, the hands and heart behind this pottery brand.

name: Rumble Cards
description: Rumble Cards is a vibrant and creative greeting card company founded by Jess in 2015. The brand focuses on producing bright and colourful paper goods, collaborating with talented artists worldwide to create unique and beautiful stationery products. Over the years, we have evolved, refining our distinctive style and establishing a niche in the market by partnering with global artists to bring fresh designs to our collection.

name: Rumsey's Handmade Chocolates
description: A proudly independent family business, we have been making exquisite handmade chocolate for nearly twenty years. With one High Street premises in Wendover and one in Thame, we’re proud to be flying the flag for independent business across the Chilterns. Handmade chocolate tells a rich story, from the provenance of its ingredients to the methods of its makers. In a world where so much seems to be made, bought and consumed in haste, our handmade chocolate simply refuses to be rushed. Crafted carefully, savoured slowly.

name: Runaround Retro
description: A Nostalgic Children's Accessories Brand brimming with vintage charm. Hats, Crowns, Hairbands, Hair Bows for Parties, Play and Adventures everyday. All items come beautifully wrapped so PERFECT for gifting. Our Accessories are made to be well worn, create memories in and be passed down the family. Shop our collection, gift our beautifully wrapped accessories & let the Magic of Childhood begin.

name: Rye Chocolates
description: We first started our little chocolate business in 2016 with a small broken chocolate machine (fondly known as Lilly) from the Welsh valleys. We got to work, curating the best recipes and designs for our chocolate bars, sourcing only the best chocolate from around the world. All we needed was huge enthusiasm, truck loads of creativity and most importantly, a focus to bring quality handmade chocolate to the market.

name: Sails & Canvas
description: Sails & Canvas - The Recycled Sail Company was established in 2015 to save old sails from landfill. From our sail loft studio on the Topsham Quay, we handcraft nautically inspired bags, accessories and lifestyle products - repurposing the sailcloth, adding colourful marine canvas and insignia for design and personalisation. Using marine quality thread, ropes, zips, grommets and fixings ensures our products are as beautiful, strong and durable as the sails they once were. Sailed - Saved - Sewn

name: Sally Guinness Ceramics
description: Handmade functional stoneware. Mostly wheel thrown, some hand built pieces too.

name: SALT & CLAY
description: Hi there! I'm Lisa, the creator of SALT & CLAY! I've always been surrounded by plants and flowers, spending my childhood mixing up "tinctures" and floral "perfumes" - so in many ways, what I do now is just the grown-up version of that early passion! For me, skincare should be simple, nourishing, and deeply connected to nature. That’s why I carefully source natural ingredients - ones that not only promote healthy skin but also bring us back to the beauty of pure, uncomplicated self-care. Your skin will thank you for it! Creating new products is where my heart truly lights up. I love experimenting, getting creative, and bringing new ideas to life. It’s such a joy to share them with you!

name: Salty's Studio
description: We like simple design, a bit witty and just off the mainstream - so when we began printing we found we could play around with visual ideas and then print straight away in our studio shop in Ashburton, Devon and try things out on our customers - we have playful graphics as wall art, homewares and gifts, and always trying new things. If you love a fresh upbeat look, we have responsibly sourced, well designed printed treats for you!

name: Samantha Barnes
description: Hello, I'm Sam. An artist for 30 years now. I enjoy a deep love of Drawing and Line, as well as believing wholly in the personal benefits that engaging in art brings to all of us. I have taught drawing for many years now. My recent project is called Artfully Minded, which delivers creative joy and gentle inspiration in an A4 Letterbox Parcels, direct from my studio to your tabletop. I live and work in Suffolk, UK. It's truly lovely to meet you Sam x

name: Sanders de Roeper
description: Playful designs that embrace individuality, feelings and expression

name: Sapling Spirits
description: We exist for three reasons... ...to help lead the way with sustainability in the drinks industry, tackle climate change, and make world class spirits. We focus on reforestation, waste reduction and eco packaging.

name: Sarah Cemmick Lino Cuts
description: Creator of original limited edition Linocuts and Art Cards. Designs are inspired by the fluffy, furry and feathered wildlife surrounding her Cumbrian home. With over twenty five years of experience, Sarah has a love for Lino and a passion for printmaking.

name: Sarah Frances
description: Sarah Frances combines her love for nature, travel and digital illustration to create vibrant and captivating artwork that brings the beauty of the outdoors into your home.

name: Sarah Guild Floral Design
description: Hello! I’m Sarah, Florist at Sarah Guild Floral Design. A friend once said 'you always look happy with flowers in your hands' and it’s a mission of mine to share that feeling of joy by creating thoughtful handmade floral products. My floristry is inspired by the seasons as they go by, and a deep-rooted passion to celebrate the magic of nature. Everything I make is created using sustainable mechanics, wherever possible I like my work to look and feel like it’s still growing too.

name: Sarah Le Breton Willow
description: Unique, beautiful, practical and innovative baskets. An exclusive collection of willow baskets handcrafted for you in my Devon workshop. Inspired by heritage baskets and celebrating the craft form that I love, I've taken time to design, develop and hand weave each basket. In so doing, I've created for you original pieces that showcase traditional basketry techniques, which highlight the beauty of natural materials and that are perfect for our modern lifestyle. Made using locally sourced Somerset willow, all of the collection embraces sustainability.

name: Sarah Rickard Art
description: Hello, I’m an artist and ceramicist creating unique, handmade pieces from my garden studio in rural East Sussex. My workshop is my sanctuary, where I come to be creative and escape the distractions of family life. I do allow the odd cat and my studio schnauzer Gertie in, but only if they promise not to break anything!

name: Sassigraphy
description: I'm Sarah, the 'Sass' behind Sassigraphy. I developed the calligraphy bug a few years ago after receiving the most beautiful handwritten wedding envelope in the post and deciding there and then I was going to learn how to create lettering like that myself! My passion for traditional Liberty fabrics and artisanal marbled papers inspired me to create handcrafted products incorporating hand lettered calligraphy; resulting in a truly one-of-a kind, personalised gift.

name: Savana Lawler Textiles
description: Hello! I'm Savana and I live in Torbay with my husband, Ryan, and my tiny person, Ted. I specialise in hand sewn (no sewing machine to be seen round here!) gifts and décor and every order is designed and sewn by me!

name: Say In Silver
description: Hi! I am Rachel and I live in North Shropshire with my husband, two not-so-little people and one big dog. I specialise in hand stamping personalised messages onto vintage silver plated cutlery, creating unique pieces to be treasured as keepsakes and mementos. I am professional and proud of my work and treat every customer with the utmost care and respect.

name: Scarlet Impressions
description: I founded Scarlet Impressions from a deep love of glass and a belief that everyday choices can be both beautiful and sustainable. With over a decade of experience, I now create vibrant, handcrafted glass straws that turn a simple sip into a joyful, mindful moment. Designed to be reused, treasured, and noticed, these little tools of change help bring colour and consciousness to daily life.

name: Scout & Sage Gin
description: Welcome to Scout and Sage Micro Distillery, nestled in the heart of the South West. Born from a deep desire to explore and collaborate in the distilling space, foraging plays a large part of our limited editions along with seasonal garden herbs and aromatics. At Scout and Sage, we craft each batch of gin in our 150l copper pot still and each bottle bares the signature of our head distiller ~ Holly. Our range features the Scout & Sage London Dry Gin, our award winning take on the timeless classic, made with Seville orange, pink peppercorn and other delicious aromatics. For those seeking a taste adventure try our limited edition offering of "Mother’s Ruin" infused with pomelo, grapefruit, rosemary flower and grains of paradise peppercorns. Finally we have our vibrant pink gin made with Raspberry and Hibiscus.

name: Sea Bramble Ceramics
description: Lesley is a British artisan, maker of gorgeous handmade, coastal inspired ceramic gifts and homewares. Each piece is mindfully made to be affordable for all, ranging from decorative items to functional homewares to brighten up your home. Lesley's colours are inspired by a dreamy beach seaside setting, think sherbet sunsets, ocean waves, and cotton candy skies. Her products are handcrafted with love and care, using high-quality materials and techniques. Whether you are looking for a gift for someone special, or a treat for yourself, you will find something to suit your taste and budget at Sea Bramble Ceramics.

name: See + QUIN
description: Hello, I’m Kate the owner of See+QUIN - an embellishment studio located in beautiful Bath, UK. At See+QUIN, it’s all about turning the ordinary into the extraordinary; giving home decor that unique, playful twist with my trusty hand-operated chainstitch Singer sewing machine.

name: Seldom Found
description: Seldom Found was created to make a slow-design, slow-made range for Dogs & their owners, with an ethos on handcrafting. I focus on the importance of sustainability, high quality materials sourced in the UK and Europe, using age-old artisan techniques with a modern approach to design. Each item is made to last by myself with attention to detail from hand-cutting the leather to finishing with saddle-stitch by hand to bring the best quality outcome for your product.

name: SevenSeventeen
description: We create mood-boosting, vegan-friendly candles (and other glorious home, bath & body products) that smell divine and donate 10% of profits to mental health charities...£63k & counting!

name: Shell on Earth
description: Hi, I'm Caryl, co-founder of Shell on Earth. I launched this company along with my husband, Jordan, in 2019. Our desire was to recycle the shells generated at our family's seafood processing business, rather than sending them to landfill. We’ve been processing shellfish here on the West coast of Wales for over 40 years. We currently specialise in processing whelks. The whelks are caught locally in traditional pots, a low impact method of fishing which means minimal damage to the sea floor and marine habitats. We’re passionately committed to sustainability and are always looking for new ways to do better. It's estimated that 5,000 tonnes of waste shells are generated in the UK fishing industry every year. We’re proud to not only reduce our waste output from the factory, but also to help support a circular economy by utilising 100% of the whelks we process.

name: Shibui Tea
description: We are a family run tea company based in Edinburgh. We believe tea should be affordable and accessible to everyone. We keep it simple and there is no judgement on how you take your tea. It is your cuppa! We stock many different blends and there is one constant - excellent quality. We pack loads of flavour in and consistently win Great Taste Awards. Shibui is a Japanese word and is a way of describing something which appears simple but has a complex nature. We think that this sums up tea. Tea is just your regular cuppa to most people but look into it and there is so much more to experience. We are excited to offer you lots of blends that you won’t have tried anywhere else before and perhaps you will find a new favourite.

name: Shiny Happy Pottery
description: My small business is all about bringing people joy through the everyday use of handmade pottery. I love creating pieces that are colourful, funky and whimsical- made to put a smile on your face when you use them. Every single item is totally unique, you're truly getting a functional piece of art!

name: Show Pony
description: Show Pony is the pseudonym of artist and sign-maker Meg Tait. A life-long fascination with words, fonts and fairgrounds is the inspiration for her hand-painted signs & illuminated artworks, which are often fitted with light bulbs and embellished with gold.
