Alongside these are typographic prints, and wooden cut-outs featuring icons of popular-culture.

name: Silo Studio
description: Hannah’s inspiration largely derives from the tropics; namely the African landscape, both natural and architectural as well as from the craft originating there, particularly the textiles. Hannah likes to make up ‘dreamworlds’ within her designs, creating exaggerated versions of natural elements, particularly the plants and flowers within our landscape, and using pattern as a constant reference. With a strong interest in hand made craft everything has either been created in house by Hannah, or designed and made by specialist artisans. We are proud to work with small, family run makers and artisans from around the world to support both them and their craft, always prioritising quality.

name: Silverstick
description: Adventure is in our nature. We hear it calling in every roaring wave, whispering forest, shimmering river and brooding mountain. And the call is always the same: Life feels better out here. That’s the founding spirit of Silverstick. We’re outdoor people making sustainable clothes purpose-built for the natural habitats we love to play in. Nestled in the South Downs national park, we created our first organic cotton clothing collection in 2010 and we’ve stuck to our sustainable philosophy ever since. Our clothes are designed to feel comfortable and look great wherever you are. They’re rugged enough to thrive in the wild (and believe us, we put every garment through its paces). And they’re produced in tune with nature to help support and protect our beloved outdoor playgrounds. Watching over it all is a magical bird who inspires all our clothing. The Silverstick represents the roving spirit of adventure, urging us to spread our wings.

name: Simply Delicious Cake Co
description: Home for The Simply Delicious Cake Co is amongst the gentle rolling hills of South Shropshire, just a few miles from Ludlow. The cakes started as an offshoot of Milly’s catering business, baked in the farmhouse kitchen and sold at various food festivals. By 2002 the cakes were in full swing and sales began to grow. Before long we had grown out of our home kitchen and started converting redundant outbuildings and stables outside our back door, where the bakery still remains today. All the cakes are handmade to our own traditional recipes, then baked in small batches, so that production can be personally supervised by Milly. Where possible, we source ingredients locally – free range eggs from the farm over the hill behind us and English butter. Presentation is a big thing for us too. Our cake packaging is contemporary in design and we strive for the highest standard, whether the cake is eaten at home, or given away as a present. All our mail order cakes are sent out in the post in a gorgeous gift box, with our eye catching branding. And very importantly all our packaging is recyclable.

name: Single Variety Co
description: At Single Variety Co we lovingly hand-make seriously delicious fruit preserves and chilli jams. We carefully select the tastiest variety for each of our products and pack each jar full of the good stuff, using less sugar. We've won an award for every core product we make and genuinely believe our products are as high quality as jam can possibly get. We prep, cook, jar, label and lid everything ourselves from our little jam factory in Bristol with our fab team of 9.

name: Sister Paper Co.
description: At Sister Paper Co. we create empowering and dreamy illustrated cards and luxury gift wrap. Our greeting cards are for diverse, relatable and modern card sending occasions - in our collections you'll find gender neutral greeting cards to celebrate the birth or adoption of new babies, rainbow love hearts to celebrate all the wonderful kinds of love, alongside plenty of beautiful bodies and a touch of wondrous magic.

name: skeletondraw
description: Hi and welcome to skeletondraw - the home of silly cards and thoughtful gifts! I’m Laura, a freelance illustrator who loves creating digital designs for greetings cards, prints and custom commissions. I stumbled into being a freelance illustrator during lockdown and haven’t looked back since! You’ll usually find me curled up somewhere, sketching away on my iPad and slurping a fizzy drink. My work is full of colour, cats and chips.

name: Sloane Stationery
description: Launched in 2014, Sloane Stationery was brought to life with a view on bringing the traditional craft of bookbinding into the 21st century. We’re on a mission to help you get excited about sitting down at your desk. And in this age of the ever evolving workspace, that may mean an office, kitchen table or park bench. We are champions of pen-to-paper creativity and hope that our books will inspire you to savour words and revisit big ideas. Think Big, Make a Plan, Write it Down

name: Sock Sisters
description: A new sock brand offering colourful, gender-neutral designs that prioritise comfort and individuality. With a shared passion for creativity and inclusivity, we aim to redefine everyday essentials with bold, versatile socks.

name: Sofishop Wicker Prams
description: Handmade wicker beauties.

name: Somerset Charcuterie
description: We're Somerset Charcuterie. Our journey started 15 years ago as a hobby and we have been lucky enough to call it our life's work. Driven by a deep commitment to our craft, we produce award-winning charcuterie that showcases bold, refined flavours—expertly crafted through traditional methods and inspired by the rich culinary heritage of the West Country.

name: Something From The Turnery
description: Hi! I'm Joel, I've fallen in love with the steady , satisfying pace of hand-crafting beautiful timbers into pieces for your home. Each item will hold it's own unique grain, formed slowly over years and it's my mission to create solely (and soulfully) from sustainable, reclaimed and repurposed timbers.

name: Sonshine Magazine
description: Sonshine is a quarterly magazine taking a positive slant on parenting sons, to create a better world for all our children. Each beautiful issue follows a different theme and is packed with non-judgemental positive advice & articles, recipes, simple crafts, book reviews and a healthy dose of down to earth humour. It's all printed and bound using FSC approved papers right here in the UK.

name: Soodle Street Studio
description: Soodle Definition: To walk in a slow or leisurely manner. Inspired by a love of architecture, history, renovation and colour, Soodle Street Studio offers a growing collection of paper products including digital prints, greeting cards, postcards and bespoke original artwork. Each illustration is hand-collaged from unwanted paper such as old magazines, junk mail and advertising; celebrating the simple joy of re-using waste material to create something new, worthwhile and desirable.

name: Sophie Kinns' Studio
description: Hello! I am Sophie from Sophie Kinns' Studio. I run my business from my studio in Market Harborough. My collection has just 10 sustainably sourced, 100% recyclable cards designed to be versatile for many occasions. All of my cards have a little special detail, they’re either hot foiled, die cut or are sprinkled with neon. They could even be considered a present in themselves. Sending a card creates a simple moment of joy connecting people in an other wise fast pace world.

name: Sourdough Fever
description: We believe baking should be joyful, creative, and just a little bit magical. When we started Sourdough Fever, it was all about sharing the fun and beauty we found in baking—especially those little details that make each loaf feel special. The products we create are things we genuinely love and use ourselves. We choose materials carefully, think through every design, and even enjoy getting the packaging just right—because those things matter to us, and we think they matter to you too.

name: South London Letterpress
description: Old fashioned printing in a modern era. Letterpress is all about impression and texture. Karen creates hand printed stationery that feels personal and looks magical.

name: Speckled Grey
description: My name is Elle and I run Speckled Grey. I love to make satisfyingly tactile wares to celebrate everyday life. My work is all about bright, matte colours and soft, hand-carved textures. I work by slip-casting with silky Parian porcelain and polishing up each piece to be huggable in your hands. This creates a soothing but vibrant aesthetic to cheer your senses and help create a home you adore. After my degree, I spent ten years as a delftware painter whilst honing my skills as a maker. I'm continuously learning about this brilliant material and tweaking and refining my practice all the time. I’ve been lucky enough to see my work visit some wonderful places and I hope you find something to treasure here!

name: SPILL Tea
description: Tea is too cheap. We’ve been drinking tea for 300 years. A kilo of tea cost around £1,000 back then, now you can get a kilo for £2. Mad. Hard work goes into growing, picking, processing, packing, branding and selling tea. But the rewards for doing each job are not equal. Most of the money is made in the UK. Too little is made where the tea is grown. Traditionally, tea brands buy teas from different countries and blend them all together. You can't buy tea from a smallholder farmer directly. It has to be processed by the factory before it can be bought. And tea can be bought in a mixture of ways... Some direct from the factory, some via auction, some via brokers or traders. Sometimes, a mixture. This makes things murky. And makes it difficult to know what the smallholder farmer who grew the tea has been paid. That can't be right. So we thought "let's start again". Find a great tasting tea that hits the spot. Buy the tea direct. Talk to farmers, understand what they need. Pay the farmers more. Be open about payments to farmers. For you, a better cuppa. For the farmer, a better price.

name: Stamped By Cheryl
description: Hi, I’m Cheryl, the owner, designer and maker of Stamped by Cheryl from the small village of Woodhall Spa. Everything in my store is individually hand stamped by me so each item is truly unique. Thank you for visiting!

name: Stitch Happy Studio
description: Hi I’m Louisa, founder of Stitch Happy, Here I am happily stitching away in my Warwickshire studio. Stitch Happy was founded on the strong belief that anybody can benefit from having some creativity in their lives. Giving you time to relax and do something for yourself in our hectic world is at the heart of what Stitch Happy is about. I believe strongly in the good that comes from creativity. I’ve always loved making and love to see others discovering the joy of making too!

name: Stitched By Alan
description: Hello! Im Alan and I'm a freehand embroiderer with a passion for animals. I mainly create embroidered portraits of pets, these are perfect keepsakes or presents for loved ones. I have been sewing pet portraits since 2016 and each day I love it more and more. I enjoy capturing emotions and character by stitch, something I hope to be doing for a long time!

name: Stocky and Dee
description: Every dog is unique, and we create the products they deserve. Built entirely from start to finish by our team in Edinburgh we use Merino Lambswool & Cotton blend yarns to create our eye catching fabrics and each piece is lined with a luxurious velvet resulting in dog products that are not only strong and functional, but stylish too. Creating items to order not only allows us to limit waste and harness our designers skills, but also the ability to offer customers bespoke options. Whether it's a tweak to a collar or size we can ensure the product is perfect for your beloved pup.

name: Stoff Studios
description: Stoff Studios was founded in 2015 by Carys Briggs, a textile designer who trained at both the Royal College of Art and Central St Martins. We produce all our pieces in our river-side studio in Woolwich. It’s a part of London that has a wealth of resources and a great community of makers.

name: Stokey Textiles
description: A kitchen table (in Stoke Newington) brainstorming session gave birth to Stokey Textiles in the summer in 2015. The colourful fruits of this venture included beautiful, hand-printed aprons, tea towels and other fab homeware. Stokey Textiles merchandise currently sells in shops internationally, and designer fairs as well as through art and crafty word of mouth and boasts a growing roster of notable fans…

name: Stormy Knight
description: We. Love. cards. We believe they have the power to make people feel good – whether that’s by sending some birthday wishes, welcoming a new baby to the world or by giving someone a hug when they need it the most, so we’ve made it our mission to make the world a brighter place with each and every card we design.

name: Stuart Forrester
description: I like to mix the iconic with the ironic. Recently returning to my first love of image making my screen print work focuses on combining classical and modern imagery to create new narratives, showing how time marches forever forward but human desires and fears ultimately remain the same.

name: Studio 55 Letterpress
description: I am a Cotswolds based creative letterpress studio, creating vibrant letterpress cards, prints and stationery the good old fashioned way! The look and feel of letterpress is unmistakable – when combined with the right paper, the inked surface becomes slightly debossed adding another dimension. All my prints are pressed on my beautifully renovated ‘Mary’; an Arab Treadle Press 10 x 15, built in 1915. I also design and sell poster prints, as I am a graphic designer by trade. Some of my letterpress designs are also available as giclée poster prints.

name: Studio ERS
description: Studio ERS is a small one-woman ceramics business run by Emily Rose Sinclair. I design and make everything from start to finish in my studio in South East London and focus on creating pieces I would like in my own home. You'll find lots of vases and tableware, based on my love of food and fresh flowers, and many pieces have a hand-painted element to them, making each piece entirely unique.

name: Studio Ginkgo
description: Hi, I am Lilia Wells. Studio Gingko is a luxury brand that embraces fragility. We create soulful fine jewellery, inspired by the raw beauty of natural forms. Our hand-made pieces are deliberately imperfect; unique in their flaws and resiliently beautiful, just like every one of us.

name: Studio Koter
description: Koter is a London-based brand emerging from a shared vision of a modern, modular wardrobe for children that is produced in a considered and responsible way. Our design is contemporary and always with an innovative edge; we use tactile fabrication and unexpected colour combinations and our silhouettes are carefully developed to be both functional and unisex. Collections are limited and made in artisanal factories ensuring transparency, minimal waste, and the very best quality.

name: Studio Sewn
description: Discover a paradise of embroidered gifts perfect to be given for any occasion. With a passion for preserving & treasuring, Studio Sewn creates modern yet timeless keepsakes for you and your loved ones.

name: Studio Wald
description: We are Jakob & Freya, a husband and wife team who met while studying a degree in 3D design. We are the proud parents of 3 little humans and we have a studio/workshop in our home city of Leeds. Our collection of Flower Press, Paper Goods, Homewares and Prints are made in England with care & attention to ideas, pattern & process.

name: Studio Zef
description: Beautifully artistic, characterful and contemporary hand printed lampshades. With a love of craft, we hand print our lampshades with carefully designed, confident patterns in thoughtful and stylish colours. Each design is hand drawn and carved to create lino blocks, then printed onto cotton shades in our Cotswold's studio. Our aim is to create harmonious, striking designs that complement and elevate the style of any interior.

name: studioEVIG
description: Two women on a mission to bring natural colour and joy into peoples lives! That’s us! Harvesting natural dyes grown on our flower farm, we celebrate the vibrant colours of nature by creating products that bring joy to everyday life in your home. From bright and bold table linens to silk ribbons, our range is ever expanding! We use a variety of techniques in our work including immersion dyeing, eco-printing and shibori resist to create different textures, colours and patterns. Our aim is to make designs that are always: Joyful, colourful and sustainable.

name: Su Owen
description: A sense of fun is at the heart of my characters and designs. I like to make things that hopefully bring a little joy and make people smile. It's also important to me that the materials I use for my products are as sustainable as possible, can be recycled or are made from recycled waste. I'm now proud to have built a collection of brooches that are made from sustainable walnut and neckerchiefs that are made using Regenesis satin, a fabric created by recycling plastics that were previously used as packaging materials.

name: Sukie
description: Hi, we’re Darrell and Julia Gibbs, welcome to our world of paper goods and printed happiness! Our nostalgic notebooks & accessories take inspiration from travels, nature and our collections of vintage objects and ephemera, using a mix of traditional printing techniques to bring our designs to life. We recycle and repurpose items such as old papers, maps and bus destination blinds, to give them a new lease of life as something useful that we hope will bring you joy!

name: Supplies For Life
description: We are Supplies For Life, a family run creative team based in the North of England. Our work and processes reflect the joy of simple living, finding inspiration in the beauty of nature and the tranquillity of rural life. We create heirloom-quality pieces that marry utility with beauty, from home-ware to thoughtful gifts for your loved ones. Each item in our range has been meticulously designed and lovingly crafted using mainly British native hardwoods and natural textiles like linen and cotton. We believe in creating products that not only enhance your daily life but also become treasured family pieces, passed down through generations.

name: Surprise Radish
description: Hi, I’m Ayesha! I live in Bristol UK with my husband Sam and our little girl. I created Surprise Radish to modernise the art we share with our kids. Our pieces are designed with the whole family in mind, we think they look great in every room of the house!

name: Survival Techniques
description: Hello, I’m Naomi and I create art that aims to promote hope and optimism and bring a little light to someone having a dark day. I collect people’s coping strategies and then craft the heart of their messages into typographic artworks that offer a kindness and an opening of possibility. Across street art, painting, print and textiles, Survival Techniques celebrates our shared experiences, our strengths and the current of hope within that keeps us moving forwards.

name: Suzanne Oddy Design
description: Based in Haworth, West Yorkshire, next to a historic steam railway, we specialise in creating beautifully printed and laser-cut products. Each piece is crafted with care, designed to be cherished by your family for years to come.

name: Suzy Dreams
description: Welcome to our online store, where your style meets your imagination! Our philosophy is simple - we want you to express yourself in the most authentic and creative way possible! We offer a wide range of caps, berets and beanies, and most can be fully customised to meet your unique taste and preferences, whether that's an embroidered name, or a font style/thread colour of your preference. Some of our listings have set designs, but we always try to offer an option to make it bespoke, usually by adding a name or initials at the back.

name: Sweet Marie Jewellery
description: A boutique collection of diamond and precious stone set vermeil jewellery, Sweet Marie believe in considered purchases of proper jewellery pieces that add fun, cool and serious style to your jewellery box.

name: Sylvie Signs
description: Hi, I'm Esther and I love to paint. Using traditional signwriting and gilding techniques, I create modern heirlooms to cherish for generations. My house signs, wedding signs and wall art explore light and texture through bold typographic designs and the warm glow of gold leaf. Quality and heritage are at the centre of everything I produce: it’s my mission to paint lines so clean and beautiful they soothe your soul. Let me paint you something truly unique.

name: Sytch Farm Studios
description: Welcome to Sytch Farm Studios, based at our home in Shropshire. Here we hand craft a range of products suitable for restaurant use and home dining.

name: Tales of Me Books
description: Tales of Me books have been created to help children and parents turn the big adventures in life into personalised tales. Through the power of personalisation, our Tales place your child at the centre of their book making the story easy to relate to and easier to learn from as they instantly see how the changes will affect their world. Tales of Me books have been thoughtfully designed to engage all types of learning & communication styles so that all children will enjoy them. Actively taking photographs and sticking them in, filling in the blank spaces with writing or colouring, naturally inspires conversation through both the content of the books and the unique and beautiful designs and illustrations. The books are eye-catching as well as durable so that once completed they can be read as often as children choose to read them, and become a treasured memory of an important milestone to keep forever. All of our products have been designed to help support children's emotional wellbeing through supporting their independence and each individual chid's needs.

name: Talou
description: Talou is a kids knitwear brand, founded in 2023. We embrace the freedom to be loud. Our Cut and Stick motif represents bold, hand cut shapes, celebrating the creativity of every child. Each item is carefully crafted in limited runs, from deadstock yarns, in our small partner studio in London. All products are made to be recycled, and you can sell them back to us or trade in for a bigger size as your child grows. We're sure you'll find your little explorer's favourite colour in our ever evolving collection of unique, small batch knitwear.

name: Tara Jane Ceramics
description: Tara Davidson is a potter and sculptor, based in the Cotswolds. She creates sculptures for the home and garden using stoneware and crank clay. "I love that people feel drawn to reach out and touch my work, and that it brings joy to so many—especially the wildlife for whom my garden ceramics are ultimately made."

name: Tatty Devine
description: Tatty Devine is the go-to brand for original, fun, acrylic statement jewellery, founded in the heart of east London in 1999 by Harriet Vine MBE and Rosie Wolfenden MBE. From personalised Name Necklaces - made to order since 2003 to pop-culture collaborations and limited edition seasonal designs, all Tatty Devine jewellery is designed, laser cut, and handmade in-house by a small, skilled team of makers.

name: Tatty to Natty Furniture
description: Hello, I’m Vikki, an upcycling artist from beautiful Dorset. I create statement décor from things that probably would have ended up in landfill. I combine imagery (the quirkier the better) with wording (sometimes sweary, always empowering) and bright paint colours and bring all of these components together in textured layers. I aim to create the feel of a genuinely aged, bohemian piece that not only recycles but will make you smile every time you look at it.

name: Teppi
description: Hello there and welcome to Teppi! Founded by two friends Ella + Lydia, Teppi is a slow living lifestyle brand, inspired by the simple, slow living aesthetic of Scandinavian culture. With concepts such as hygge and fika, the Scandinavian culture simply illustrates an alternative remedy to the stresses and strains of daily life. It was from these ideals of comfort, simplicity, belonging and the feeling of home, that Teppi was born. Our cosy Scandi brand is best known for our range of handmade ceramics, designed to bring timeless character and one of a kind charm to your home for many years to come.

name: Text From A Friend
description: Text From A Friend is an award winning luxury cards and stationery brand. Our designs are inspired by texts, written by hand, then hand foiled and hand finished using sustainable materials. Some have anti-social messages. Some don't. Take your pick.

name: Text from a Kid
description: Meet the new kid on the block. This cute sidekick brand created by Text From A Friend, and a little person, has finally launched. We're kicking off with greetings cards and notecards but watch this space for more :)

name: The Black Rabbit
description: Hello, I’m Lindsay the founder and designer at The Black Rabbit. My charming, colourful greeting cards all have a little badge as part of the design, an extra present for the recipient to keep and enjoy. The range includes nature inspired paper animal decoration kits which are designed with both kids and adults’ in mind, they’re decorated with my original patterns that will look beautiful in your home. I’m pleased to say you’ll also find some of my original artworks in my store, collages created by hand with watercolour inks and scissors.

name: The Brighton Beard Company
description: Hello, we're Lloyd and Jessica! We founded The Brighton Beard Co. in 2013 as we wanted to create a distinctive beard-care range that championed both style and nourishment for the urban beardsman. Lloyd had grown a beard and realised he needed to find some kind of beast control, before his boss’ “shave it” taunts got the better of him. However, there were no products on the market that really grabbed his attention. So we put our time into something both creative and productive and together, we created The Brighton Beard Co.; and the rest as they say, is history. And Lloyd’s beard lived happily ever after.

name: The Brilliant Sign Company
description: The Brilliant sign co. is a husband and wife team. Over the last 30 years we have created many different signs, shopfronts and interiors, working all over the country, but our passion always comes back to our love for victoriana and glasswork. Heavily influenced by our surroundings of leafy Burnham Beeches and a love for gypsy caravans our work has become quite distinctive, so we are delighted with our 'Brilliant Letter', bringing Brilliant signs into your home....

name: The Charpoy
description: The Charpoy is a small Independent business founded by Preneet Bart. The brand is inspired by the richness of the Indian heritage and textiles. It is the amalgamation of unique contemporary designs and homewares. Preneet breathes new life to the age – old tradition of block printing, designing new prints that have a simple and classic appeal.

name: The Chocolate Detective
description: I’ve been obsessed by chocolate since I was child and always loved creating beautiful things. A degree in textile design and a student job selling chocolate in Harrods led to completing a small business course and founding Rococo Chocolates in 1983. After exiting the business in 2019 I set up the Chocolate Detective, and during the pandemic I worked alone out of a small kitchen in at the London Sketch Club in Chelsea perfecting my recipes and designing my no plastic eco packaging. I also supported the Grenada Chocolate Company fundraising to help them through this difficult time. I have invested in an organic cocoa farm in Grenada and the harvest is available to the chocolate company who make some of the best chocolate I have ever tasting in the perfect circular economy that also respects the environment. I am the only person to have been honoured for “Services to chocolate making” (with an OBE from the late Queen Elizabeth in 2014).

name: The Coast Creative
description: We believe artistic self-expression is fundamental to our happiness. By effectively communicating our tastes, values and beliefs to the world around us we can find and connect with those who share our worldview. Your home should be a synergy of design, craftsmanship and self-expression. It should facilitate the way you aspire to live and enable you to enjoy that life with your kindred spirits.

name: The Den Kit Company
description: We are The Den Kit Co. Founded by two dedicated mothers and teachers, we're committed to inspiring children to step away from screens and embrace the great outdoors. Our passion lies in creating engaging and imaginative outdoor play experiences that promote creativity, exploration, and a love for nature. With our thoughtfully designed kits, we empower children to have their own adventures. No single-use-plastic, no batteries, no complicated instructions. The Den Kit Co. - Your Passport To The Outdoors.

name: The Distinguished Dog Company
description: Established in 2015, The Distinguished Dog Company is a fabulous, quintessentially British brand. Based in a wonderfully converted barn in Devon, we design and make products for the most discerning dogs that want to look and feel the bees-knees. The inspiration behind the brand is the rather eccentric Lhasa Apso named Nusandilly Rocket Man, or Mr Gatsby to his friends.

name: The DO Book Co
description: Do Books are concise guides designed to help creative entrepreneurs, makers and Doers work smarter and create positive change. Written by experts whose stories and ideas have inspired others to go and Do, our collection of nearly 40 titles spans design, business, wellbeing and sustainable living with each book focusing on the ‘doing’ rather than the background theory. Concise, practical guides that make it easier to Do stuff. The Do Book Co. is an independent publishing company launched in 2013.

name: The Edible Museum
description: Hi, I am Sarah Hardy, your friendly, eccentric, chocolate artist. Come into the museum and find animals, anatomy and ancient artefacts all magically transformed into delicious, high quality, chocolate art. Everything is hand made by artists ready for you to gift to someone special. It is important to me that each piece is unique to us, so I sculpt and make the moulds too. Only then can we get to the delicious business of hand pouring and painting your extraordinary gifts.

name: The Faraway Gang
description: My name is Sally, I am the Designer and Founder of The Faraway Gang. We have a slow fashion ethos, creating unisex children’s knitwear that can be worn, loved, and passed on. This brand speaks to that inner child within us all, conjuring childhood memories building dens with muddy knees, and playing make-believe with our siblings and friends. Colourful nostalgic knits made with great quality materials ensure each piece is ready for their everyday adventures!

name: The Florist’s Daughter
description: Deeply rooted in nature and plant life, The Florist’s Daughter is inspired by the idea of merging a hand-crafted lifestyle store with a small batch garden flower shop. At the heart of all of our creativity is seasonal simplicity and bringing the natural world into everyday life, be it in your own home or through gifting to others. Using our floral knowledge passed down a generation, we create considered; nature inspired crafting kits, botanical led gifts and sustainable florist goods.

name: The Garage Press
description: My name is Simon Trewin, Founder and Chief Inkoholic. My prints, books and cards always start out with me scratching my head and thinking, “I wonder what would happen if I...." and then I am away! Experimentation is at the heart of my practice - I love playing around with inks, vintage papers, wooden illustration blocks and historic metal type to a clanking soundtrack of my wonderful family of hand+foot operated presses. I also love classic typefaces, bold colours and an ever-present sense of how good prints can make a real instant impact. As you will see - I can rarely resist sprinkling a sense of humour in to the mix too! Running through everything I do is my passion to help keep heritage crafts alive and to enjoy that sense of a historical connection to the printers, presses and ephemera that have come before me. I also truly believe in the benefits of slowing down, switching off and zoning into the deep focus that this process of discovery inspires in me. In a world where everything is too fast, I enjoy nothing more than closing my studio door and diving into the rich and ever-rewarding world of letterpress printmaking.

name: The Greedy Gardener
description: Welcome to the wonderful world of The Greedy Gardener. A range of deliciously different growing gifts exclusive to Holly & Co, from the team behind The Gluttonous Gardener, one of the UK’s most-loved gift companies. Each gift is hand wrapped by our small team in South London and delivered by courier.

name: The Grey Earl
description: Hello there, I'm The Grey Earl (my mum still calls me Jon), an illustrator making work from my studio, in the misty hills of Scotland... how mysterious. I make funny cards for your favourite people, all with a distinct sense of humour and a healthy dollop of nostalgia. My work tends to appeal to that ever so hard to shop for demographic, men. When I'm not drawing pictures or thinking up jolly japes for cards, I can be found chasing after my two daughters, bouncing on our trampoline or eating ice lollies, often all at the same time.

name: The HappySelf Journal
description: Hello, I'm Francesca and here I am with my children who I made our daily journals for in the first place! Gratitude journaling helped me immensely and I wish I had discovered it when I was younger. I'm passionate about giving children the tools they need to support their own happiness and wellbeing. Our beautiful journals which are designed for all ages, are easy to use and encourage gratitude, kindness and emotional wellbeing. Made with love from my family to yours.

name: The Hepple Spirits Company
description: We founded Hepple Spirits Company in 2014. Passionate about our home and its untamed wonder, obsessed with flavour and extracting it as precisely as possible, and dedicated to the cocktail community, whether that’s at home or in the top bars around the world, we’re excited to share with you a taste of the wild moors of Northumberland.

name: The Honey Project
description: This is next generation honey... We’re starting small. Very small. Making honey that’s a force for good – sweet stuff that’ll help re-flower the world around us, jar by delicious jar. The Honey Project is a true modern love story. It began during our own summer of love, 2019. We fell in love with local British honey and we hope you do too. Love Laura & Ed x

name: The Indian Block Print Co
description: Hi, I am Maggie the founder of The Indian Block Print Co. I recognised the capacity of block printing to allow anyone to create something beautiful regardless of background, and in doing so build confidence and wellbeing. We work directly with a team of craftsmen in India. The team have been regularly invited to family weddings, receive updates from their families and give back to the industry by supporting the development of a new block carving workshop in rural India.

name: The Industrious Maker
description: Hello! I’m Gill, and I create craft storage and accessories for 'The Industrious Maker'. I am inspired by vintage packaging and sewing ephemera and I love to utilise and re-purpose materials in playful and unusual ways. I make a range of items such as embroidery hooped pin cushions, sewing pouches, needle books and pattern weights. My focus is on creating functional storage and display solutions which are a pleasure to own and a unique and thoughtful gift for the creative and busy maker.

name: The Ink Pot
description: Our notebooks are hand-stamped to order in our Oxfordshire workshop. We offer a wide range which can be customised with your choice of image, foil colour and, if you wish, personalisation (initials, names, dates or words). All of our journals have beautiful linen or card covers, have ultra-thick paper inside and they lie flat. They are perfect for stationery lovers because the paper can handle paints, brush pens and fountain pens without the ink bleeding or ghosting through the paper. Our journals come with dot-grid or lined paper. Not only do we have a wide range of white paper options, we have journals with only black paper or a mix of black, brown and kraft paper. #MAKEITYOURS

name: The Inkist
description: Hey, I’m Mathilda, founder of the illustration studio The Inkist. In a previous life, before having children, I was a multi-award-winning graphic designer, traveling the world. I quite accidentally returned to illustration as an outlet after undergoing surgery. The Inkist combines unique illustrations with a luxurious finish. We use Mohawk Eggshell 324gsm paper, known for its elegant texture and strength, for all our cards, and our eco-friendly master printers use modern Indigo digital printing technology to reproduce my illustrations in all their vibrancy.

name: The Jacksons
description: Best known for the playful word handmade jute bags alongside homewares and embroidery, The Jacksons’ mission is to put smiles on faces. Our bags have introduced us to many new friends on tubes, beaches and planes – you never know where they are going to turn up and the conversations they will start. Through our work with artisans in over 60 villages in Southern Bangladesh, we know that employment leads to independence, empowerment and status. This is why, for more than twelve years now, Louise and her team have been working relentlessly, designing products with a continual focus on the partnerships with our artisans and the environment. All our jute bags and mats are made entirely from locally grown jute and are virtually carbon free. Indeed jute is one of those rare plants that can claim to have cleaned the air rather than polluted it! We always have our friends and the planet at heart and we are striving to prove that mindful fashion is possible.

name: The Kebab Club
description: The Kebab Club is on a mission is to bring authentic Turkish flavours to homes nationwide, making it easy to create delicious, nutritious kebabs in your kitchen. Founded by a husband and wife team who have a shared passion for food, Yuksel grew up in his family's kebab shop and Elizabeth grew up in her family's greengrocer business and then trained to be a chef. They combined their shared love of food to create Turkish condiments that are authentic, 100% natural and created exactly how they make them at home.

name: The Little Blazer Company
description: Partnering timeless, distinguished tradition with free and contemporary expression of individuality, The Little Blazer Company is revolutionising the children's blazer market, as the first gender neutral British luxury kidswear label. Revered by the fashion elite from Florence to London and New York ~ we're a Multi-Award Winning Brand and proudly authentically British. Our creations are made end-to-end in London and by locally sourcing the finest cloth and championing the absolute best of British craftsmanship, we promise to consistently offer exceptional quality at a fair price. We love individuality and recognise every child's need for self-expression. We celebrate all personalities, differences and backgrounds with each vibrant piece from the collection adorned with an expression of character. Empowering our mini trailblazers with the confidence to be proudly themselves! Our heirloom garments are made to last, with a hope that each blazer supports many a story as it's lovingly passed down through generations. The Little Blazer Company® ~ The Collection ~ Colour • Character • Comfort

name: The Little House
description: Dan and Anna of The Little House are a couple who love all things food! Drawing on inspiration from around the world our chocolates are lovingly created using the very best ingredients, thoughtfully combined with the wonderful produce we find on our doorstep, here in the bountiful county of Dorset.

name: The Lucky Fox
description: Hi I'm Emma, designer/artist by trade. The Lucky Fox, is born out of my love of thrifting. The majority of pieces in my store are altered art plates. It's really special to treasure hunt some old decorative plates that have lived a whole life, pair them up with vintage images, and create brand new unique pieces. They become true one offs, which look great mixed into a wall of art. And of course I have renewed, reused and recycled to make them :)

name: The Marshmallowist
description: Hand-crafted marshmallow creations with a French, soufflé-like texture and a creative edge. Combining classic confectionery with unexpected flavours.

name: The Natural Dyeworks
description: The Natural Dyeworks was founded by Ros, a natural dyer living in the Kent countryside. We make small batch, slow crafted, hand dyed accessories and homewares using the alchemy of 100% plant based dyes, which are natural and non toxic.

name: The Oak & Rope Company
description: The Oak & Rope Company is a renowned maker of personalised oak gifts, founded by Jeanette Aurdal in 2009. Originally ignited from a joyous home-made birthday gift, the company has expanded into a globally recognised brand out of Kent, UK, offering meticulously crafted, customisable oak products, best known for their swings, all imbued with Scandinavian design principles. The team prides themselves on creating enduring heirlooms, embracing the natural beauty of oak in every piece.

name: The Olde Gingerbread House
description: The Olde Gingerbread House is located in a quiet hamlet within the Lincolnshire Wolds. All of my designing & creating is done within acres of beautiful tranquil countryside.

name: The Painted Anthology
description: A woven tapestry of hand painted words and ancient patina. A celebration of the beauty of found objects.

name: The Paper Project
description: Welcome to The Paper Project! I'm Chrissie, the creator behind these long-lasting, handcrafted crepe paper flowers. I've always been drawn to creative, hands-on work, but it wasn’t until 2019 that I discovered my true passion—paper floristry. Since then, I haven’t looked back. Each bloom is meticulously handmade, combining vibrant colour with thoughtful design to capture the essence of real flowers in paper form. Over the years, I’ve developed a unique style that brings warmth, beauty, and a touch of nature into your home—minus the wilting.

name: The Passenger Press
description: The Passenger Press is a letterpress print and design studio based in Glasgow, Scotland. Every card & design tells a story and breathes new life into images found tucked away in books and archives. The Passenger Press studio is housed in an old Victorian shopfront so we have our vintage presses and workspace at the back and sell all our products in the shop area at the front. We love traditional methods of production and enjoy the hands on methods used in slow making. We are inspired by traditional skills and practices. Each design is printed in small batches using ecologically sound paper milled in the UK.

name: The Pennant People
description: We are Emma & Sarah and we design, make and print traditional felt pennants which celebrate people, places, pop culture and positivity!The Pennant People is inspired by the traditional American felt pennants that historically celebrated US colleges and sports teams. We are bringing that tradition into the present by creating modern designs celebrating, female empowerment, small business owners, our beautiful National Parks, 80s movies, coffee and cats, to name but a few!We design, hand cut, sew and print all parts of our pennants in-house, and love creating unique pieces that act as a keepsake of a favourite place or shout out a positive motto. Our pennants are made to make you smile, make you nostalgic, and just look plain cool in your space!

name: The Pop Out Card Company
description: Thanks for popping by. We're Jonathan and Louisa, the husband and wife behind The Pop Out Card Company. What makes us tick is a desire to take everyday items and give them a special twist. Our pop out cards are a card and a small gift in one. Each has a mini card and a decoration for your friends and loved ones to pop out, slot together and treasure long after a traditional card is taken down. We design and lovingly small-batch craft them from our converted brewery studio.

name: The Primitive Home
description: The home of Big Bows. Hand crafted using beautiful linens, cottons and velvet ribbon.

name: The Printer's Devil
description: Fascinated by centuries old techniques, processes and the history of wood block printing Stephen Kenny established his Letterpress workshop in 2008 in Walthamstow. Now in its 4th location in East London’s rapidly changing Hackney Wick, ‘The Printer’s Devil’ occupies a room on the first floor of an old Peanut Factory unchanged since the artists moved in in the 1980’s. The wooden floors and original Victorian arched windows offer a glimpse into the past and a calm, bright and peaceful environment in which to print.

name: The Rusty Rag
description: Hey folks, It's Ian here and I love all things vintage but most importantly Flags. I design and make pennant flags to uplift and motivate or just create that little bit of warm nostalgia in your home or on your travels. Inspired by 1950s Americana with a touch of Irish warmth. I am passionate about classic craftsmanship. I love to use as many analog methods as I can when when making my flags. The journey of my flags begins when I hand draw the artwork and ink it onto paper first, this is then transferred to a heavy duty canvas flag that I make using my old 1960s Singer sewing machine ( I take this very seriously regards concentration and attention to detail as you can see from my profile pic lol ). I then type a personal thank you letter on my old Olivetti typewriter that I include with every order. I did say I love vintage, analog methods and classic craftsmanship so it brings me nothing but joy and happiness if I where to make a flag for you.

name: The Silicone Straw Company
description: If you hate soggy paper straws, take a look at our colourful collection of chewable, reusable, dishwasher proof silicone straws made right here in the U.K! The UK Government has now banned single-use plastic straws which is great for the environment but not so great for your drinks! So whether you only use straws occasionally or every day let these straws help you avoid any more soggy straw situations! They are perfectly simple in design and can be taken out and about with you in our handy travel tins! This company has been created by Charlotte, an engineer and mum-of-three on a mission to help families live greener, happier lives. These straws are the environmentally friendly alternative to plastic and soggy paper straws.

name: The Singing Rabbit
description: Inject good vibes into your life with this collection of toe tickling neon and brightly hued candles. Sure to dazzle and add drama into the home of the lucky recipient, they are each hand dipped individually making them uniquely yours.

name: The Smallprint Co.
description: The Smallprint Company is a traditional letterpress and design studio in Derby, Derbyshire. The heritage print shop specialises in Wedding Stationery and teaching the craft of letterpress through our workshops. We have combined our love of typography and design with our commercial experience to explore the world of traditional letterpress print, using antique presses, original metal and wooden poster type, beautiful papers and hand mixed inks.

name: The Snow Sheppard
description: Our range of sustainably made birch plywood playthings are designed to encourage creativity and open ended play. We make simple forms which have all manner of uses and interpretations. Included in our line up of modern classics are versatile and functional storage and homeware pieces for a more conscious lifestyle. Designed to be used in every room throughout the home.

name: The Stitch Geek
description: Hi I’m Clair, founder of The Stitch Geek. Needlepoint designer on a mission to make it cool again. My kits are perfect for beginners and stitchy pros. I love creating kits that are simple to do, fun and relaxing. Warning… it’s addictive!

name: The Thoughtful Potter
description: Small batch artisan stoneware pottery hand made in my log cabin studio in Somerset. I create functional pottery that feels delicious to hold in your hands. Hand thrown on Betty my pottery wheel my pots are very tactile, you can feel the artisanal making processes in each one. My work is inspired by inspiring words, my love of nature and the beautiful Somerset countryside where I live. My pottery is decorated by either imprinting flowers into the clay or free painting flowers, birds or fungi and are finished in my range of unique hand mixed glazes.

name: The Traditional Christmas Company
description: Welcome into the world of the Traditional Christmas Company! Here, we try to weave magic into every stitch, offering a range of Christmas sacks, stockings, and year-round gifts. Whether you're decking the halls or spreading joy on any occasion, our creations add that extra sparkle. From personalised stockings to whimsical sacks, we've got something special for everyone. Join us in celebrating the spirit of giving, no matter the season. Dive into our collection and let's make every moment merry and bright together!

name: The Unlikely Painter
description: I'm a sign painter and artist that works out of Glasgow. Most of my work is made on glass using Gold leaf, Precious shell, Etched Glass, Flake and Oil enamels.

name: The Unraveling
description: Hi, I'm Dominique the creator behind The Unraveling, my sustainable homeware brand. Never happier than when I'm surrounded by plants or immersed in a crochet project, I am passionately influenced by the natural world. I strive to inspire a peaceful, slow lifestyle with my designs, encouraging nature into your home in a hollistic way. Using sustainable materials, my aim is to evoke a sense of calm within our frantic day to day lives and create space for you to retreat and relax in.

name: The Vely Soapery
description: Thoughtful self-care made by hand, with nature at heart We use only pure, natural ingredients — nourishing oils, rich butters, mineral clays, and healing botanicals. Everything is crafted to be kind to your body and leave no trace behind — plastic-free, biodegradable, and rooted in simplicity. We handcraft our soaps in small batches using a cold process method, hand-cutting, stamping, and wrapping each one individually.

name: The Village Pottery
description: We're the faces and hands behind the pots! Since 2005 Jen has grown The Village Pottery into a thriving business while keeping all the charm and warmth of the small family-run venture it once began as. Along the way, friends have joined Jen in making this dream grow.

name: The Way To You
description: The Way to You is a UK-based brand specializing in handcrafted crochet flowers and lifestyle ornaments. Thoughtfully made by our artisan community and finished in our London studio, our designs blend timeless craftsmanship with botanical inspiration. We offer a poetic, sustainable alternative to fresh blooms—each piece crafted with care, creativity, and meaning.

name: The Wild Darkroom
description: Welcome to The Wild Darkroom! Nestled on the Kent Coast in Faversham, my little workshop is where creativity thrives. I’m Karen, and I’ve built this space around family, tradition, and the joy of analogue photography.

name: The Wood Cove
description: We are a small business situated in a little garden studio, consisting of only two employees, who have created a collection of fun, unique and original decor pieces and wooden toys designed for children. We pride ourselves on creating modern and playful designs which connect to nature through texture, pattern and tone. We love to give our customers as much choice as possible and have a large selection of our collection able to be customised. From picking your own paint colours to customising a wooden rainbow to match your nursery, or choosing the engraving on our toys. All of our painted pieces are painted by hand and our products are carefully packaged in eco-friendly materials (99% of our products have plastic free packaging!).

name: The Yorkshire Pasta Company
description: Hi my name is Kathryn, I am the founder of The Yorkshire Pasta Company and a proud mummy of 2, I founded The Yorkshire Pasta Company when I was only 27. I’m so proud to have started the first British Pasta brand and to have done it so sustainably. I love running the business, it has been a steep learning curve and I’ve learnt so much! I have met so many amazing people and businesses over the last 5 years. Some of my highlights so far include appearing on James Martin, making the Finals of the Great British Entrepreneur Awards and supplying Harrods. I am always blown away to hear Italians raving about our Yorkshire Pasta and hearing stories of it being sent to Italy to show family! Favourite pasta dish: A rich and decadent bolognese with ample parmesan and a very garlicky garlic bread!

name: Their Nibs
description: We create gorgeous pyjamas for special occasions such as Christmas and birthday mornings or just a rainy Tuesday evening when you want to feel cherished. Pyjamas that make thoughtful gifts for friends facing hospital stays, pyjamas that are practical for every element of our lives but also add glamour to a Sunday brunch. In short: an investment in yourself that gives you joy every single day.

name: Theodore Children
description: Heirloom handknits for little ones, to be loved, cherished and passed down for years to come.

name: Third Eye Signs
description: Third Eye Signs has been serving fresh and delicious handpainted wonders to the people of Yorkshire and beyond since 2015. With a basis in traditional signpainting and mural techniques, we utilise clashy colour palettes and catchy phrases to adorn a multitude of surfaces. Working from a studio in Leeds, Third Eye Signs have collaborated with all manner of independent and big businesses, providing an authentic and visually distinctive approach. Loved by stylists, designers and influencers, our handpainted and colourful approach is a guaranteed win.

name: This Thing Is String
description: This Thing is String is an eclectic collection of homewares, oddities and décor, all made from humble household string. Hand knitted, hand dyed, hand sculpted – it’s just me, at my old oak dining table, crafting up solutions to life’s minor plasticky problems. All my things are plastic free, made in small batches (often to order) and packaged using compostable, recycled or widely recyclable materials.

name: This Thursday
description: Hi there! I go by Tori but will pretty much answer to anything. I’ve loved drawing and creating as long as I can remember, almost as long as I’ve adored all living things on our lovely planet. It took me a while to find a way to gel the two together but as soon as I did, the rest was history. Now I aim to bring joy into people’s lives through the twinkle of a painted animal’s eye, be it through a card sent by a friend, or a piece of art hung on the wall.

name: Thread and Mischief
description: Here you’ll find curious, whimsical knitwear made to spark smiles and brighten everyday life. Each piece is handmade with joy, a dash of wonder, and a firm belief that life is far too short for dull clothing or too much seriousness.

name: Throw to Fire
description: Hi, I’m Bex, one half of Throw to Fire. We are a husband and wife team and work from our garden studio in the heart of Brighton. We design and make wheel-thrown, ceramic table and homewares inspired by contemporary Scandi-living. Our work is characterised by the use of stained clay to create our soft colour palette of greys, pinks, mauves and greens. We mix our coloured clays by hand, before throwing on the wheel.

name: Tiger and Fox
description: Hello, I'm Catherine, a designer and printmaker with a love of colour and illustration. After travelling in 2009, I fell in love with the range of letterpress prints I found around the world and soon got to teaching myself the traditional printing process when I returned to the UK. Today, my collection of printing presses, inks and wooden type has grown and I now create a range of paper goods focused on simple colour illustrations and the idea of having fun with paper.

name: Tim Walker Studio
description: A collection of original handmade ceiling pendant lights made from pigmented cement and plaster.

name: Tinker & Tallulah
description: We create lampshades that steal the spotlight. Tinker & Tallulah exists to bring joyful elegance into homes and hospitality spaces with handmade lighting defined by expressive design, meticulous craftsmanship and a bold attitude. Our signature style draws unapologetically from the opulence and glamour of the Art Deco era – a design movement that has always inspired our founders, Rach and Liam.

name: Tiny Riot
description: We are long term friends Sarah, Andrew & Natalie. We love art, we love creating, we love music and we love a kitsch mash up. We also love a Riot. But just a Tiny one. And as you can see, our collective Tiny ones keep us on our toes! With a background in animation, design and advertising, Tiny Riot enables us to release the shackles and have fun! We create artwork that is bold and beautiful, that leaves a lasting impression and that is always a talking point.

name: Toast Studios
description: In my small-batch ceramics studio in Birmingham, I specialise in creating sustainable, accessible, and expressive functional ceramics. Each piece is carefully handcrafted, focussing on minimising waste by reusing and repurposing materials from previous projects. I am a classically trained art historian with over four years of experience, who combines traditional techniques with a modern ethos. I am dedicated to making ceramics accessible to everyone and my work is deeply rooted in sustainability and queerness. Every item you discover here is thoughtfully crafted to bring both beauty and purpose to your everyday life.

name: Too Easy
description: we produce small batches of all natural margaritas in the UK. you’ll only find the usual suspects in our bottles: tequila blanco, triple sec, 100% lime juice not from concentrate, organic blue agave syrup and water. so shake, pour, drink too easy

name: Townsend Farm
description: Townsend Farm is a family business near Ledbury, Herefordshire, growing a variety of dessert and cider apples. All apples are from our orchards, we never buy in.

name: Tozer Signs
description: Hello! I'm Tozer, a traditional signwriter based in Bristol but working all over the UK. I create purely bespoke hand-painted signage for businesses big and small, as well as private commissions for everything from birthday gifts, to wedding presents, to pet tributes. I truly love what I do, and I believe it shows in every brushstroke, every twist of the wrist and every perfectly imperfect, human-made line. I can't wait to make something truly special for you!

name: Trash Prints
description: Art dedicated to the glory of the now deleted and once discarded. Our vantage is vintage and we nature nostalgia that is good for the sole.

name: Treefall
description: Hi there! I’m Manda McGrory the designer/maker behind Treefall. I create all my creatures and clothing by hand in my studio on the Isle of Wight. My inspiration for all my creatures comes from my own childhood obsessions with nature and birds, The Famous Five and the wild Dungeness coastline (where we had a family home). And in recent years by the incredible island I now call home. Life on the island has not only led to the creation of the Treefall collection of creatures and clothing but also to my obsessions with surfing, skateboarding and running. Which means that when I’m not in my studio, I can be found surfing and enjoying a meal at the beach, in my beloved camper van (Gareth), or skating at Canopy, my local skatepark.

name: Tuuli Tea
description: The Tuuli Tea story began in 2019 when Tuuli Shipster started blending bespoke herbal infusions for friends and family for everything from hangovers to heartbreak. She saw the need for a thoroughly modern herbal tea brand that addresses the ups and downs of everyday life.

name: Twig
description: Fancy adding some softness and texture to your home? Well you've come to the right place. Hello, I'm Sarah, a "plant enthusiast" with a background in forest conservation. I design and make bespoke cotton plant pots out of Bobbiny recycled cotton yarn. Go on, give your favourite plants a hug with my handmade cotton plant pot covers and brighten up your home.

name: Twinn Pottery
description: Twinn Pottery is the studio practice of Faye Twinn. I take great pride in quietly crafting small batches of simple homewares from my little garden studio. I mainly work with British pan-milled stoneware and studio blended glaze to create neutral, eco-conscious and mindfully made everyday items. The work and inspiration was born from an understanding that we need to live slower for our planet, and our well-being. Sustainability is also at the core of my practice. Suppliers are carefully selecting to ensure ethical and environmentally responsible sourcing. Prioritising the planet about anything else.

name: Typographic Dex
description: I am a London-based designer, creative director and illustrator with a couple of decades of experience across print, web and film. I have a distinct handcrafted typographic style, clever and conceptual, with themes of literature, music and film.

name: Under The Same Moon
description: Making memories and creating new traditions with loved ones sits at the heart of Under The Same Moon.We create personalised products that will last year after year and teach the new generation the magic of re-using items and the stories that come with them. From our personalised wicker baskets for those family Easter egg hunts to our motivational mugs designed to inspire and encourage, you will be find something different and unique for that special person.

name: Unseen Icons
description: When we’re asked what we do, we like to say we specialise in refurbishing vintage cinema seats, from our dedicated upholstery studio in Essex. But the truth is, what we do is so much bigger than that. Our passion is taking the unseen, neglected and forgotten and creating something truly iconic. You could say we’re rebels of sorts, we're here for the ones not afraid to do things differently. We believe that your home should uncompromisingly reflect who YOU are, so forget boring high street trends and embrace the bold.

name: Vanessa Rose Accessories
description: Timeless Accessories for YOUR everyday. We design accessories taking inspiration from our favourite style icons. Our Headbands, Scrunchies and Bags are made for you to use, wear to bring JOY to your outfits and everyday life. We choose the finest ethically sourced linens and organic cottons for our accessories and hand finish with cotton threads. Orders are sent out in organic cotton drawstring bags for gifting and storage. Handmade in the Somerset countryside each piece is unique and made just for you ~ Welcome to Vanessa Rose ~ XX

name: Verena's Kitchen
description: Discover our colourful range of all natural nut butters made from purely nourishing and luxurious ingredients. Nature has lots to offer so we explored the little treasures and created excitingly tasty and colourful products with impactful taste - and yes, without all the sugar and additives! So, come in, don't be shy and discover our range of natural & wholesome delights....

name: Vespucci Adventures
description: Vespucci Adventures was founded 8 years ago and is a trusted source for a great day's walking. Our beautifully packaged maps and guidebooks make a wonderful gift. Vespucci Signature Hikes all have a good cafe near the start, a pub towards the end, great views and interesting places to see along the way. Most are directly accessible by train and public transport. Our packs include an OS based map with the route superimposed upon it and a guidebook designed to give you everything you need to know for a great day out. Kit lists, names of pubs and cafes, hotels, taxis and descriptions of points of interest are all included. Every guidebook contains a "Plan B" if things start to go awry. The gift of a Vespucci Hike is designed to inspire family friends or colleagues, including those less confident, to get outside on a self guided country walk.

name: Vinegar & Brown Paper
description: For those that love wit, typography and a slightly askew way of looking at the world, Vinegar & Brown Paper presents his collection of etched apothecary glass bottles. Individually sandblasted, each bottle is created by artist Andy Poplar in his studio in the North of England. Featured in magazines, TV programmes and social media posts, his range of bottles can be found on the desks of writers, artists, scientists and those that revel in wordplay from York to New York.

name: Wag & Wool
description: We provide stylish and sustainable clothing for dogs, ethically made right here in the UK. Our commitment to sourcing only the best natural and recycled materials reflects our values of preserving nature and pet well-being. We believe that dogs deserve to look and feel their best while minimising their carbon pawprint. Through our thoughtful designs and slow production practices, we aim to promote a more sustainable and compassionate lifestyle for pets and their owners alike

name: We Are Here
description: We're a queer owned roastery based in a little seaside town in Kent called, Margate. We want to do our very best to provide visibility and representation within the coffee community. Wanting to create an equitable, inclusive space for all and build a business that totally and completely puts people and planet first. We think coffee needs to be a little more fun and even more friendly, so set out on creating just 4 coffees that work amazingly with the ways that coffee is brewed and enjoyed. in 2020, a very bright THIS ONE, THAT ONE, THE OTHER ONE and DECAF were born. the beans origin, how it's processed, who farmed it and so on are of course, incredibly important. To try and make this world a little bit better, we give 10p from every bag sold to the marvelous charity, Missing People UK or by choosing The Queer One it will go to glorious, Gendered Intelligence. These donations happen all year round/forever and are so important to what we and who we are.

name: Wednesday's Domaine
description: Name your favourite alcohol free wine. No? Nothing? Us neither, until now, of course. Many moons ago, alcohol free was a dirty phrase. If you were choosing not to drink, your options were limited and you probably felt slightly out of the loop. Not another lime and soda, you would silently lament as you made your way back to the bar whilst your friends were still enjoying their first round. Thankfully, times are changing.

name: Western Sketch
description: Hi I'm Melissa the illustrator and founder of boutique greeting card brand Western Sketch. I started this business back in 2017 whilst I was on maternity leave after picking up my sketchbook and paint palettes that had gathered dust over a good few years. We are a Boutique Greeting Card publisher where each greeting card starts from a sketchbook illustration, and is hand painted using watercolour paints, in a fun non traditional style.

name: Wexbaby
description: Wexbaby is a French inspired kidswear brand launched by two sisters, Ettie and Sally. Mixing their French heritage with a British upbringing, Wexbaby is a collection that is bursting with clothes that are full of personality and comical illustrations. Made from the softest fabric and designed with durability in mind, Wexbaby is a brand that you will love. A percentage of sales to The Fostering Network, a charity close to their hearts as Ettie and Sally were raised in Foster care themselves.

name: What Ted Wore
description: Hello there, I'm Lucy. Founder of What Ted Wore. We're a Bristol based fashion brand that enjoys colour and fun filled slogans. The brand started out with a small collection of kids t-shirts and sweatshirts and, with the help of social media (and some hard work), has now grown to include bags, accessories and more! With a soft spot for screen printing, embroidery and catchy slogans, I hope you love our unique designs, the kaleidoscope of colour and of course, our fave motto...Always. Carry. Snacks. Thanks for stopping by, it really means so much. Lucy x

name: When Skies Are Grey
description: Looking for cards that are good for the soulandfor the planet? As a lover of all things occasions, I hoped to replace the disposable culture of cards with designs that are intentionally timeless and can be cherished for years to come. However if they no longer wanted to be kept, they could be recycled easily and guilt-free! Each card has been hand-painted and printed by me (Maggie) with those belly laugh and dad chuckle moments in mind. Sent with love to you and yours.

name: Whistle and Woof
description: I make bespoke, ceramic Pet Bowls that can be personalised with your Pets’ names. It’s a lengthy process that requires a lot of care and attention, and I love it. The process of turning a cold lump of clay into wonderful creations, warm out of the kiln, is a special thing Ceramics wise, I also make Treat Jars and Human Mugs that can all match, so if you’re that kinda person…

name: Whole Caboodle Design
description: Welcome to The Whole Caboodle, a satisfying mix of beautifully printed stationery and delicately handwritten details

name: Wild Sage + Co
description: A Mother + Daughter run small business, we manufacture hand made soaps and natural skin care from our cottage in Herefordshire, UK. Our soaps contain no artificial colours, fragrances or chemicals, and you can be sure that everything we make is 100% cruelty free. We believe that skin care should be simple, handmade + with ingredients found in nature.

name: Wild Sea Calligraphy
description: Modern calligraphy and letterpress printing.

name: Wild Things
description: Wild Things by Kirsty Hartley make simple, happy kids play clothes & sewing patterns to inspire adventure and play. Beautifully made in the UK

name: Willow & Twigg
description: Hello! I’m Kelly, and I create silver, sea glass and gemstone jewellery from my home studio on the south coast of Hampshire. I take my inspiration from flowers, nature and the ocean when creating my designs, especially my unique and 'one of a kind' statement pieces. All my work is handmade (by me) using traditional metalsmithing tools and techniques; crafted with skill and care, and made to last a lifetime.

name: Willow Leather
description: Welcome to Willow Leather, your go-to destination for original handmade accessories crafted with love and care by yours truly, Amber Willow. As a small independent brand based in Hertfordshire, I take great pride in creating beautiful, clean-looking, and practical pieces that stand the test of time. Each item is meticulously sourced, designed, and handcrafted by me, ensuring the utmost attention to detail and quality. I have a deep appreciation for vegetable-tanned leather, as its colour matures and develops a rich patina over time, making each piece truly unique. Vegetable tanned leather is tanned using natural ingredients such as tree bark, fruits, and leaves in the tanning process, which embrace a more environmentally friendly approach to dying leather. I am also thrilled to announce the launch of my latest collection featuring stunning marbled leather pieces such as bags and smaller accessories, allowing you, my valued customer, to handpick your preferred colours and discover the joy of owning bespoke accessories that reflect your individual style.

name: Wilma & Willow
description: Wilma & Willow products are handmade by me in my studio based on the edge of the beautiful Lincolnshire Wolds.

name: Wini Tapp
description: Hello! I’m Louise Burgess, face and founder of wini-tapp. Essentially, wini-tapp is a decorative and gift brand, that sells paper based products, ranging from cut and make kits to decorative kinetic mobiles. The work is characterised by a painterly illustrative style - full of joy and fun. All products are handmade and produced in the UK and printed onto FSC certified cardstock and paper.

name: Wired Moments
description: Hi, I'm Sophie...and I make three dimensional typographic signs in the heart of Norfolk. We offer a substantial range of Halloween pumpkin decorations, Personalised Christmas Wreath signs and new to the studio are our Recycled Cotton Knit Names which are sure to add a pop of colour to any interior.

name: Wonky Picnic
description: Wonky Picnic is a celebration of the wonky everyday. Inspired by my love of food, picnics, the dinner table and foraging for fruit with my grandmother, Wonky Picnic explores the relationship between food, gatherings and shared experiences. Each piece is lovingly handmade by me, Nadia, either in ceramic or crochet. With each piece I seek to distil the ephemeral joy of fruit at its perfect ripeness.

name: Wordplay Clay
description: Tableware with a turn of phrase. The fun heirlooms of the future.

name: Wycombe Chef's Table
description: Farewell Notice Dear Spice Lovers, 💛 After much thought, we’ve made the difficult decision to close Wycombe Chefs Table, as our family is relocating abroad. Our final day of trading will be 1st November 2025. Until then, stock is available — so if you’d like to enjoy our blends and gift boxes one last time, now is the moment. We are so grateful to have been part of this community and to everyone who has supported our small business along the way. Thank you for being part of our journey. 🌿✨ With love, Jules&Ghani from Wycombe Chefs Table

name: Yael Rosenberg Ceramics
description: Yael is a designer, primarily dedicated to creating ceramic objects, with a particular fascination for working with porcelain and appreciating its distinct characteristics. She explores the relationship between people and the objects that surround them, emphasizing the emotional value of handmade pieces and recognizing their significance in our lives.

name: You've Got Pen On Your Face
description: We’re Frankie and Tom AKAYou’ve Got Pen On Your Face.Since 2016, we’ve spent an unhealthy amount of time thinking up rollicking puns and witty one-liners for the front of our cards. Our rallying cry is simple: greetings cards may be frivolous, but they don’t have to be forgettable. Make an impact. Send something memorable. Our cards and gift wrap reflect the authenticity of our lives, capturing the real stories, laughter, and love that make each day a unique adventure.

name: Yr Hen Gof Forge
description: Jamie is an Artisan Blacksmith. He has a real love and enthusiasm for the traditional countryside crafts. As a practicing Farrier, Jamie has been working with metal for 18 years. Alongside his wife Emma, they love creating beautiful bespoke gifts and traditional pieces for you and your home.

name: ZIG+STAR
description: I'm Ali and welcome to ZIG+STAR! "Let's Give Growing Feet a Smaller Footprint" As a mum of 3, I always felt it was a compromise buying kids shoes... it was choice between style OR fit, with no sustainable options in sight. So with over 20 years experience in developing footwear for top high street brands, I decided to create the product I wanted to buy for my own kids... Sustainably designed, Podiatrist Approved, Unisex footwear that would last longer and reduce waste. In collaboration with a Paediatric Podiatrist we created an innovative removable midsole that adds half a size to the fitting of the shoe, lasting up to 6 months longer. We select all materials for durability and biodegradable-friendly. Our designs are cool classics that do not date and can be passed down from brother to sister. And when you've finished with them, we offer free donation and recycling services. Everything we do supports our mission to ensure "No ZIG+STARs to ever end in landfill"

name: Zoe Sherwood
description: ‘I am one of many, I am one of few, I am an individual, just like you.’ I believe in embracing who you are & what you stand for. I am an artist who through my pieces empowers & tells stories, I call them my Wearable Reminders. 'Me' (meaning the wearer) is the starting point, goes on adventures meeting a ‘You’, finding ‘You&Me’, ‘Love’, ‘Peace’, ‘Hope’ and now I want to ‘Save’ our ‘Earth’. Join ‘Me’!

name: Zoe's Clay
description: Welcome to Zoe’s Clay. I design and make everything by hand in a home studio, creating small-batch stoneware pieces that are as practical as they are playful. From mugs to match pots, you’ll find ceramics made to be used, enjoyed, and loved every day, each bringing a little handmade charm to your home. I love the challenge of making ceramics that feel good in your hands and bring a smile to everyday rituals. From hand-thrown to handbuilt, every piece is one of a kind, crafted to brighten your daily routine.

name: Zuri House
description: Welcome to Zuri House studio! We are passionate about knitting and crocheting. We turn this passion into eco-friendly home décor, inspired by Scandinavian and boho design. We create for both adults and little ones. Our products would add warmth and cosiness to any living space. From adorable baskets to comfortable bean bags - we have something for everyone. Embrace sustainability and support local business by choosing our handcrafted high-quality, eco-conscious creations.
